finding: The common intronic variant rs8192675 in SLC2A2 was associated with the glycaemic response to metformin, indicating its potential relevance in T2D management.
title: Weighted burden analysis in 200,000 exome-sequenced subjects characterises rare variant effects on risk of type 2 diabetes

finding: This SNP was reported as associated with both dyslexia and ADHD in previous studies, establishing a notable link between the genetic predisposition to these two conditions. It was identified among the six loci previously reported for dyslexia and was also significant in the ADHD GWAS, underlining its importance in the genetic correlation between these neurodevelopmental conditions.
title: Genetic neurodevelopmental clustering and dyslexia

finding: The SNP rs6764623 was included as a causal SNP in the GWAS analysis, exhibiting an effect size of β=0.01.
title: A High-resolution Haplotype-resolved Reference Panel Constructed from the China Kadoorie Biobank Study

finding: The sentinel variant rs4686373 was linked to short-term varenicline effectiveness (SVE) and was pointed out for its potential biological relevance in the study.
title: Genome-wide association study of varenicline-aided smoking cessation

finding: The locus indexed by rs3836464 showed an association with active-to-sedentary transition probability (ASTP), representing a novel finding related to physical activity behavior.
title: Genome-wide association studies of 27 accelerometry-derived physical activity measurements identifies novel loci and genetic mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs9818758 was linked to relative amplitude, a proxy for sleep behavior and circadian rhythm, marking a new association in the context of physical activity.
title: Genome-wide association studies of 27 accelerometry-derived physical activity measurements identifies novel loci and genetic mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs6806825 located in MECOM indicated significant age-dependent variation in its effect on lung function, confirmed by its P value of less than 5.14×10^-5.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The SNP rs114108468 was identified as a novel variant influencing \\u0394THR in the genome-wide linkage scan. It was associated with higher \\u0394THR (\\u03B2=1.965; p=5.68e-6) and was found to be an eQTL for the genes EIF4A2 and ADIPOQ, implicating their roles in relation to \\u0394THR.
title: Novel Loci (EIF4A2, ADIPOQ, TPRG1) for Triglyceride / High-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol Ratio Longitudinal Change (ΔTHR) among Subjects without Type 2 Diabetes: Evidence from the Long Life Family Study (LLFS) and the Framingham Heart Study (FHS) Offspring Cohort (OS)

finding: The SNP rs16864075 was also discovered as a significant variant at the 3q28 locus that increased \\u0394THR (\\u03B2=0.85; p=1.10e-6). However, it was not associated with the transcription levels of TPRG1.
title: Novel Loci (EIF4A2, ADIPOQ, TPRG1) for Triglyceride / High-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol Ratio Longitudinal Change (ΔTHR) among Subjects without Type 2 Diabetes: Evidence from the Long Life Family Study (LLFS) and the Framingham Heart Study (FHS) Offspring Cohort (OS)

finding: The SNP rs1516725, located in the DGKG region, was associated with obesity in the GWAS catalog and showed a strong association with the volume of grey matter in the right ventral striatum (p < 10^-26). Additionally, it was linked to the mean volume of the hippocampus in ENIGMA2 summary statistics (p < 9 × 10^-4). These brain regions are connected to reward processing and motivation, which are implicated in obesity.
title: A Multimodal Foundation Model for Discovering Genetic Associations with Brain Imaging Phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs993137 was identified as strongly associated with ADHD and paired with the volume of grey matter in the left amygdala (p < 3 × 10^-11). It also associated with the mean volume of the inferior temporal cortex in ENIGMA2, a region tied to behavioral inhibition and ADHD, indicating significant connections between genetic markers and specific brain structures.
title: A Multimodal Foundation Model for Discovering Genetic Associations with Brain Imaging Phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs17753641 showed significant association with IL-12p70 production as measured after 22 hours of LPS stimulation. Donors with the homozygous major allele had a higher proportion of IL-12p70 low responders, indicating its role in modulating IL-12p70 levels.
title: Early IFNβ secretion determines variable downstream IL-12p70 responses upon TLR4 activation in health and disease

finding: SNP rs17809756 was found to be significantly associated with IL-12p70 levels in the context of LPS stimulation, following a pattern where homozygous major allele carriers exhibited a greater proportion of low IL-12p70 responders.
title: Early IFNβ secretion determines variable downstream IL-12p70 responses upon TLR4 activation in health and disease

finding: The SNP rs17810546 was significantly linked to IL-12p70 production after LPS stimulation, with individuals carrying the homozygous major allele displaying a higher prevalence of low IL-12p70 responses.
title: Early IFNβ secretion determines variable downstream IL-12p70 responses upon TLR4 activation in health and disease

finding: Significant associations were observed for SNP rs76830965 with IL-12p70 levels, supporting its involvement where homozygous major allele carriers were more likely to be low responders, affecting IL-12p70 secretion.
title: Early IFNβ secretion determines variable downstream IL-12p70 responses upon TLR4 activation in health and disease

finding: The SNP rs143060887 demonstrated a significant association with IL-12p70 levels after LPS stimulation, where individuals with the homozygous major allele showed an increased likelihood of being IL-12p70 low responders.
title: Early IFNβ secretion determines variable downstream IL-12p70 responses upon TLR4 activation in health and disease

finding: The novel variant rs562545 in the MOBP gene was found to be associated with diastolic blood pressure in a large meta-analysis of African ancestry, reflecting unique genetic associations pertinent to hypertension in African-derived populations.
title: Genomic Exploration of Essential Hypertension in African-Brazilian Quilombo Populations: A Comprehensive Approach with Pedigree Analysis and Family-Based Association Studies

finding: The SNP rs9834970 on chromosome 3q12.1 was previously associated with lithium response and demonstrated a significant correlation in the context of mania within bipolar disorder.
title: Isolating the genetic component of mania in bipolar disorder

finding: The variant rs17036160 located near PPARG was involved in the Lipodystrophy cluster, indicating its target role in promoting insulin sensitivity through thiazolidinediones.
title: Multi-ancestry Polygenic Mechanisms of Type 2 Diabetes Elucidate Disease Processes and Clinical Heterogeneity

finding: The SNP rs13059102 was associated with obesity via its nearest gene BCHE, which encodes butyrylcholinesterase affecting the ghrelin pathway.
title: The genetic architecture of changes in adiposity during adulthood

finding: The rs35055419 variant showed a significant association with p-tau and t-tau levels, contributing to the understanding of tau pathology associated with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of CSF biomarkers in Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease cohorts

finding: The rs9877502 variant at the 3q28 locus between GEMC1 and OSTN was previously identified to be associated with higher CSF tau levels, reinforcing its significance as a genetic risk factor in Alzheimer's disease.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of CSF biomarkers in Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease cohorts

finding: MultiSuSiE fine-mapped rs4894803 at the FNDC3B locus for resting heart rate. It was not fine-mapped in any of the analyzed cohorts due to low minor allele frequency and high LD in the European populations. It is a conserved variant previously associated with resting heart rate in GWAS.
title: MultiSuSiE improves multi-ancestry fine-mapping in All of Us whole-genome sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs9876658 distally regulated AMOTL2 expression in SMCs, with targeted CRISPR interference confirming its role as a regulator of AMOTL2, further implicating it as a candidate variant influencing CAD.
title: Single cell variant to enhancer to gene map for coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs1376606, located in an intergenic region near the OSBPL10 gene on chromosome 3p23, was associated with a decreased PRU value. The evidence indicated a statistically significant delta with a beta coefficient (β) of -31.38, a confidence interval of -43.66 to -19.09, and a p-value of 7.75×10^-7. This finding was contextualized within the framework of dyslipidemia's impact on high on-treatment platelet reactivity (HTPR) in clopidogrel-treated patients.
title: Discovery of Ancestry-specific Variants Associated with Clopidogrel Response among Caribbean Hispanics

finding: The SNP rs12495172 located in intron 12-13 of ERC2 was identified as significantly associated with aneuploidy rates. The finding suggested that the alternative allele of rs12495172 was positively correlated with increased aneuploidy rates in embryos, indicating that it may influence the risk of maternal meiotic aneuploidy. Further analysis showed that this SNP was linked to decreased expression of the nearby gene CCDC66, a candidate gene involved in chromosome segregation during meiosis.
title: Identifying risk genes for embryo aneuploidy using ultra-low coverage whole-genome sequencing

finding: The rs1316356 variant, identified as a risk variant for Alzheimer's disease in linkage disequilibrium with SNP rs9877502, was also noted for its association with tau levels.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of CSF biomarkers in Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease cohorts

finding: Linking to <italic>ST6GAL1</italic>, this variant contributed significantly to PSA variations and holds prospects for research in prostate health.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Evidence indicated that rs2268491 showed genotype-dependent effects of oxytocin treatment, where CC carriers demonstrated greater improvements in SRS-2 scores and changes in oxytocin concentrations compared to T+ carriers. This SNP was initially associated with autism in meta-analysis.
title: Infrequent intranasal oxytocin followed by positive social interaction improves symptoms in autistic children: a randomized clinical trial

finding: Associations revealed that the BFP increasing allele at rs62271373 correlated with reduced T2D risk, higher HDL, and lower TG, pointing towards its protective role in metabolic health.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs1491985, located within the RNF123 gene, was associated with chronic widespread musculoskeletal pain (CWP) and replicated in a meta-analysis with a p-value of 0.0002, indicating a significant finding related to CWP.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies RNF123 locus as associated with chronic widespread musculoskeletal pain

finding: The SNP rs10490825 within the ATP2C1 gene showed suggestive association with CWP (p=0.0227) and had a consistent direction of effect in 5 of the 6 independent replication cohorts.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies RNF123 locus as associated with chronic widespread musculoskeletal pain

finding: The SNP rs17806888, mapped to SUCLG2, was part of an epistatic interaction with rs924135 that explained approximately 32% of the variance between bioenergetic clusters 2 and 3, emphasizing its role in influencing cognitive decline through succinylcarnitine metabolism.
title: Individual bioenergetic capacity as a potential source of resilience to Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The BP allele of rs843355 was associated with decreased expression of PSMD2 in various immune cells, including blood neutrophils CD16+ (P = 1.38×10^-6) and blood monocytes (P = 1.79×10^-6). This SNP contributes to the pathway involving NRF2 degradation.
title: Pathway-based polygenic score analysis identifies the NRF2-KEAP1 and mRNA splicing - minor pathways as enriched in shared genetic variation between chronotype and bipolar disorder

finding: The BP allele of rs62287507 was associated with increased expression of POLR2H in blood (P = 2.33×10^-6).
title: Pathway-based polygenic score analysis identifies the NRF2-KEAP1 and mRNA splicing - minor pathways as enriched in shared genetic variation between chronotype and bipolar disorder

finding: The SNP rs6441930 was associated with reduced IL-6 production following influenza stimulation of PBMCs. This SNP illustrated that risk alleles were linked to lower cytokine responses, further reinforcing the hypothesis that these alleles compromise the innate immune response in individuals at risk for severe COVID-19.
title: A functional genomics approach to understand host genetic regulation of COVID-19 severity

finding: associated with TCTA, contributing insights into the mechanisms underlying addiction risk.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: this SNP was among the significant signals for cannabis use disorder, highlighting crucial genetic factors.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: mapped to CADM2, indicating its previous implications in substance use disorder genetics.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The SNP rs2120789 was marked as influential with nearly one-fifth of ASD individuals carrying the ASD-SV in the KALRN gene, associated with altered dendritic density linked to ASD.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The SNP rs4856257 marked ASD cases connected to ROBO1, indicating its involvement in the axon guidance mechanisms critical for ASD.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The SNP rs687813 was linked to ROBO2, found in 19% of cases, highlighting its role in the axon guidance system that is disrupted in ASD.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: At rs17011282, the association with PP shown through significant STST interaction was confirmed (P_GxE=5.9×10^-7), related to the ZNF385D gene.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: In analyzing long sleep interactions, rs138288695 linked to CRBN was shown to significantly affect DBP (P_GxE=3.5×10^-7).
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: At rs142966182, linked to ALCAM, significant association for DBP interaction was reported with P_GxE=1.0×10^-7.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: This SNP was identified in a meta-analytic GWAS for Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) using Family Genetic Risk Scores (PA-FGRS). It showed a beta of 0.014 and a p-value of 2.9 × 10^-8, demonstrating its significant contribution to genetic risk associated with MDD.
title: PA-FGRS is a novel estimator of pedigree-based genetic liability that complements genotype-based inferences into the genetic architecture of major depressive disorder

finding: Identified as significant in the GWAS for MDD case-control status, this SNP showed a beta of 0.085 and a p-value of 7.1 × 10^-9, underlining its importance in differentiating between MDD cases and controls.
title: PA-FGRS is a novel estimator of pedigree-based genetic liability that complements genotype-based inferences into the genetic architecture of major depressive disorder

finding: The study found that carriers of the risk allele (C) at rs10490770 experienced a significantly increased risk of all-cause mortality (hazard ratio [HR] 1.4, 95% confidence interval [CI] 1.2-1.6) and COVID-19 related mortality (HR 1.5, 95% CI 1.3-1.8). Furthermore, risk allele carriers had higher odds for severe COVID-19 complications including severe respiratory failure (odds ratio [OR] 2.0, 95% CI 1.6-2.6), venous thromboembolism (OR 1.7, 95% CI 1.2-2.4), and hepatic injury (OR 1.6, 95% CI 1.2-2.0). Notably, in individuals aged ≤ 60 years, the odds of death or severe respiratory failure were even higher at OR 2.6 (95% CI 1.8-3.9) compared to those aged > 60 years (OR 1.5, 95% CI 1.3-1.9), indicating an interaction where younger risk allele carriers faced greater risks. Additionally, the prediction of death and severe respiratory failure was enhanced with the inclusion of this genetic risk factor, displaying an area under the curve (AUC) of 0.84 compared to non-genetic factors.
title: Age-dependent impact of the major common genetic risk factor for COVID-19 on severity and mortality

finding: The SNP rs6783485 located at LOC105377110 was found to be among the top 20 associated variables for 'fast' progression in Parkinson's disease (PD). It was associated with a significant increase in the risk of faster PD progression.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: The SNP rs11711441 located at chromosome 3:183103487 was included among the top 20 SNPs associated with 'fast' PD progression, with its non-reference allele indicating an increased risk of more rapid progression.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: The SNP rs7617877, linked to LINC00693, was recognized as one of the SNPs associated with 'moderate' PD progression, indicating a role in disease progression patterns.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: The SNP rs310755 was also shared between hypothyroidism and TSH levels, supporting its relevance in thyroid-related conditions.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: The SNP rs376613564 corresponded to a single-nucleotide polymorphism c.547G>A in RBSN, which resulted in a Glycine to Arginine substitution at position 183 in the FYVE domain of the RBSN protein. This variant was confirmed to segregate completely with the disease in a family with a unique phenotype characterized by progressive muscle weakness, facial dysmorphisms, ophthalmoplegia, and intellectual disability. The mutation was deemed deleterious or damaging by pathogenicity prediction programs, and it was identified only once in the heterozygous state in the GnomAD database with a frequency less than 1e-5.
title: RABENOSYN separation-of-function mutations uncouple endosomal recycling from lysosomal degradation

finding: The SNP rs745678941 was associated with a homozygous variant c.538C>G in RBSN, leading to a p.Arg180Gly substitution within the PI3P-binding domain of the protein. This variant segregated recessively with the disease in an unrelated family with overlapping symptoms of developmental delay, intellectual disability, distal motor axonal neuropathy, and facial dysmorphism. Like the previous SNP, this mutation was seen only once in GnomAD, with a frequency less than 1e-5.
title: RABENOSYN separation-of-function mutations uncouple endosomal recycling from lysosomal degradation

finding: The SNP rs6774202, linked to endometriosis, was found as an eQTL for various overlapping genes that participate in pathways enriched for associations between endometriosis and other immune diseases.
title: The Association between Endometriosis and Immunological diseases

finding: The SNP rs6809879, related to osteoarthritis, was also identified as an eQTL for overlapping genes, reinforcing the genetic links between endometriosis and multiple immunological diseases.
title: The Association between Endometriosis and Immunological diseases

finding: This SNP was associated with prostate-specific antigen (PSA) levels in individuals of both European ancestry (β=0.0180, p=2.6e-10) and African ancestry (β=0.0237, p=4.9e-8), marking it as a significant finding in both cohorts.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: The SNP rs4402960 in IGF2BP2 was associated with T2D in males only, suggesting male-specific genetic risk factors for T2D.
title: Sex-specific genetic loci linked to early and late onset type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs341988 was previously identified as insignificant for type 1 diabetes in traditional GWAS (<italic>β</italic> = −0.0009, s.e. = 0.0007, <italic>P</italic> = 0.17). However, in the context of inverse probability weighted GWAS (WGWAS), it was found to be genomewide significant (<italic>β</italic> = −0.004, s.e. = 0.0007, <italic>P</italic> = 1.26 · 10<sup><italic>−</italic>8</sup>). The significant difference in point estimates between GWAS and WGWAS was confirmed (<italic>P</italic><sub><italic>H</italic></sub> = 4.05 · 10<sup><italic>−</italic>24</sup>). This indicated that selection bias led to attenuation bias, resulting in the missing of several significant loci for type 1 diabetes.
title: Correcting for volunteer bias in GWAS uncovers novel genetic variants and increases heritability estimates

finding: This SNP was identified among the 58 significant loci associated with major anxiety disorders and demonstrated pleiotropic associations with cardiometabolic and hematological traits.
title: Genome-wide association study of major anxiety disorders in 122,341 European-ancestry cases identifies 58 loci and highlights GABAergic signaling

finding: rs79439102 within <italic>LSAMP</italic> was replicated in both the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children and Genes, Reading and Dyslexia cohorts, indicating its association with reading ability.
title: Genetic and Demographic Predictors of Latent Reading Ability in Two Cohorts

finding: This SNP mapped to the SLC6A11 gene and was strongly associated with ME/CFS. It was replicated in the Verbal Interview cohort, indicating its relevance to this disease.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for ME/CFS Identified using Combinatorial Analysis

finding: The SNP rs1768208 in the MOBP gene demonstrated protective effects against PSP, with an odds ratio of 0.76 and a p-value of 2.49·10^-04, supporting previous findings regarding PSP susceptibility.
title: A Novel Susceptibility Locus in NFASC Highlights Oligodendrocytes and Myelination in Progressive Supranuclear Palsy Pathology

finding: The SNP rs9836522 was associated with PM2.5 sensitivity and demonstrated an odds ratio of 0.75. Validation through the All of Us program showed significant differences in AAP concentrations consistent with the primary study results. This SNP was connected with the gene PFN2, where its expression negatively correlates with asthma and is involved in key signaling pathways related to lung diseases.
title: GWAS reveals Genetic Susceptibility to Air Pollution-Related Asthma Exacerbations in Children of African Ancestry

finding: The SNP rs1467913 located within the CACNA2D2 locus was newly recognized as significant for its association with coffee consumption.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The minor C-allele of SNP rs9838739 exerted risk on SS susceptibility by decreasing DNA methylation levels at the intergenic region within the CCR cluster in chromosome 3. This association highlighted the SNP's potential contribution to the pathogenesis of SS through altered gene regulation.
title: An integrative multi-omics approach in Sjögren’s Syndrome identifies novel genetic drivers with regulatory function and disease-specificity

finding: In SS patients, PLSCR1 expression increased with the dose of the minor A-allele of rs56077428, indicating a genetic variant that positively affected this gene's expression in the autoimmune disorder.
title: An integrative multi-omics approach in Sjögren’s Syndrome identifies novel genetic drivers with regulatory function and disease-specificity

finding: The variant rs9873183 was associated with RNF123 expression and was in linkage disequilibrium with significant SNPs related to both endometriosis and IBS.
title: Evidence of shared genetic factors in the aetiology of gastrointestinal disorders and endometriosis and clinical implications for disease management

finding: The SNP rs13092179 was associated with the Surface-Enhanced Raman Scattering (SERS) spectroscopy in the context of cancer diagnosis. This finding was significant for the sensing and characterization of exosomes in cancer, indicating a role in the detection and analysis of biomarkers related to malignancies.
title: Applications of Data Characteristic AI-assisted Raman Spectroscopy in Pathological Classification

finding: The variant rs1818163 at the HTR1F locus was significantly associated with sleep apnea in non-obese individuals (BMI < 30), with a beta of 0.059 and a P-value of < 1.58e-8 in FinnGen. This association was replicated in the Estonian Biobank (beta = 0.042, se = 0.021, P = 0.046). Additionally, it was found that rs1818163 was related to an increased risk for OSA while correlating with lower BMI (P = 4.6e-5, beta = -0.0084). In functional analysis, the regulatory role of rs1818163 on HTR1F expression was confirmed particularly in neurons, supported by eQTL data with a finding of beta = -0.030 (P = 1.2e-4). Furthermore, it was associated with a higher number of awakenings during the night (P = 5.6e-8).
title: Regulatory variation at serotonin receptor 1F (HTR1F) modulates arousals and risk for sleep apnea

finding: The mutation c.5857C>T (rs150312701; NM_199420 p.Arg1953X) in the POLQ gene was identified as a heterozygous stop-gain mutation strongly associated with hereditary colorectal adenomas and early-onset colorectal cancer (CRC). This mutation showed co-segregation with disease status in multiple CRC pedigrees and was characterized as having a significant deleterious effect (CADD score = 42). It was previously reported in CRC organoid cultures and astrocytic tumors, although those were documented as somatic mutations rather than germline.
title: A germline heterozygous POLQ nonsense mutation causes hereditary colorectal cancer

finding: SNP rs116643249 was found to be significantly associated with ITR, with a p-value of 5.93x10^-6. Situated near the CCDC54 gene, it underscores the role of genetic background in antidepressant response variability.
title: Genomic predictors of response to antidepressants in Major depressive disorder (MDD): A GWAS-Based Study on Indian cohort

finding: Associated with mitral valve prolapse, this variant was predicted to create an SP-like motif and regulate LMCD1, a transcription factor whose knockdown in zebrafish resulted in atrioventricular valve regurgitation, linking it to important valve development pathways.
title: Molecular convergence of risk variants for congenital heart defects leveraging a regulatory map of the human fetal heart

finding: The rs9875219 variant on chromosome 3q13.32 was linked to a previously identified bone development GWAS, achieving significant association for recurrent miscarriage (P=2.6e-08, OR=1.043).
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: The SNP rs13092151 was associated with the ATRX alteration, which contributed to tumor growth and immune escape in pleomorphic sarcomas. This finding highlighted the role of ATRX in oncogenesis and its broader implications in cancer biology, particularly in relation to tumor microbiology and therapeutic responses.
title: Alpha thalassemia/mental retardation X-linked (ATRX) protein expression in human pituitary neuroendocrine tumours and its reported correlation to prognosis and clinical outcomes: A systematic review

finding: The lead variant rs1991431 in <italic>ZBTB38</italic> was positively associated with hyperplasia of prostate (BHP) in the FinnGen data. Additionally, other variants in the same locus were linked to complex traits such as cell counts of lymphocytes and monocytes, highlighting biological relevance.
title: Meta-analysis of gestational duration and spontaneous preterm birth identifies new maternal risk loci

finding: The T allele of variant rs9846396 was associated with longer gestational duration (Z-score = 6.36, p = 2.04e−10) and was also linked to taller height, higher body mass measures, and an increased risk of prostate cancer, indicating its significant influence on multiple traits.
title: Meta-analysis of gestational duration and spontaneous preterm birth identifies new maternal risk loci

finding: At the SMC4 locus, rs11718121 was associated with increased mutation count specifically in females, highlighting a sex-specific impact of genetic variation on mutation burden.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: The variant rs445676, located within the TLR9 gene, exhibited the highest positive effect associated with TIMP2 protein levels. This finding contributed to the understanding of TIMP2's role in enhancing cognitive performance and memory in humans, demonstrating a significant association in global cognition and memory assessment, particularly in at-risk populations for age-related cognitive decline.
title: Polygenic proxies of age-related plasma protein levels reveal TIMP2 role in cognitive performance

finding: The SNP rs4857906 was identified in the eRNA region of the GATA2 gene and exhibited the highest posterior probability of being a causal SNP for prostate cancer.
title: Enhancer RNA transcriptome-wide association study reveals an atlas of pan-cancer susceptibility eRNAs

finding: The SNP rs10428132 in <italic>SCN10A</italic> showed that 8 out of 15 affected family members were homozygous for the risk allele, suggesting its potential role in increasing susceptibility to BrS within the family cohort.
title: Additional Evidence Implicating GPD1L in the Pathogenesis of Brugada Syndrome in A Large Multi-generational Family

finding: The SNP rs11708996 in <italic>SCN5A</italic> was found to be heterozygous in 12 out of 15 affected subjects, indicating its association with BrS risk in this family.
title: Additional Evidence Implicating GPD1L in the Pathogenesis of Brugada Syndrome in A Large Multi-generational Family

finding: The variant rs832190 was nominated as a candidate causal variant associated with schizophrenia (SZ), bipolar disorder (BD), and sitting height, as identified through joint statistical fine-mapping of eQTL and GWAS data for THOC7.
title: Trans-ethnic eQTL meta-analysis of human brain reveals regulatory architecture and candidate causal variants for brain-related traits

finding: The lead variant rs73064425 in the 3p21.31 locus was confirmed as one of the strongest susceptibility loci associated with severe COVID-19, showing a significant odds ratio of 3.2 in the ODYSSEY cohort. This variant was associated with high linkage disequilibrium with other variants in the region, which encompasses multiple genes, including FYCO1, and was replicated by multiple consortia, reinforcing its impact on disease severity.
title: Role of FYVE and Coiled-Coil Domain Autophagy Adaptor 1 in severity of COVID-19 infection

finding: The variant rs33910087 was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for CXCR6 and significantly modified monocyte percentages in COVID-19 patients, demonstrating strong linkage disequilibrium with other variants in the region. Its strong association highlighted its role within the 3p21.31 locus in modulating immune response during SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Role of FYVE and Coiled-Coil Domain Autophagy Adaptor 1 in severity of COVID-19 infection

finding: Identified in the discovery analysis with a P value less than 1.0 x 10^(-6), rs1561072 was associated with any TP53 mutation and GOF TP53 mutations.
title: Association of ESR1 germline variants with TP53 somatic variants in breast tumors in a genome-wide study

finding: The SNP rs34567530 was part of a novel replicated locus at 3q13.33 linked to genes such as SLC15A2, finding relevance in traits associated with neurodevelopment or neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Genome-wide analysis of brain age identifies 25 associated loci and unveils relationships with mental and physical health

finding: The variant rs893363 was identified in the stepwise conditional analysis and showed significant differences in allele frequency between East Asians (96.2%) and Europeans (61.9%) in non-ischemic heart failure (NIHF) cases.
title: Genome-wide analysis of heart failure yields insights into disease heterogeneity and enables prognostic prediction in the Japanese population

finding: The variant rs35593046, located intronically within <italic>CACNA1D</italic>, exhibited a protective role against high blood pressure and was found at a higher frequency among East Asians (53.8%) compared to Europeans (26.8%).
title: Genome-wide analysis of heart failure yields insights into disease heterogeneity and enables prognostic prediction in the Japanese population

finding: This missense variant found in <italic>CAND2</italic> was observed in high linkage disequilibrium with other missense variants and linked to mTOR signaling pathways affecting cardiac remodeling.
title: Genome-wide analysis of heart failure yields insights into disease heterogeneity and enables prognostic prediction in the Japanese population

finding: Also related to <italic>CAND2</italic>, this missense variant was noted in the multi-trait GWAS analysis but required further investigation to establish its causal role.
title: Genome-wide analysis of heart failure yields insights into disease heterogeneity and enables prognostic prediction in the Japanese population

finding: Another missense variant in <italic>CAND2</italic>, contributing to the genetic risk for HF and being strongly linked to cardiac remodeling pathways.
title: Genome-wide analysis of heart failure yields insights into disease heterogeneity and enables prognostic prediction in the Japanese population

finding: Identified as a missense variant in <italic>CAND2</italic>, contributing to the genetic analysis of heart failure, and requiring further research for causal attribution.
title: Genome-wide analysis of heart failure yields insights into disease heterogeneity and enables prognostic prediction in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs73062389 located in the SLC6A20 gene at the chr3p21.31 locus revealed a strong association with SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility in the European ancestry population (P = 2.315 × 10-12). This finding indicated that this locus may play a significant role in modulating susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Genetic risk factors associated with SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility in multiethnic populations

finding: The rs73062394 SNP found in the LZTFL1 gene on chromosome 3 was associated with SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility within the European cohort (P = 4.401 × 10-11). This locus had previously been implicated in other studies, suggesting its relevance in the response to SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Genetic risk factors associated with SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility in multiethnic populations

finding: The SNP rs6762208 in SENP2 was linked to increased risk of insulin resistance (IR), showing a significant association under the dominant model. The A/C-C/C genotypes had an OR of 3.11 (95% CI 1.55-6.24; p < 0.0013), highlighting its role in IR susceptibility.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Insulin Resistance Risk in Normal BMI Indians

finding: The SNP rs4434138, located in the STAB1 gene, was shared between anxiety and major depression (MDD), highlighting its relevance in the genetic overlap between these psychiatric phenotypes.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The variant rs10935473 (C>A) on chromosome 3 was identified as a trans-pQTL impacting VEGF-R3 levels, with the A allele being associated with decreased VEGF-R3 plasma levels, corroborating previous studies on its role in other patient populations.
title: Common variation in a long non-coding RNA gene modulates variation of circulating TGF-β2 levels in metastatic colorectal cancer patients (Alliance)

finding: Intronic variant rs3804622 (G>A) within CPOX exhibited a significant association as a trans-pQTL for VEGF-R3, with a P-value less than 5.7e-23, contributing to the overarching associations with VEGF protein levels.
title: Common variation in a long non-coding RNA gene modulates variation of circulating TGF-β2 levels in metastatic colorectal cancer patients (Alliance)

finding: The intronic variant rs844159 (A>G) in ST3GAL6-AS1 was also identified as a trans-pQTL for VEGF-R3, with a strong association demonstrated through a P-value less than 1.1e-19.
title: Common variation in a long non-coding RNA gene modulates variation of circulating TGF-β2 levels in metastatic colorectal cancer patients (Alliance)

finding: The study confirmed that rs13100262, associated previously with SARS-CoV-2 infection related to earlier variants, was identified again as significant in relation to Omicron variants.
title: Central role of glycosylation processes in human genetic susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infections with Omicron variants

finding: The SNP was identified as the strongest signal, significantly associated with reduced risk for Omicron infection (OR 0.857), and had previously been associated with influenza infection outcomes.
title: Central role of glycosylation processes in human genetic susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infections with Omicron variants

finding: The rs116421102 SNP in CHL1 was significantly linked to mortality risk (HR = 1.3, p = 2.5 x 10^-5).
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: The SNP rs121912698 was identified as a top pQTL site for protein aminoacylase 1, which was studied for its causal effects on plasma levels of N-acetylvaline, N-acetylglutamate, and N-acetylmethionine. This analysis specifically evaluated its risk association with type 2 diabetes in a cohort of 35,559 Icelanders and through the Mendelian randomization approach using both METSIM and FinnGen datasets.
title: Metabolome-wide Mendelian randomization characterizes heterogeneous and shared causal effects of metabolites on human health

finding: The SNP rs1046956, associated with the gene SEMA3F, demonstrated a robust connection to chronic pain risk, with evidence indicating that increased expression of SEMA3F correlated with heightened risk of chronic pain. This finding was significant due to coding variant evidence (Leu503Met) and a strong P-value (1.4 × 10−13), implicating the gene's role in axon guidance, which is crucial for sensory afferent pathfinding in the spinal cord.
title: GWAS of Extended Prescription Analgesic Use Identifies Novel Genetic Loci in Chronic Pain

finding: This variant in SLC25A26 was associated with the metabolite 2,3-dihydroxy-5-methylthio-4-pentenoate (DMTPA).
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: This SNP was identified as having the highest number of associations (378 traits) with impulsivity and risky behaviors in a multi-ancestral cohort, notably within the gene CADM2.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: This SNP was replicated with significant association (p=2.10E-09) near the CADM2 gene, previously linked to impulsivity.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: This SNP was identified as significant (p=3.20E-11) near CADM2, reinforcing the link to impulsivity.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: rs7617877 was identified as a key variant linked to Parkinson's disease (PD) risk through its eQTL effects on the gene EAF1-AS1, located in the heart atrial appendage. It contributed approximately 3% to the overall model weight.
title: Machine learning identifies six genetic variants and alterations in the Heart Atrial Appendage as key contributors to PD risk predictivity

finding: rs6808178 also played a significant role in PD risk, similarly influencing EAF1-AS1 expression in the heart atrial appendage and contributing around 3% to the total model weight. It acted as an eQTL for another gene implicated in neurodegeneration.
title: Machine learning identifies six genetic variants and alterations in the Heart Atrial Appendage as key contributors to PD risk predictivity

finding: The SNP rs2777888 was identified as genome-wide significant in a meta-analysis of European ancestry PTSD GWAS, where its expression in the anterior cingulate cortex was linked to the gene NAA80. Additionally, it was recognized in joint concordance analyses for substance use disorder indicating its relevance in understanding the genetic predisposition towards NPSUD.
title: Identifying potential risk genes and pathways for neuropsychiatric and substance use disorders using intermediate molecular mediator information

finding: The SNP rs73064425 was associated with a Neanderthal haplotype on chromosome 3, which correlated with a doubling of the occurrence of severe respiratory disease in COVID-19 patients, implicating its importance in immune response.
title: Potential associations of selected polymorphic genetic variants with COVID-19 disease susceptibility and severity

finding: The SNP rs6772228 belonged to the PXK gene, and was associated with total cholesterol levels, which might contribute to the risk of coronary heart disease through its impact on telomere length.
title: Leukocyte Telomere Length and Cardiac Structure and Function: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs73842644 was significantly associated with gestational length (beta = -0.667, P = 4.9×10^-8), indicating a potential role in influencing the duration of pregnancy.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes in Nulliparas

finding: The SNP rs72956265 was significantly associated with gestational diabetes (OR = 3.09, P = 2.98×10^-8). This intronic variant is located within the ZBTB20 gene, which has implications in glucose homeostasis.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes in Nulliparas

finding: The intronic variant rs61167087 was associated with gestational diabetes, supporting regulatory functions of the ZBTB20 gene in this condition.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes in Nulliparas

finding: The variant rs4058156, located in the region of RUVBL1, was identified as significantly associated with endometriosis, with a strong P-value of 3.51E-10 in the multi-ancestry GWAS meta-analysis.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: The variant rs9870207, located in the 3q28 region, presented a significant association with endometriosis, showing a P-value of 4.17E-09 in the multi-ancestry analysis.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: This SNP was linked to cancer, indicating its possible role in oncogenic pathways.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: The SNP rs368636424 demonstrated a significant association with knee pain, showing a primary p-value of 2.07 × 10^-2. Despite not reaching the replication threshold, its involvement indicates connectivity to the genes influencing knee pain pathophysiology.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: SNP rs2019689 was found to be significantly associated with knee pain in males, with a p-value of 6.51 × 10^-9. It is located near the MBNL1 gene, suggesting intricate regulatory mechanisms may relate to joint health.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: Located in the intronic region of STAG1, this SNP was characterized as a EUR-specific signal, suggesting its relevance in the genetic architecture of RA.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: This SNP, located in the ARHGEF3 locus, had a novel trans-pQTL association with YBX2 levels. The variant was previously associated with more than 1,000 SOMAmers in recent pQTL studies, impacting protein secretion during sample preparation.
title: Genome and epigenome wide studies of plasma protein biomarkers for Alzheimer’s disease implicate TBCA and TREM2 in disease risk

finding: The SNP rs6768326, located near the gene RAP2B on chromosome 3, was found to have a significant association with a two-sided p-value of 9.26×10^-8 in the analysis of a large cohort. This finding, however, could not be replicated in a separate dataset due to the lack of availability of the SNP on the genotyping platform utilized in that dataset.
title: Phenotypic and genetic factors are associated with absence of cardiomyopathy symptoms in PLN c.40_42delAGA carriers

finding: This SNP was previously reported in the literature as associated with chronicity and MR substantiated its linkage to neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Mendelian randomisation analysis using GWAS and eQTL data to investigate the relationship between chronotype and neuropsychiatric disorders and their molecular basis

finding: The SNP rs80064213 was significantly associated with the oxo-MiNP_oh-MiNP ratio, showing an effect size of 0.331 and a p-value of 4.15E-08, near the FECHP1 gene.
title: Common genetic variants associated with urinary phthalate levels in children: a genome-wide study

finding: This variant was significantly more common in the ORCADES cohort compared to other biobanks. It was associated with IgG glycosylation, indicating a novel association despite being absent in CROATIA-Korcula and VIKING cohorts.
title: Exome sequencing reveals aggregates of rare variants in glycosyltransferase and other genes influencing immunoglobulin G and transferrin glycosylation

finding: The SNP rs35092096 was associated with a higher ratio of CCR6+CCR7-CCR5+ Tregs in type 1 diabetes (T1D). Specifically, the minor allele T correlated with an increase in these Treg percentages, highlighting its significant role in Treg function within the CCR region's context.
title: Genetic and environmental effects on the immune phenotypes in type 1 diabetes

finding: This SNP, in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs113010081, was linked to an increased percentage of CCR5+ CD4+ T-cell traits and a decreased percentage of CCR5-CD4+ T-cell traits. It emphasized the T1D disease context regarding its effects on immune cell composition.
title: Genetic and environmental effects on the immune phenotypes in type 1 diabetes

finding: Linked with rs11574435, this SNP contributed to T1D risk through its associations with the proportions of various CD4+ T-cell traits, confirming its role in the disease-specific immune response alterations.
title: Genetic and environmental effects on the immune phenotypes in type 1 diabetes

finding: This SNP was identified as one of the significant loci influencing T cell subpopulations expressing chemokine receptors, contributing to the understanding of genetic regulation in T1D.
title: Genetic and environmental effects on the immune phenotypes in type 1 diabetes

finding: The lead SNP rs6795209 was linked to the HTR1F gene, encoding the serotonin 5-HT1F receptor, with a significant association suggesting its role in migraine pathophysiology (P = 1.23 x 10^-8).
title: Genome-wide analysis of 102,084 migraine cases identifies 123 risk loci and subtype-specific risk alleles

finding: SNP rs61069053, located at 3q27.3, demonstrated significant interactions with vitamin use, evidenced by a p-value of 1.05×10^-5. The minor allele (G) conferred higher odds of NSCL/P in individuals who did not use vitamins, but lower odds among those who used them.
title: Genome-wide interaction study implicates VGLL2 and alcohol exposure and PRL and smoking in orofacial cleft risk

finding: The SNP rs1500714, found within ARHGEF3, was associated with VATadjBMI exclusively in females (P = 1.8 x 10^-8). Previous research suggested a female-specific effect related to postmenopausal osteoporosis associated with this gene.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The SNP rs17036328, associated with PPARG, and other related variants indicated increasing ASATadjBMI and GFATadjBMI, and decreasing ratios of VAT/ASAT and VAT/GFAT.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The SNP rs71304101 was part of a signature indicating higher ASATadjBMI and was implicated in the same effects as rs17036328 at the PPARG locus.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The SNP rs9290264, a Val15Phe variant in the SI gene, was identified as common and found in 113 IBS patients. Its hypomorphic nature suggested a potential association with improved response to the dietary intervention, further supporting the relevance of hCAZyme genetic variation in IBS treatment efficacy.
title: Functional variation in human Carbohydrate-Active enZYmes (hCAZymes) in relation to the efficacy of a FODMAP-reducing diet in IBS patients

finding: The previously identified genome-wide significant locus for OCD at rs2581789 was replicated, and the lead SNP was refined to rs2564930.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies new loci associated with OCD

finding: Identified as the lead SNP in the previously noted locus associated with OCD, this SNP was significant in all three MTAG analyses and related to various psychiatric disorders.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies new loci associated with OCD

finding: The variant rs7429614 was associated with the mean mode of anisotropy of the corticospinal tract, contributing to the genetic correlations between sleep conditions and DTI parameters.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs10865954 was associated with fractional anisotropy traits of the fornix-stria terminalis, linked to insomnia in several genomic regions.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: In the study, rs145367119 was detected with significant genetic overlaps in the neuroimaging outcomes.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs34967119 variant's implications for cognitive aspects established its relevance in the context of sleep.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: Found significant in Bonferroni-corrected analyses in the GenLang consortium, relating specifically to reading and spelling ability.
title: Discovery of 42 Genome-Wide Significant Loci Associated with Dyslexia

finding: The coding variant rs138043992 in <italic>KIF15</italic> was identified as deleterious with a significant enrichment in the Finnish population and was predicted to be damaging, indicating a possible role in IPF pathogenesis.
title: Leveraging global multi-ancestry meta-analysis in the study of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis genetics

finding: This SNP was identified in the fine-mapping of the SMC4 locus, contributing to increased expression of SMC4 and its role in hematopoietic mutation variability.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: Located at the SMC4 locus, rs6790951 was associated with increased expression of SMC4 based on eQTL analysis, implicating it in the regulation of mutation burden.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: This SNP was associated with severe COVID-19 outcomes, being identified as a lead variant in the FYCO1 gene related to this phenotype. This evidence reinforced the earlier findings linking the Neanderthal chromosome 3 locus to severe disease manifestations in COVID-19.
title: Exome-wide association study to identify rare variants influencing COVID-19 outcomes: Results from the Host Genetics Initiative

finding: Associated with hospitalisation outcomes in COVID-19, this SNP was also identified as a lead variant in the FYCO1 gene. This further supported the significance of the Neanderthal chromosome 3 locus across different clinical outcomes.
title: Exome-wide association study to identify rare variants influencing COVID-19 outcomes: Results from the Host Genetics Initiative

finding: This SNP was implicated in susceptibility to COVID-19, linked to the LIMD1 gene. It was part of the broader association with the Neanderthal chromosome 3 locus, demonstrating its relevance in the susceptibility phenotype.
title: Exome-wide association study to identify rare variants influencing COVID-19 outcomes: Results from the Host Genetics Initiative

finding: This SNP (rs77648866) was assigned a p-value of 1.82×10⁻¹⁰ in the OUD-MTAG analysis, marking it as significant and linking it to the NICN1 gene, further contributing to the understanding of genetic factors in OUD.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: The SNP rs55855024 showed a significant association with OUD, marked by a p-value of 7.89×10⁻⁹, further contributing insights into its genetic architecture linked to OUD.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: The SNP rs2241766 (+45T>G) was found to be significantly associated with metabolic syndrome. The mutant genotype combination (TG+GG) was less frequent in women with metabolic syndrome (MetS) compared to those without (p=0.017), indicating that the wild type may confer some protective effect against MetS. Furthermore, the presence of the mutant G allele was associated with higher levels of leptin and lower adiponectin levels (p<0.001), contributing to a higher HOMA-IR in MetS women, showcasing its role in obesity-related metabolic disorders.
title: Linking Adiponectin Gene Variants (+45T>G and +276G>T) to Adipokine Levels and Metabolic Syndrome in a North Indian Adult Women

finding: The SNP rs1501299 (+276G>T) demonstrated a significant association where the frequency of the mutant T allele was lower in MetS women compared to those without metabolic syndrome (p=0.027). The homozygous variant TT was linked with lower adiponectin levels and higher insulin resistance (measured as HOMA-IR), with the change being statistically significant (all p<0.001). This highlighted the variant's potential role in the increased risk of developing metabolic syndrome through its effects on adipokine profiles.
title: Linking Adiponectin Gene Variants (+45T>G and +276G>T) to Adipokine Levels and Metabolic Syndrome in a North Indian Adult Women

finding: This lead variant was associated with increased expression of RPL39L, a gene previously linked to type 2 diabetes in islet studies.
title: Identification of novel type 1 and type 2 diabetes genes by co-localization of human islet eQTL and GWAS variants with colocRedRibbon

finding: This variant co-localized with ADCY5 expression, showing that the risk allele A decreased ADCY5 expression and was associated with increased type 2 diabetes risk through multiple glycemic traits.
title: Identification of novel type 1 and type 2 diabetes genes by co-localization of human islet eQTL and GWAS variants with colocRedRibbon

finding: This SNP associated with the gene RHOA was discovered as a significant finding through trans-ancestry colocalization, indicating a potential role in signal transduction related to SCZ.
title: Brain eQTLs of European, African American, and Asian ancestry improve interpretation of schizophrenia GWAS

finding: SNP rs1991545, associated with FE, indicated a specific genetic contribution to focal epilepsy, representing a novel finding that required further understanding of how variations in SLC33A1 influenced epilepsy.
title: Systematic review of genome wide association studies (GWAS) of epilepsy identifies common risk variants and associated genes

finding: The c.316G>A (p.Asp106Asn) variant in the QARS1 gene was also observed in 3% of the tests, suggesting potential pathogenicity. This variant is associated with 'Microcephaly, progressive, with seizures and cerebral and cerebellar atrophy' syndrome and the amino acid change from aspartic acid to asparagine indicates a shift in the protein's characteristics.
title: Previously defined variants of uncertain significance may play an important role in epilepsy and interactions between certain variants may become pathogenic

finding: This SNP was associated with COVID-19 hospitalization, critical illness, and infection risk, with significant differences in effect sizes observed between sexes.
title: A genome-wide association study of COVID-19 related hospitalization in Spain reveals genetic disparities among sexes

finding: The SNP rs35731912 was associated with COVID-19 severity in European populations, mapped to the LZTFL1 gene, indicating its relevance to hospitalization risk.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: Significant association for rs9290877 in the LPP gene was found in the liability GWAS for asthma, although it was not detected by the binary method, aligning with findings reported in the literature.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The SNP rs6794370, located in the TF gene, was identified as a significant locus associated with the 'Hemochromatosis Brain' phenotype, with a p-value of 2.43×10^-81, indicating its strong involvement in iron homeostasis.
title: Polygenic architecture of a novel MRI endophenotype: the “hemochromatosis brain”

finding: The study highlighted lower methylation rates in the intron 1 region of the OXTR, with particular emphasis on how this relates to the potential impact of the OXTR rs53576 genotype on psychosis in individuals with Prader-Willi syndrome (PWS). It underscored that male PWS subjects with psychosis exhibited significantly lower methylation of the OXTR exon 1 region compared to those without psychosis, suggesting a complex interaction between genetic factors (like rs53576) and epigenetic modifications influencing psychiatric outcomes.
title: Distinct promoter regions of the oxytocin receptor gene are hypomethylated in Prader-Willi syndrome and in Prader-Willi syndrome associated psychosis

finding: The common variant rs2276868 in the promoter region of RPL14 was associated with increased susceptibility to nasopharyngeal carcinoma (NPC) with significant odds ratios in both familial (OR=1.575) and sporadic (OR=1.242) cases. The study indicated that this variant influences RPL14 expression through the transcription factor NKRF, which modulates the Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) life cycle, potentially impacting NPC pathogenesis.
title: Whole-Exome Sequencing Association Study Implicates Genetic Effects on Viral Oncogenesis and Tumor Microenvironment in Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma

finding: The locus rs7618658 in the SNX4 gene was identified as a common protective factor for high-altitude polycythemia (HAPC) in both Tibetan and Han Chinese populations, showing statistical significance (P<5e-8). It was validated in an independent sample of 1,600 participants, with Tibetans exhibiting a P-value of 6.50E-09.
title: Differences in pathogenetic mechanism between Tibetan and Han high-altitude polycythemia based on a whole genome-wide association study

finding: The rs1803155 G>A substitution in the AADAC gene was found to have a significant impact on rifampin (RIF) clearance. Homozygous individuals exhibited 17.3% lower RIF clearance compared to heterozygous and wild type alleles (p=0.0015). This variant influenced metabolism in the context of pharmacokinetics for TB treatment.
title: A Nanopore sequencing-based pharmacogenomic panel to personalize tuberculosis drug dosing

finding: The finding related to sensation seeking was notably associated with the intronic variant in the CADM2 gene, which had an extremely low p-value of 8.85×10^-98. This particular SNP was identified in prior GWAS of related traits, indicating a well-established link.
title: Neurogenetic and multi-omic sources of overlap among sensation seeking, alcohol consumption, and alcohol use disorder

finding: The genetic variant rs187941554 was associated with a substantially raised risk of incident stroke, with 2 strokes observed among 32 GA heterozygotes, resulting in a HR of 5.44 (95% CI 1.33 to 22.30, p=0.019). However, it was not associated with MIs, showing a HR of 1.20 (95% CI 0.62 to 2.32, p=0.58), thus establishing it as a significant finding for stroke.
title: Genetic variation in activating clopidogrel: longer-term outcomes in a large community cohort

finding: The intergenic variant rs73823326 located between RBMS3 and TGFBR2 was significantly associated with sTREM2 levels. Its linkage to a regulatory role affecting sTREM2 provides strong evidence for its influence on Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: Proteo-genomics of soluble TREM2 in cerebrospinal fluid provides novel insights and identifies novel modulators for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs35081325 from the LZTFL1 locus replicated associations with severe COVID-19 cases despite its low frequency in the Japanese population (MAF = 0.0013). It exhibited a significant odds ratio of 11.8 (95% CI = 1.64-85.5, P = 0.014) for severe and younger COVID-19 cases, indicating a potential shared host genetics background across populations.
title: Japan COVID-19 Task Force: a nation-wide consortium to elucidate host genetics of COVID-19 pandemic in Japan

finding: The SNP rs139045636 was associated with the linear coefficient of cervical change and mapped within the IL-12A-AS1 region near IL12A, indicating potential implications in inflammatory responses during pregnancy.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Cervical Length is Shared with Spontaneous Preterm Birth Risk

finding: The interacting SNP rs6777173, located 12 kb upstream of KLF15, was found to influence the disease outcome when combined with the SNP rs2025994, highlighting its role in the context of severe long COVID.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for Severe and Fatigue Dominant Long COVID and Commonalities with ME/CFS Identified by Combinatorial Analysis

finding: The frequency of rs1015164 was significantly associated with increased CCR1 expression, suggesting its role in severe COVID-19 cases.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The frequency of rs2248690 showed significant values in the Indian population, related to AHSG levels and the severity of COVID-19.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The SNP rs4496464 was associated with increased BHLHE40 expression in monocyte-derived macrophages (MDMs). It was also linked to increased IL-10 production from peripheral blood dendritic cells and MDMs after stimulation with TB whole cell lysate (TBWCL) and LPS.
title: CNBP, REL, and BHLHE40 variants are associated with IL-12 and IL-10 responses and tuberculosis risk

finding: The SNP rs11130215 demonstrated an association with a decreased risk for pediatric tuberculosis (TB) in South Africa, reflecting a genetic factor that potentially protects against this disease.
title: CNBP, REL, and BHLHE40 variants are associated with IL-12 and IL-10 responses and tuberculosis risk

finding: The SNP rs11709852 was linked to increased IL-12 production from dendritic cells following TBWCL stimulation, highlighting its role in immune response but not directly associated with TB outcomes.
title: CNBP, REL, and BHLHE40 variants are associated with IL-12 and IL-10 responses and tuberculosis risk

finding: The rs73060324 variant was positively associated with iron deficiency anemias.
title: New insights into the genetic etiology of 57 essential and non-essential trace elements in humans

finding: The variant rs6762719 was related to the regulation of transferrin protein LTF, implicating its role in iron binding capacity.
title: Plasma Proteome Variation and its Genetic Determinants in Children and Adolescents

finding: The inframe deletion rs72556363 in the gene CACNAD10 was associated with modestly increased risk of hypertension. This finding was supported by reports indicating that rare variants in this gene could lead to aldosterone-producing adenomas and primary aldosteronism, suggesting a biological mechanism for the hypertension risk.
title: Analysis of 200,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subjects implicates genes involved in increased and decreased risk of hypertension

finding: A potentially novel association was identified at rs72419458 near the POMGNT2 gene for cleft lip (p=2.4e-8, MAF=0.072, OR=0.621), suggesting an association distinct from known associations with cleft palate.
title: Large-scale trans-ethnic replication and discovery of genetic associations for rare diseases with self-reported medical data

finding: A genome-wide significant association was reported at rs4437193 in the KY gene for spontaneous pneumothorax (p=3.7e-10, MAF=0.38699, OR=0.7535), with unclear causal mechanism.
title: Large-scale trans-ethnic replication and discovery of genetic associations for rare diseases with self-reported medical data

finding: The novel lead variant rs2260685:T>C in MUC4 was found to increase the risk for SARS-CoV-2 infection (OR = 1.03, 95% CI = 1.02–1.04, P = 4.1 × 10^-8).
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: The missense variant rs2259292:C>T (p.Gly4324Asp) was identified to be in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with the lead variant rs2260685:T>C in MUC4, influencing the risk associated with SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: This SNP, when considered alongside rs29001570, helped generate the most constrained bounds of (-0.07, 0.73), emphasizing its usefulness in the context of the MR study.
title: Bounding the average causal effect in Mendelian randomization studies with multiple proposed instruments: An application to prenatal alcohol exposure and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder

finding: The most significant locus with a concordant direction of effect was rs10511087, found within the CADM2 gene. This SNP was associated with both AUD and BMI, reflecting similar effects, and was connected to traits such as cognition, impulsivity, and metabolic phenotypes.
title: Alcohol use disorder and body mass index show genetic pleiotropy and shared neural associations

finding: In the study, rs2279829 was identified to be associated with brain shape features, paralleling its prior identification in GWAS for regional brain volumes. It also served as an eQTL of gene ZIC4 in human brain tissue.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The analysis indicated a genome-wide significant association at rs2102158 in chromosome 3q24 with DCM risk, particularly among patients who experienced antecedent flu-like illness (p=2.74×10^-8). This suggested that the relative risk of DCM associated with each alternate allele of this SNP was heightened in patients reporting flu-like symptoms.
title: Antecedent flu-like illness and onset of idiopathic dilated cardiomyopathy: The DCM Precision Medicine Study

finding: The SNP rs1799988 was associated with increased expression of CCR2 (p = 8.2e-5), decreased serum levels of CCL-2 (p = 2.41e-9), and an increased risk of developing type 1 diabetes (T1D) (p = 7.9e-5). This indicated a regulatory role in the CCR2/CCL2 immune pathway that contributed to the pathogenesis of T1D.
title: The 3p21.31 genetic locus promotes progression to type 1 diabetes through the CCR2/CCL2 pathway

finding: The SNP rs746492 exhibited a significant association with increased CCR2 expression (p = 5.2e-5), decreased serum levels of CCL-2 (p = 6.21e-9), and increased risk of developing T1D (p = 7.9e-5). This finding was integral in linking the genetic variant to immune-mediated islet destruction in T1D.
title: The 3p21.31 genetic locus promotes progression to type 1 diabetes through the CCR2/CCL2 pathway

finding: The SNP rs13061423 was related to immune microenvironment changes in AML, impacting the expression of ALDH1A1. A positive correlation was observed between this SNP and high ALDH1A1 expression, which was associated with adverse outcomes for AML patients.
title: Lower RNA expression of ALDH1A1 distinguishes the favorable risk group in acute myeloid leukemia

finding: The rs35081325 variant was identified as a sentinel variant for severe illness and COVID-19 hospitalization, although it did not coincide with distinct monocyte count variants, suggesting its association with eosinophil percentage may be a mechanism for severe illness.
title: Genetic Examination of Hematological Parameters in SARS-CoV-2 Infection and COVID-19

finding: The study found that the common variant rs9843653, located approximately 200kb upstream of the BSN gene, exhibited a significant association with adult body mass index (BMI) (beta=-0.13 kg/m², P=9.5×10^-46). Additionally, this variant was associated with blood expression levels of BSN.
title: Protein-truncating variants in BSN are associated with severe adult-onset obesity, type 2 diabetes and fatty liver disease

finding: The rs73062389 variant at the chr3p21.31 locus was associated with Covid-19 susceptibility, showing an odds ratio (OR) of 1.22 in European ancestry participants, indicating increased susceptibility to the disease.
title: A year of Covid-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: The rs71325088 variant at the chr3p21.31 locus was associated with severe outcomes of Covid-19, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.62, highlighting its role in influencing disease severity.
title: A year of Covid-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: The rs2260685 variant within MUC4 was identified in association with susceptibility, highlighting a connection to immune response.
title: A year of Covid-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: The allele rs34336178-T was among the significant associations found for the Tanner 3 to Tanner 4 transition in boys, located 1 bp downstream of LARS2 and associated with obesity-related and anthropomorphic traits.
title: Joint models reveal genetic architecture of transitions between pubertal stages and their association with BMI in a Latino population

finding: The variant rs13075111-G was also identified in the Tanner 3 to Tanner 4 transition for boys, acting as an eQTL and sQTL that regulates the expression of LARS2, LIMD1, and SACM1L across multiple tissues.
title: Joint models reveal genetic architecture of transitions between pubertal stages and their association with BMI in a Latino population

finding: The allele rs114974272-G was detected in the Tanner 2 to Tanner 3 transition in boys, and it is related to SOX2-OT, which is involved in pubertal traits such as age at voice breaking and facial hair onset.
title: Joint models reveal genetic architecture of transitions between pubertal stages and their association with BMI in a Latino population

finding: Linked to rapid progression subtype (Subtype III), providing insights into the genetic basis of the aggressive disease course.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The SNP rs71325088 demonstrated a significant association with SARS-CoV-2 infection and hospitalization risk, showing a Bonferroni adjusted P-value of 0.007 and an odds ratio (OR) of 1.46 [95% CI 1.17-1.81]. This variant is part of the repetitive analysis indicating its relationship to severe COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Replication of LZTFL1 gene region as a susceptibility locus for COVID-19 in Latvian population

finding: Identified as having the strongest association in a fine-mapping study at the 3p21.31 locus, rs2191031 had a P-value of 5e-05 with an odds ratio of 1.40 [95% CI 1.19-1.64]. This SNP is located in the LZTFL1 gene and was noted to have a higher prevalence compared to other replicated variants.
title: Replication of LZTFL1 gene region as a susceptibility locus for COVID-19 in Latvian population

finding: This SNP was also significantly associated with COVID-19 severity, showing a P-value of 0.007 and an odds ratio of 1.45 [1.17-1.80], contributing to the findings related to the 3p21.31 locus.
title: Replication of LZTFL1 gene region as a susceptibility locus for COVID-19 in Latvian population

finding: The SNP rs35081325 was found within the 3p21.31 locus, identified as a new locus, and was associated with severe COVID-19. The gene CXCR6 was prioritized as a candidate causal gene for this SNP.
title: Single cell sequencing analysis uncovers genetics-influenced CD16+monocytes and memory CD8+T cells involved in severe COVID-19

finding: Similar to rs35081325, the SNP rs33998492 in the 3p21.31 locus was associated with severe COVID-19 and served as a second independent genetic association signal. The gene CCR1 was identified as a causal gene for this SNP.
title: Single cell sequencing analysis uncovers genetics-influenced CD16+monocytes and memory CD8+T cells involved in severe COVID-19

finding: The rs631312 SNP was implicated in both MOBP and RPSA through SMR, showing prioritization of these genes in relation to ALS risk.
title: Common and rare variant association analyses in Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis identify 15 risk loci with distinct genetic architectures and neuron-specific biology

finding: The SNP rs73062389:G>A in SLC6A20 was associated with increased susceptibility to COVID-19 (OR = 1.18, P = 2.5 × 10^-74), highlighting the interplay between different loci in the disease severity and risk context.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19: an update

finding: The rs121908839 mutation (c.955C>T, p.Arg319Cys) was noted as causing ectrodactyly, supporting the detrimental nature of mutations at codon 319 of the TP63 gene, which are linked to oral clefts and limb malformations.
title: A Novel de novo TP63 Mutation in Whole Exome Sequencing of a Syrian Family with Oral Cleft and Ectrodactyly

finding: This SNP, intronic to IGF2BP2, was found in the positive effect cluster linked to obesity traits impacting conditions related to female reproductive health.
title: The role of obesity in female reproductive conditions: A Mendelian Randomisation study

finding: The SNP rs73163796 had a posterior probability of 66% for being a shared SNP influencing both major depressive disorder (MDD) risk and DNA methylation (DNAm). This colocalisation was particularly noted in relation to a smoking-associated CpG probe.
title: DNA methylome-wide association study of genetic risk for depression implicates antigen processing and immune responses

finding: The SNP rs73163779 exhibited a posterior probability of 17% as a shared SNP between MDD and DNAm, indicating a potential link between genetic influences on both traits, also associated with a smoking-related CpG probe.
title: DNA methylome-wide association study of genetic risk for depression implicates antigen processing and immune responses

finding: The SNP rs11710605 showed an 11% posterior probability of being a shared SNP for MDD and DNAm, suggesting a possible genetic intersection between these traits, particularly within the context of a CpG probe related to smoking.
title: DNA methylome-wide association study of genetic risk for depression implicates antigen processing and immune responses

finding: The SNP rs9810512 was among the prominent SNPs linked to regulatory functions, indicating its significance in the genetic interplay underlying crosstalk between blood cell traits and cardiovascular disease.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: The SNP rs12630999 was originally associated with both the 'mental health' and 'metabolic' categories due to its location between the neighboring Mendelian disease genes STAG1 and PCCB. This dual association highlighted its relevance in both contexts affecting body mass index (BMI) and indicated a potential overlap in the underlying biological pathways.
title: Distinct pathway-based effects of blood pressure and body mass index on cardiovascular traits: comparison of novel Mendelian Randomization approaches

finding: The SNP rs11707416 was significantly associated with the expression of the microglial gene P2RY12, showing p-values of 1.2e-4 in the Brain xQTLserve browser. This SNP was highlighted as a strong functional candidate within a locus defined by previous GWAS for Parkinson's disease due to its important role in the immune system related to the disease pathogenesis.
title: Heritability enrichment implicates microglia in Parkinson’s disease pathogenesis

finding: The SNP rs17283010 was identified as the strongest credible set SNP overlapping with microglia open chromatin regions. It displayed an association with P2RY12 expression levels at p=1.5e-5, indicating its potential relevance in the regulation of this key microglial gene within the context of Parkinson's disease.
