title: Heritability enrichment implicates microglia in Parkinson’s disease pathogenesis

finding: The SNP rs9834970 reached genome-wide significance in both male (OR T allele = 0.90, P = 6.6×10^-10) and female (OR T allele = 0.91, P = 5.7×10^-12) meta-analyses for bipolar disorder in European ancestry cohorts. This SNP had been consistently associated with bipolar disorder in prior studies.
title: Genetic diversity enhances gene discovery for bipolar disorder

finding: Identified as the most significantly associated SNP (P = 1.87×10−17) within the PPP2R3A gene, showing improvement from previous dyslexia GWAS findings.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of quantitative reading skill and dyslexia improves gene discovery

finding: This SNP demonstrated a positive correlation to reading ability and is also tied to body mass index, indicating a multi-faceted influence.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of quantitative reading skill and dyslexia improves gene discovery

finding: Connected to NCK1 and associated with blood urea nitrogen measurement, indicating a broader biological relevance.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of quantitative reading skill and dyslexia improves gene discovery

finding: Previously associated with body height, this SNP also correlated with poorer reading performance, suggesting multifactorial effects.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of quantitative reading skill and dyslexia improves gene discovery

finding: This SNP was found to be significantly associated with adiponectin levels and was one of the loci that demonstrated statistical significance despite the presence of high heterogeneity.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: This SNP was identified in the European-ancestry analysis as a previously unreported locus associated with adiponectin.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: This SNP was identified as a putative causal variant in the adiponectin exploration and a lead variant from the meta-analysis.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: This SNP was one of the identified putative causal variants from the European-ancestry analyses.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: The study confirmed the association between the LZTFL1 variant rs67959919 and the risk of COVID-19. The rare T-allele of rs67959919 was linked to an increased risk of COVID-19 after adjusting for age, sex, and hypertension, with a significant p-value of 0.003 and an odds ratio (OR) of 1.86 (95% CI: 1.23-2.82). While there was no significant difference in the severity of the disease between severe and non-severe cases, the rs67959919 A - CCR5 non-deletion (wild-type) haplotype was significantly more prevalent among the patients.
title: The CCR5-delta32 variant might explain part of the association between COVID-19 and the chemokine-receptor gene cluster

finding: rs9877502 near GMNC was found to be associated with CSF proteomics data, indicating it related to tau levels and implicating its impact on brain ventricular volume.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis for Alzheimer’s disease cerebrospinal fluid biomarkers

finding: The study evaluated the copy number alterations related to heterozygosity for rs1062633, demonstrated that the SNP was effective in measuring allelic imbalances, and established it as a crucial SNP for assessing genomic stability in DNA from mixed samples.
title: Allele-specific digital PCR enhances precision and sensitivity in the detection and quantification of copy number alterations in heterogeneous DNA samples: an in silico and in vitro validation study

finding: Heterozygosity of rs2236947 was integrated into the analysis framework, supporting its role in detecting copy number variations and contributing to the measurement of allelic imbalances in uveal melanoma specimens.
title: Allele-specific digital PCR enhances precision and sensitivity in the detection and quantification of copy number alterations in heterogeneous DNA samples: an in silico and in vitro validation study

finding: The variant rs7650482 showed associations with cardiac arrhythmias and was linked to anthropometric measures such as waist-hip ratio.
title: Using human genetics to understand the causes and consequences of circulating cardiac troponin I in the general population

finding: The variant rs11718898 in the CAND2 gene was identified in significant linkage disequilibrium with the index variant rs7650482, indicating its potential involvement in cTnI expression.
title: Using human genetics to understand the causes and consequences of circulating cardiac troponin I in the general population

finding: The index SNP rs28654158, located in the ADCY5 gene region, exhibited both maternal and fetal effects on gestational duration with the same effect direction. This SNP was involved in different trait associations compared to its nearby counterpart impacting birth weight.
title: Genetic effects on the timing of parturition and links to fetal birth weight

finding: The SNP rs7650602, located in the ZBTB38 gene region, showed significant enrichment metrics and contributed to understanding the evolutionary forces shaping gestational duration and related traits.
title: Genetic effects on the timing of parturition and links to fetal birth weight

finding: The SNP rs1687225 was identified as an independent significant variant associated with brain stem LBS (p=5.6E-10). This exonic variant is a missense variant located in VWA5B2, and although it exhibited a high CADD score and was associated with various traits, it was predicted to be likely benign.
title: Beyond Volume: Unraveling the Genetics of Human Brain Geometry

finding: The SNP rs13061308 was associated with the neutrophil-to-lymphocyte ratio, which was shown to predict the development of immune-related adverse events (irAEs) in patients undergoing immune checkpoint blockade therapy. This finding had significant implications for understanding patient outcomes in cancer treatment with atezolizumab, particularly in predicting who might be at higher risk for irAEs.
title: Baseline risk factors associated with immune related adverse events and atezolizumab

finding: An African ancestry-specific variant located near ERC2 was associated with lower fasting glucose following metformin treatment, exhibiting a beta of -0.94 mmol/L and a p-value of 1.9x10^-9.
title: Genome-wide association analysis identifies ancestry-specific genetic variation associated with medication response in the Study to Understand the Genetics of the Acute Response to Metformin and Glipizide in Humans (SUGAR-MGH)

finding: The intronic variant in PRICKLE2 was linked to multiple secondary outcomes including lower glucose levels during glipizide treatment, with evidence suggesting enhanced drug response in carriers.
title: Genome-wide association analysis identifies ancestry-specific genetic variation associated with medication response in the Study to Understand the Genetics of the Acute Response to Metformin and Glipizide in Humans (SUGAR-MGH)

finding: The SNP rs113341849 was identified as part of the Haplotype A in the CEU population, with a perfect linkage disequilibrium (r² = 1) with the CCR5delta32 deletion. This haplotype consists of variants linked to the CCR5 receptor and was observed to have undergone positive selection between 7,000-2,000 years BP in Western Eurasia.
title: Tracing the evolutionary path of the CCR5delta32 deletion via ancient and modern genomes

finding: Like rs113341849, the SNP rs113010081 was found to have a perfect linkage disequilibrium (r² = 1) with the CCR5delta32 allele in Haplotype A. This suggests strong connection to HIV-1 infection resistance and highlights its significance in therapeutic strategies involving the CCR5 receptor.
title: Tracing the evolutionary path of the CCR5delta32 deletion via ancient and modern genomes

finding: The rs34097149 variant mapped to the GPR149/MME locus on 3q25.2 was associated with an increasing risk of VT recurrence, exhibiting a hazard ratio (HR) of 1.84 (95% CI: [1.49-2.29], P=2.65×10^-8). GPR149 was previously linked to coronary artery disease and haemostatic traits.
title: Genomic Landscape of Thrombosis Recurrence Risk Across Venous Thromboembolism Subtypes

finding: The SNP rs1354034 was associated with the expression of 297 genes involved in platelet function regulation, highlighting its broad pleiotropic effects on genetic regulation.
title: Genetic analysis of blood molecular phenotypes reveals regulatory networks affecting complex traits: a DIRECT study

finding: This SNP was identified as a novel locus in European populations, located in the intron of the ATR gene, which is crucial for telomere maintenance and DNA damage response.
title: Genomic, phenomic, and geographic associations of leukocyte telomere length in the United States

finding: Located at EXOSC7, this SNP associated with telomere shortening by contributing to the telomerase RNA template processing, indicating a role in telomere biology.
title: Genomic, phenomic, and geographic associations of leukocyte telomere length in the United States

finding: The SNP rs11917431 at the 3p21.31 locus was significantly associated with febrile seizures (P = 5.63 × 10^-12, OR = 1.15). It was located intronic in the BSN gene and associated with neuronal excitability, with numerous eQTL variants reported for related genes.
title: Genome-wide association study of febrile seizures identifies seven new loci implicating fever response and neuronal excitability genes

finding: rs4974130 was found at the 3p14.3 locus with a P value of 1.52 × 10^-13 and an OR of 1.31. This SNP was intronic in ERC2 and linked to increased gene expression in the cerebellum, positioning it among key neurotransmitter system contributors.
title: Genome-wide association study of febrile seizures identifies seven new loci implicating fever response and neuronal excitability genes

finding: The lead variant rs73064425 was reported as the strongest susceptibility locus for severe COVID-19, with an odds ratio (OR) of 2.14 and a highly significant p-value of 4.77E-30, indicating a strong association with disease severity.
title: Elevated plasma levels of CXCL16 in severe COVID-19 patients

finding: The variant rs10490770:T>C pointed to CXCR6 and was associated with hospitalization (p-value of 1.443E-73) and critical illness (p-value of 2.20E-61). Carriers of the risk allele faced a 1.5-fold increased risk of COVID-19 related mortality and had significantly increased odds of complications such as severe respiratory failure (OR 2.0) and venous thromboembolism (OR 1.7). The study replicated this variant's association with severe COVID-19 in a hospitalized patient cohort (OR 1.9, p-value <0.002).
title: Elevated plasma levels of CXCL16 in severe COVID-19 patients

finding: In British-Bangladeshi individuals, the proxy variant rs34288077 was found to be associated with COVID-19 hospitalization, being present in 34.6% of hospitalized patients compared to 23.8% in non-hospitalized individuals (OR [95%CI] = 2.11 [1.39, 3.21]; P =4.7 × 10-4).
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The lead variant rs10490770 was associated with severe COVID-19 symptoms and represented a strong signal at the 3p21.31 locus, the most replicated signal for COVID-19 severity.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The rs13074711 SNP was reported as a risk variant in a previous GWAS of African ancestry population for estrogen receptor (ER)-negative breast cancer. In the present study, this SNP was shown to alter the expression of the TNFSF10 gene and influence IFN-β-induced apoptosis. The high expression of TNFSF10 was associated with a lower risk of breast cancer, linking rs13074711 to potential cancer suppressor functions of the TNFSF10 gene, which may operate through immune defense mechanisms.
title: A joint transcriptome-wide association study across multiple tissues identifies new candidate susceptibility genes for breast cancer

finding: The SNP rs13092249 was implicated in the context of homologous recombination repair deficiency and tumor immunogenicity. This finding related to the study's results on mutational signatures and their influence on tumor subtypes and response to immune checkpoint inhibitors (ICIs).
title: Tumor genomic subtypes orthogonal to mutation burden predict the efficacy of immune checkpoint therapy

finding: The variant rs6808178, an intron variant of LINC00693, emerged as significant with a p-value of 0.038, suggesting a potential role in the genetic landscape influencing CSF alpha-synuclein aggregate presence in LRRK2-patients.
title: LRRK2-Associated Parkinsonism With and Without In Vivo Evidence of Alpha-Synuclein Aggregates

finding: The most significant association in admixed African (AFR) ancestry with a minor allele frequency of approximately 6% in AFR and <0.01% in EUR, indicating a strong population-specific effect.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of mosaic loss of chromosome Y in the Million Veteran Program identifies 167 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs12107945 was identified as a significant locus in the study of skull bone mineral density (SK-BMD), contributing to the understanding of genetic determinants of this trait in 43,800 individuals. It was found to be involved in regulating the development of the skeleton and associated with craniofacial abnormalities, providing functional validation for its role in skull development.
title: Genome Wide Association Metanalysis Of Skull Bone Mineral Density Identifies Loci Relevant For Osteoporosis And Craniosynostosis

finding: The SNP rs11919682 in ROBO1 showed genome-wide significant association (p=1.63×10^-8) in the MVP GWAS.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs567572378 in KCNH8-EFHB showed suggestive significance (p=8.19×10^-8) in the findings.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs6801957 was associated with Brugada syndrome (BrS) and showed a connection to ECG traits. It led to reduced expression of the SCN10A-short transcript and decreased cardiac I_Na while causing minimal effects on SCN5A expression. This finding underscored the role of common non-coding variants in the regulatory elements at the SCN5A-SCN10A locus in the genetic etiology of BrS.
title: A rare non-coding enhancer variant in SCN5A contributes to the high prevalence of Brugada syndrome in Thailand

finding: The SNP rs7430407 located in an exon adjacent to the RE5 intronic variant, was utilized to measure SCN5A allelic expression. It demonstrated that hiPSC-CMs containing the RE5 variant displayed a 34% reduction in SCN5A transcript allelic ratio compared to isogenic controls, providing evidence for allele-specific reduced RE5 enhancer activity and SCN5A expression due to a loss of the Mef2 motif, which contributed to the understanding of BrS genetic mechanisms.
title: A rare non-coding enhancer variant in SCN5A contributes to the high prevalence of Brugada syndrome in Thailand

finding: For asthma, the SNP rs509399 was fine-mapped with a PIP of 0.96 and linked by cS2G to the target gene BCL6, indicating a significant connection to asthma pathobiology.
title: Combining SNP-to-gene linking strategies to pinpoint disease genes and assess disease omnigenicity

finding: The SNP rs121912851, corresponding to the mutation c.C742T in the TP53 gene, was found in 0.18% (1 out of 571) of ESCC patients and was noted as one of the pathogenic mutations in the study.
title: Comprehensive Study of Germline Mutations and Double-Hit Events in Esophageal Squamous Cell Cancer

finding: Variant rs1288694 showed an impact on fasting glucose (FG) and is known to be intronic to the FOXP1 gene, which may regulate splicing. This gene has a demonstrated role in hepatic gluconeogenesis, indicating a potential mechanism through which dietary macronutrient composition could influence glycemic traits.
title: Investigating gene-diet interactions impacting the association between macronutrient intake and glycemic traits

finding: The rs1540354-T variant in MLH1 was associated with decreased overall survival only in glioma cases treated with temozolomide (HR=1.70, 95% CI: 1.17-2.47, p=0.0058). It did not affect survival in non-temozolomide treated individuals.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The intron variant rs4647218-G in MLH1 was associated with improved survival, where carriers of two copies had a median survival of 14.3 years, contrasting with shorter survivals for those with fewer copies (HR=0.73, 95% CI: 0.61-0.88, p=0.0014).
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The rs1052133-G in OGG1 indicated altered survival outcomes for temozolomide treated patients, with an HR of 0.78 (95% CI: 0.67-0.92, p=0.0025).
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The SNP rs16859966 on chromosome 3 was identified as strongly disease-associated with Multiple System Atrophy (MSA), exhibiting a P-value of 8.6 × 10^-7 and an odds ratio (OR) of 1.58 (95% CI = 1.32-1.89). This association was relevant as the SNP is located upstream of the genes ZIC1 and ZIC4, both of which are critical for central nervous system development and have previously been implicated in congenital cerebellar defects.
title: Genome-wide association study of autopsy-confirmed Multiple System Atrophy identifies common variants near ZIC1 and ZIC4

finding: The rs4955351 SNP near GADL1 was described as a novel finding, with a P-value of 3.19e-08, suggesting potential involvement in AD and amyloid levels.
title: Connecting genomic and proteomic signatures of amyloid burden in the brain

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with the A1 ("aging-related") dimension of autism spectrum disorder (ASD), which related to globally reduced brain volume, cognitive dysfunction, and aging-related genetic variants.
title: Three Imaging Endophenotypes Characterize Neuroanatomical Heterogeneity of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: rs200040076 exhibited significant differences with an AF of 0.132 in COVID patients and 0 in the general population, with p-value=1.14E-179.
title: COVID-19 relevant genetic variants confirmed in an admixed population

finding: The SNP rs724016 in ZBTB38 was associated with FVC, showing a negative correlation (P=1.35×10^-10, β=-0.0178). This locus was previously associated with Crohn’s disease.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: The SNP rs12633655 was related to the DNASE1L3 locus, with a p-value of 4.82e-31. While it was not successfully replicated in the independent cohort due to sample size limitations, it was part of the initial cfGWAS findings.
title: cfGWAS reveal genetic basis of cell-free DNA features

finding: This SNP was recognized as a novel finding on chromosome 3 and was associated with internalizing traits, particularly showing a strong linkage with major depressive disorder (MDD) and relationships to neuroticism and depression.
title: A Multivariate Genome-Wide Association Study Reveals Neural Correlates and Common Biological Mechanisms of Psychopathology Spectra

finding: The study identified a positive association between the GSK3B -50C/T (rs334558) SNP and bipolar disorder (BD), contrasting previous inconclusive findings by Chen et al. (2014). This association was noted despite the previous results being attributed to smaller sample sizes. The study indicated that this SNP may also play a role in the pathophysiology of BD, alongside its implications in Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, and schizophrenia, suggesting its potential as a target for further research and therapeutic interventions.
title: Druggable causal genes of bipolar disorder identified through Mendelian Randomization analysis offer a route to intervention in integrated stress response

finding: The adjacent lead SNP rs11130215 in the BHLHE40 3'UTR was found to bind to multiple transcription factors and was highlighted as a potential regulator of inflammation related to AD.
title: Meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis in 1,094,060 individuals identifies new risk loci, and sub-analysis characterizes the loci with disease severity and onset

finding: The SNP rs2710339 was linked to SCZ through the isoform ENST00000492146 of the gene SFMBT1, annotated with a strong imputed adult brain expression significance of P = 6.9 × 10⁻¹². GWAS studies indicated decreased expression of SFMBT1 was associated with increased risk of both schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
title: Isoform-level transcriptome-wide association uncovers extensive novel genetic risk mechanisms for neuropsychiatric disorders in the human brain

finding: The SNP NCKIPSD rs12497850 was involved in significant predictions of alpha-synuclein levels in cerebrospinal fluid, making it relevant in understanding Parkinson's disease.
title: The multi-modality neuroimaging analysis identified an essential genetic variant associated with Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs6439513 was validated as the lead SNP for the T2D locus at 3q22.2 in a GWAS of European samples, with a P-value of 0.03 and an OR of 1.07.
title: Admixture mapping screening of CKD traits and risk factors in U.S. Hispanic/Latino individuals from Central America country-of-origin

finding: The CP locus (lead SNP rs17838831) was known to be associated with copper levels, confirming prior research.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: This SNP was strongly associated with the severity cluster of phenotypes related to COVID-19. It consistently correlated with increased risk of infection severity, as identified in the main HGI severity study ("ANA_B2").
title: Novel COVID-19 phenotype definitions reveal phenotypically distinct patterns of genetic association and protective effects

finding: Identified in the HGI susceptibility study ("ANA_C2"), this SNP was strongly associated with the susceptibility cluster of phenotypes. It was distinct from the severity phenotypes, indicating it specifically conferred increased susceptibility risk.
title: Novel COVID-19 phenotype definitions reveal phenotypically distinct patterns of genetic association and protective effects

finding: Recently discovered as a novel signal, rs2531743 was associated with only two phenotypes: Symptomatic/Paucisymptomatic and Exposed_Positive/Exposed_Negative. It was noted that the minor allele was associated in a protective direction, indicating a different effect compared to other signals in the chr3 region.
title: Novel COVID-19 phenotype definitions reveal phenotypically distinct patterns of genetic association and protective effects

finding: The SNP rs11922956, located near the CADM2 gene, was associated with lifetime cannabis use, replicating previous findings in GWASs concerning lifetime use and cannabis use disorder (CUD). The association was significant with a p-value of 2.40E-11, indicating strong evidence for this relationship. CADM2 is involved in processes such as synaptic formation and energy homeostasis.
title: Genome-wide association studies of lifetime and frequency cannabis use in 131,895 individuals

finding: The SNP rs4856591 was significantly associated with the frequency of cannabis use, with a p-value of 8.10E-09. It was located near CADM2 and was in linkage disequilibrium with rs11922956 (r^2 = 0.76), suggesting a shared genetic underpinning between frequency of use and lifetime cannabis consumption.
title: Genome-wide association studies of lifetime and frequency cannabis use in 131,895 individuals

finding: The SNP rs5030044 was intronic in KNG1, contributing to bradykinin formation in the plasminogen-activating system.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The rs150385013 variant was identified as an European-specific association related to male participants in the POAG population study.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs58812088 variant's proximity to known PACG risk loci highlights its potential roles in broader glaucoma diagnoses affecting different ancestry populations.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs16856870 variant was noted for being related to PACG, affirming the complexity and need for refined stratification of ancestry effects in glaucoma genetics.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: A common SNP in the promoter flanking region of RAB7A was found genome-wide significant in a recent large GWAS study on smoking, indicating its role in smoking-related traits.
title: Powerful gene-based testing by integrating long-range chromatin interactions and knockoff genotypes

finding: A nearby SNP in the same promoter flanking region of RAB7A was found genome-wide significant with eosinophil counts in the UK Biobank, linking eosinophil levels to lung function through their predictive value on FEV1 decline.
title: Powerful gene-based testing by integrating long-range chromatin interactions and knockoff genotypes

finding: The SNP rs2280575 was linked to the LRIG1 gene and demonstrated an effect on LRIG1 expression in the hypothalamus. The analysis showed that it was significantly associated with hippocampal atrophy, with expression levels of LRIG1 being notably higher in brain tissues.
title: APOE-stratified genome-wide association study suggests potential novel genes for late-onset Alzheimer’s disease in East-Asian descent

finding: The variant rs112097551 was identified as a significant association with higher mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH) and mean corpuscular volume (MCV) among the 62,653 participants of diverse ethnicities in TOPMed. This variant was shown to act through a cis-regulatory element controlling gene RUVBL1, which is crucial for hematopoiesis.
title: Whole genome sequencing association analysis of quantitative red blood cell phenotypes: the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: The rs2977562 variant, also found in the HBA1 region, linked to MCH and RDW, demonstrated significant results in the TOPMed analyses and was supported by existing literature.
title: Whole genome sequencing association analysis of quantitative red blood cell phenotypes: the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: The rs147412900 variant in the HBA1 region was found to impact MCH and RDW, reinforcing previous publications' assertions of its role in affecting red blood cell characteristics.
title: Whole genome sequencing association analysis of quantitative red blood cell phenotypes: the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: This missense variant located in the PROS1 gene was associated with free protein S levels and represented a positive original finding.
title: Antithrombin, protein C and protein S: Genome and transcriptome wide association studies identify 7 novel loci regulating plasma levels

finding: The SNP rs34801745 had a significant association with body mass index (BMI) with a beta of 0.013 and a P value of 7 × 10^-11. This SNP was found within 500kb of TNK2.
title: Population scale whole genome sequencing provides novel insights into cardiometabolic health

finding: The SNP rs6800500 was associated with T2D, exhibiting a beta of 0.03 and a P value of 2.4 × 10^-21. This finding was linked to TNK2, demonstrating the influence on metabolic characteristics.
title: Population scale whole genome sequencing provides novel insights into cardiometabolic health

finding: The SNP rs11713193 was associated with BMI, presenting a beta of 0.025 with a P value of 3 × 10^-48. Links were noted within a 500kb proximity of IP6K1.
title: Population scale whole genome sequencing provides novel insights into cardiometabolic health

finding: The SNP rs7613875 had substantial associations with BMI and T2D, observing a beta of 0.025 and a P value of 4.8 × 10^-16, near the IP6K1 locus.
title: Population scale whole genome sequencing provides novel insights into cardiometabolic health

finding: The SNP rs72439195, located in chromosome 3q28, achieved genome-wide significance in the analysis of bilateral cleft lip (BCL) with a p-value of 3.69×10^-8. This finding was considered original because it identified a novel risk locus associated specifically with BCL.
title: The PAX1 locus at 20p11 is a modifier for bilateral cleft lip only

finding: This novel lead SNP near ADAMTS9 was associated with ascending aortic distensibility, acting as a significant eQTL for ADAMTS9.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The SNP rs66513933 was identified as a significant finding associated with subtype 1 of preclinical-T2DM, located in the intron of the gene IGF2BP2, which was strongly correlated with a low risk of type 2 diabetes.
title: Identification of distinct trajectories in preclinical type 2 diabetes and their associations with outcomes

finding: SNP rs9834970 was found to have significant colocalization with bipolar disorder in subtype 1, showing a posterior probability of the shared causal variant hypothesis (PPH4) of 0.89.
title: Identification of distinct trajectories in preclinical type 2 diabetes and their associations with outcomes

finding: The SNP rs11708067 was indicated as the birth weight locus influencing fetal insulin levels. Although its relationship was classified as that of a birth weight SNP, it was in low linkage disequilibrium with the gestational duration SNP rs28654158 and colocalized with ADCY5 gene expression. It provided valuable insight into the contrasting effects on birth weight versus gestational duration, making it a positive original finding.
title: Genetic effects on the timing of parturition and links to fetal birth weight

finding: The SNP rs2293607 in the 3q26.2 region, associated with an increased risk of multiple cancers (OR=1.11, P=5.8x10^-10) and consistent in invasive tumors (OR=1.10, P=1.5x10^-7).
title: Unraveling the genetic landscape of susceptibility to multiple primary cancers

finding: The SNP rs868933181, located in the gene VPRBP, showed a significant association with early-onset gout with a meta-analysis P value of 6.27 × 10^-9 and an odds ratio of 1.66.
title: Novel genetic loci in adolescent-onset gout derived from whole genome sequencing of a Chinese cohort

finding: Found to have an odds ratio of 3.1 (2-4.5), rs2800-G indicated a significant association with increased risk of fatty liver disease, implicating its role in the disease mechanism.
title: Severe liver damage, low bone mineral content, and PDXDC1/TTC39B gene variations linked to NAFLD with metabolic syndrome

finding: A rare missense variant in DNAJC13 was identified, suggesting its role in transferrin recycling, related to iron levels.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of iron status biomarkers and the effect of iron on all-cause mortality in HUNT

finding: The SNP rs1702136, an intronic variant of the EEFSEC gene, exhibited the strongest signal in the GWAS meta-analysis for FGT polyps with an impressive P-value of 2.17 x 10<sup>-19</sup>. Its association with reproductive cancers was noted, indicating potential overlap in mechanisms of tissue overgrowth.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study to determine the genetic underpinnings of female genital tract polyps

finding: The SNP rs4857866 was connected with prostate cancer and had a nominal association with endometrial cancer. This suggests potential involvement in malignant processes which may correlate with the development of FGT polyps.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study to determine the genetic underpinnings of female genital tract polyps

finding: The rs1163930676 variant, a homozygous nonsense variant located in exon 9 of the DALRD3 gene, resulted in a C to A transversion that introduced a premature stop codon. This led to the loss of DALRD3 protein expression, which was linked to severe developmental and epileptic encephalopathy symptoms in two sibling patients. Patient cells displayed a significant reduction in m3C modification in specific tRNAs, indicating the critical role of DALRD3 in tRNA modification and neurodevelopment.
title: Epileptic encephalopathy linked to a DALRD3 missense variant impaired in tRNA modification function

finding: As the top association for the previously reported locus at 3q25.33-<italic>SMC4</italic>, this variant played a significant role in understanding the genetics of CH.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: A missense variant in AHSG, this SNP had an odds ratio of 0.83 and was significantly associated with otosclerosis, illustrating its relevance in susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide Screen of Otosclerosis in Population Biobanks: 18 Loci and Shared Heritability with Skeletal Structure

finding: The SNP rs143184903 located in ITPR1 was identified as significantly associated with RPD, with a p-value of 8.1e-09, contributing to the identification of novel RPD-specific associations.
title: Genetic Distinctions Between Reticular Pseudodrusen and Drusen: Insights from a Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: Exonic variant rs141178913 of IL17RC on 3p25.3 was found associated with susceptibility to squamous cell carcinoma, correlating with inflammatory disease pathways.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The variant rs188990825 near COX17-POPDC2 showed associations related to squamous cell carcinoma risk.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The variant rs35044562 was associated with autoimmune conditions and was linked with higher risks of gastrointestinal disorders, such as IBS and celiac disease, supporting its relevance to gastrointestinal symptoms during SARS-CoV2 infection.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of diarrhea during acute SARS-CoV2 infection identifies multiple novel loci and contrasting etiological roles of irritable bowel syndrome subtypes

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with intelligence, showing a P-value of less than 2.33E-05, indicating its importance in cognitive function.
title: Genetic Variations in Evolutionary Accelerated Regions Disrupt Cognition in Schizophrenia

finding: This lead SNP is part of the risk locus 14q24.1 linked to an increased risk of ICP among East Asians, contributing to the historical connection to hepatitis B resistance.
title: Genetic study of intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy in 101,023 Chinese women unveils East Asian-specific etiology linked to historic HBV infection

finding: The SNP (chr3:146517122:G:A) in the PLSCR1 gene was associated with critical COVID-19, impacting interferon signaling and predicted to be a missense mutation with a significant odds ratio of 1.24.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies multiple loci for critical illness caused by COVID-19

finding: The lead variant rs72893671 at the 3:45137109-47151986 locus was recognized for its association with severity (B1 phenotype), further emphasizing the role of distinct variants in COVID-19 phenotype differentiation.
title: Insights into genetic factors contributing to variability in SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility and COVID-19 disease severity

finding: Similar to rs72893671, rs2271616 acted as a lead variant at the 3:45137109-47151986 locus but was associated with the different C2 phenotype signal, indicating an independent genetic influence on COVID-19 severity.
title: Insights into genetic factors contributing to variability in SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility and COVID-19 disease severity

finding: The intronic variant rs6787279 in IL17RD was associated with COPD and lung function, and was noted to have an odds ratio of 0.89 with p=7.87×10<sup>–9</sup>. This SNP was found to increase the risk for ACO, reinforcing the link between IL17 signaling and respiratory conditions.
title: Genetic associations and architecture of asthma-chronic obstructive pulmonary disease overlap

finding: SNP rs35570272 in the GLB1 locus was shown to be associated with ACO, presenting an odds ratio of 1.10 (EAF 0.398, P=2.44×10<sup>–9</sup>). It was previously associated with asthma only, suggesting a shared genetic risk between asthma and ACO.
title: Genetic associations and architecture of asthma-chronic obstructive pulmonary disease overlap

finding: The splice donor loss-of-function variant in GBE1 (c.691+2T>C) was associated with a protective effect, as it correlated with lower white matter hyperintensity (WMH) volume (beta=-0.74, se=0.13, p=9.7E-9) in 17,830 individuals, indicating a significant role of this variant in reducing WMH burden.
title: Whole-exome sequencing in 16,511 individuals reveals a role of the HTRA1 protease and its substrate EGFL8 in brain white matter hyperintensities

finding: The SNP rs2535629 was confirmed to be associated with schizophrenia (SCZ) after showing an increased binding affinity for CTCF, as evidenced by ChIP-Allele-Specific-qPCR. The substitution from G to A reduced suppression effects in dual-luciferase assays, with significant delta repression scores noted in CNS biosamples.
title: The contribution of silencer variants to human diseases

finding: The SNP rs53576 was associated with alcohol use disorder (AUD) in a longitudinal population representative study. The research indicated that variation in the oxytocin receptor gene, particularly at this locus, influenced alcohol abuse behaviors. This finding was significant in the context of the role oxytocin played in stress reactions, which are pertinent to the development and maintenance of AUD, suggesting a genetic component to the disorder's etiology.
title: Altered association of plasmatic oxytocin with affective stress response in alcohol use disorder

finding: The study highlighted the significance of the oxytocin receptor gene rs53576 polymorphism in influencing oxytocin's interaction with dopamine and neuroticism traits. This polymorphism was further explored in relation to its potential effects on functional brain networks, particularly in the context of the intranasal oxytocin treatment and its modulating effects on network topology in the brains of individuals at Clinical High Risk for Psychosis (CHR-P). The findings hinted at underlying genetic factors that could mediate the treatment effects of oxytocin on functional brain network organization associated with psychosis risk.
title: Connectome dysfunction in patients at clinical high risk for psychosis and modulation by oxytocin

finding: The polymorphism in the PXR gene (rs3814055; C>T) was associated with an increased risk of developing AT-DILI among TB patients, emphasizing the role of PXR in hepatic drug metabolism.
title: Polymorphism of NAT2, PXR, ABCB1, and GSTT1 genes among tuberculosis patients of North Eastern States of India

finding: This SNP was the most strongly associated variant linked to the DHX36 locus, with a p-value of 9.06×10^-37 in European subjects, implicating biological mechanisms relevant to epiretinal membrane (ERM).
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: In the trans-ancestry meta-analysis, this SNP also mapped to the DHX36 locus and showed a strong association with ERM, indicated by a p-value of 2.90×10^-37.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: Associated with changes in gene expression of the DHX36 gene in the macula, found to be significant with a p-value of 6.38×10^-13.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: This variant mapped to the RARB locus, with a p-value of 1.13×10^-10, and was previously associated with optic disc area, suggesting relevance to ocular traits.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: This SNP showed significant association with microbiome composition at age 3, specifically with PC2, indicating a role in microbiome features related to children's BMI.
title: Genotype-microbiome-metabolome associations in early childhood, and their link to BMI and childhood obesity

finding: Significantly associated with microbiome composition at age 3 (PC2) and positively correlated with the abundance of the genus Blautia, suggesting its relevance in obesity-associated microbiome.
title: Genotype-microbiome-metabolome associations in early childhood, and their link to BMI and childhood obesity

finding: Positively associated with children's BMI percentiles throughout childhood, consistent significance across time points was observed.
title: Genotype-microbiome-metabolome associations in early childhood, and their link to BMI and childhood obesity

finding: The allele count was negatively associated with children's BMI percentiles, consistent for multiple time points.
title: Genotype-microbiome-metabolome associations in early childhood, and their link to BMI and childhood obesity

finding: Showed significant associations with BMI categories across time points and was positively associated with the abundance of Collinsella, which relates to pro-inflammatory responses.
title: Genotype-microbiome-metabolome associations in early childhood, and their link to BMI and childhood obesity

finding: The SNP rs13095226 in the COL8A1 gene was identified as a variant associated with progression to advanced AMD, contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors.
title: Rare Dysfunctional Complement Factor I Genetic Variants and Progression to Advanced Age-Related Macular Degeneration

finding: IDH-mutant cases carrying rs13076508-C near PARP3 had significantly improved survival among TMZ-treated patients, with a median increase of 90.7 months in survival time over those without the polymorphism.
title: Functional germline variants in DNA damage repair pathways are associated with altered survival in adults with glioma treated with temozolomide

finding: The variant rs199707443 was analyzed in the context of Alzheimer’s disease (AD) risk. It displayed a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.003% in non-Finnish Europeans according to gnomAD v3.1.1. Despite exhibiting large variation in genotype counts across different sequencing centers and still showing genome-wide significant association with AD risk even after adjustment for sequencing center and kit. This highlighted the potential for spurious associations due to inter-center variability.
title: A fast and robust strategy to remove variant level artifacts in Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project data

finding: The SNP rs2686630 was associated with eating disorders, suggesting it holds relevance across mental and cardiovascular health.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The rs13082684 variant, located intronically to PPP2R3A, was associated with lower volume in the right posterior insula, Heschl’s gyrus, and deep subcortical structures, reflecting its significance as a dyslexia-disposing variant.
title: Distinct impact modes of polygenic disposition to dyslexia in the adult brain

finding: The SEMA3F locus variant rs2624839 showed decreased apparent fiber density in the superior longitudinal fasciculi, while also being associated positively in the occipital lobes, indicating dual roles in dyslexia-related brain structures.
title: Distinct impact modes of polygenic disposition to dyslexia in the adult brain

finding: The SNP rs11130221, linked to IP6K1, was part of the prevalent loci showing colocalization with PTSD.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs748832 was included in the shared loci associated with PTSD and cardiovascular risk factors.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs4269101 was marked as relevant in studying PTSD-related genetic overlaps with cardiovascular traits.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs6801387 located in the CLDN16 gene was found to be significantly associated with insulin resistance (IR), with the G allele linked to an increased likelihood of IR (Odds Ratio (OR) = 9.18; 95% Confidence Interval (CI): 2.11-39.94; p < 0.001) when analyzed using a dominant inheritance model.
title: Unveiling Genetic Associations: Investigating CLDN16, GRID2, NRG3, and CACNG4 Gene Polymorphisms with Insulin Resistance Risk Among Normal BMI Individuals in the Indian Population

finding: The rs53576 SNP of the OXTR gene showed a significant association with functional neurological disorders (FND), where carriers of the A allele were found to be more vulnerable to FND. Furthermore, it was associated with decreased right insular volumes in FND patients, alongside reduced bilateral amygdalar volume specifically in female patients carrying the AA genotype.
title: Increased Prevalence of Oxytocin Receptor Gene Variant in Functional Neurological Disorder: A Preliminary Case-Control Study

finding: The SNP rs67861307 was one of the top three promising SNPs identified in both mega-analysis and meta-analysis alongside rs79878474 and rs6771812. This SNP is located in the TNIK gene, known for its regulation of neurite development and its association with an autosomal recessive form of cognitive disability.
title: Cross-continental environmental and genome-wide association study on children and adolescent anxiety and depression

finding: The SNP rs6771812 was identified as one of the three most promising SNPs for anxiety and depression and was associated with the TNIK gene, which is crucial for neurite development and linked to cognitive disabilities.
title: Cross-continental environmental and genome-wide association study on children and adolescent anxiety and depression

finding: The SNP rs13061401 demonstrated a significant relationship with the response of CD19 targeting therapies in B-lineage Acute Lymphocytic Leukemia, supporting its role in enhancing cytotoxicity against leukemia cells.
title: Trending Drugs Combination to Target Leukemia associated Proteins/Genes: using Graph Neural Networks under the RAIN Protocol

finding: The SNP rs28867111 was proximal to the gene IP6K2, also linked to inflammatory processes. This SNP contributed to the same factor for rheumatoid arthritis, helping to elucidate the shared etiology with periodontal conditions.
title: A scalable variational approach to characterize pleiotropic components across thousands of human diseases and complex traits using GWAS summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs1383063 was identified as a strong predictor of End-Stage Renal Disease (ESRD), particularly prevalent in 30% of the population regardless of ancestry. It was found to be associated with the gene MAGI-1, expressed in the podocyte slit diaphragm, and its presence, especially in older males, was linked to higher risks of progression to ESRD.
title: Multimodal predictions of end stage chronic kidney disease from asymptomatic individuals for discovery of genomic biomarkers

finding: Fine-mapped as a missense variant associated with height in Japanese populations.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: Stop-gained variant found linked to height in Finnish populations.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs73082362 was identified as the most significant SNP associated with anorexia nervosa, demonstrating a strong correlation with the genetically predicted mRNA expression of the gene WDR6. This finding contributed to the identification of risk factors for anorexia nervosa and was included in the analysis of genes associated with the disorder.
title: Multiomic prioritisation of risk genes for anorexia nervosa

finding: Associated with proteinuria, rs4241542 was linked to RARB, presenting another genetic connection in the context of preeclamptic pregnancy.
title: Clotting factor genes are associated with preeclampsia in high altitude pregnant women in the Peruvian Andes

finding: This SNP was identified as a genome-wide significant locus for long sleep duration across multiple populations, with a p-value of 1.24×10−8. Its effects were consistent in primary studies.
title: Genome-wide association study investigating short and long sleep duration: a cross-population meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs9867455 was identified as a novel Alzheimer’s disease (AD) risk locus near the gene TRANK1, with a genome-wide significance (P<sub>RE</sub>=3.49E-08) and a beta coefficient (β<sub>RE</sub>=-0.0424). This locus also showed moderate linkage disequilibrium with another SNP associated with bipolar disorder I, indicating potential cross-disease relevance.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis and fine-mapping in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs9837978 was also identified as a novel AD risk locus near the gene VWA5B2, with genome-wide significance (P<sub>RE</sub>=3.75E-08) and a beta coefficient (β<sub>RE</sub>=-0.0526). Although nominal significance was observed in an East Asian dataset (P=0.048), the effect direction was inconsistent with initial findings.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis and fine-mapping in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs17217831-A in the CCR3 gene exhibited significant natural selection signals in sub-Saharan Africans, with high iHS (Standardized iHS = 2) and XP-EHH (Standardized XP-EHH = 2.5). This allele showed a declining trend from 23% frequency 1500 years ago to 6% at present, suggesting natural selection against the critically-ill COVID-19 risk allele.
title: Critically-ill COVID-19 susceptibility gene CCR3 shows natural selection in sub-Saharan Africans

finding: The SNP rs13086063, located upstream of CCR3, showed the most significant selection signal with a standardized iHS of 6.31, exceeding the 99.97% quantile of the whole genome.
title: Critically-ill COVID-19 susceptibility gene CCR3 shows natural selection in sub-Saharan Africans

finding: The SNP rs3091311 in the CCR3 gene demonstrated a top standardized XP-EHH of 2.57, which is above the 99% quantile of the whole genome standardized XP-EHH.
title: Critically-ill COVID-19 susceptibility gene CCR3 shows natural selection in sub-Saharan Africans

finding: This intergenic variant was linked to immune regulatory processes, potentially influencing skin cancer development through its association with CCR5.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: Highly linked with rs9818780 concerning sunburn response, further demonstrating its role in skin cancer risks.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: The variant rs7614709 was associated with a maximum proportion of variance explained by a pQTL of 65% for Death-associated protein 1 (DAP) in African ancestry.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: This variant was determined to have the largest effect in the study, associated with vascular endothelial growth factor D protein (VEGF-D).
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: The variant rs2246888 was associated with VEGF-D levels and had implications in chronic kidney disease.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: Associated with atrial fibrillation (AF) and LRIG1, with a notable role in drug targeting for AF risk.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: The SNP rs7634389, associated with decreased ST6GAL1 expression, correlated with lower N-sialylation in many derived traits. Its strong linkage with lead SNPs provided insights into the N-sialylation's role in IgA nephropathy.
title: The genetics and epidemiology of N- and O- IgA glycomics

finding: Similar to rs75172324, rs62280366 was negatively associated with IBS-C (aOR=0.64, 95% CI=0.46-0.88), corroborating the potential role in diarrhea susceptibility.
title: Genetic Variants in Carbohydrate Digestive Enzyme and Transport Genes Associated with Risk of Irritable Bowel Syndrome

finding: For the SNP rs4443214, a significant finding was reported in association with COVID-19 hospitalization in SLE patients, with a meta P-value of 2.24×10−57.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs2290859 was found in the context of shared genetic loci for SLE and SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs6280 in the DRD3 gene was a critical component of the DGRS, which related to the modulation of dopamine signaling relevant to ICBs in Parkinson’s disease patients. The findings indicated a relationship between high DGRS and a lower incidence of ICBs, which escalated with prolonged exposure to dopamine agonists.
title: Performance on the Balloon Analogue Risk Task and Anticipatory Response Inhibition Task is Associated with Severity of Impulse Control Behaviours in People with Parkinson’s Disease

finding: Located on the p-arm of chromosome 3, this SNP was identified as the most strongly associated new locus for ADHD-CUD, with an OR of 1.05, standard error (s.e.) of 0.006, and a P-value of 1.79×10^-15. It was linked to numerous genes via functional genomics data.
title: Disentangling the shared genetics of ADHD, cannabis use disorder and cannabis use and prediction of cannabis use disorder in ADHD

finding: This SNP was found intragenic in CADM2 on chromosome 3 and was the second most strongly associated new locus for ADHD-CUD, with an OR of 1.05, s.e. 0.006, and a P-value of 6.93×10^-14.
title: Disentangling the shared genetics of ADHD, cannabis use disorder and cannabis use and prediction of cannabis use disorder in ADHD

finding: Located intragenic in CADM2, this SNP was the most strongly associated concordant locus in the ADHD-CU analysis, with an OR of 1.06, s.e. 0.007, and P-value of 7.82×10^-16. It is linked to sensation-seeking behaviors.
title: Disentangling the shared genetics of ADHD, cannabis use disorder and cannabis use and prediction of cannabis use disorder in ADHD

finding: The rs3197999 locus reflected an average of 1.46 genes per risk locus, with multiple genes showing strong evidence for involvement in inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) related pathogenic mechanisms.
title: Integrated cell type-specific analysis of blood and gut identifies matching eQTL for 140 IBD risk loci and entrectinib as possible repurposing candidate

finding: The rs7652296 variant in the 3p11.1 region was linked with intelligence and was notably associated with connectivity in temporal and parietal areas, further supporting the parieto-frontal integration theory of intelligence.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The rs2279829 variant in the 3q24 region was associated with risk-taking behaviors and exhibited strong genetic effects within the frontoparietal, cingulo-opercular, and default mode networks.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The rs6762267 variant in the 3p12.1 region was related to psychological traits, particularly risk-taking behaviors, and demonstrated its influence across frontal areas in network interactions.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The rs387907272 variant, a loss of function (LoF) variant in MYD88, was significantly associated with leukemia and non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (NHL), indicating its role in immune response signaling pathways.
title: Exome-wide association studies discover germline mutation patterns and identify high-risk populations in human cancers

finding: The variant rs6802753 near ZBTB38 was associated with CD, with an odds ratio of 1.28 (95%CI 1.18 to 1.38, P_meta = 4.45 × 10⁻¹⁰). ZBTB38 has pleiotropic effects on various human traits, underlining its potential role as a causal gene for CD.
title: Regulatory Variants on the Leukocyte Immunoglobulin-Like Receptor Gene Cluster are Associated with Crohn’s Disease and Interact with Regulatory Variants for TAP2

finding: The variant rs6440008 was implicated as a proxy for the lead CD-risk variant rs6802753 in high LD and known as an eQTL associated with the upregulation of ZBTB38, further supporting its role in CD susceptibility.
title: Regulatory Variants on the Leukocyte Immunoglobulin-Like Receptor Gene Cluster are Associated with Crohn’s Disease and Interact with Regulatory Variants for TAP2

finding: The rs10513789 variant at the MCCC1 locus emerged as one of the top signals for PAR estimates in African/African Admixed, European, and East Asian ancestry groups in connection with PD.
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases

finding: Identified as novel and located in a regulatory region (UTR3), this SNP was assumed to potentially influence gene expression related to mood instability and alcohol use.
title: Genetic overlap between mood instability and alcohol-related phenotypes suggests shared biological underpinnings

finding: The SNP rs9815930 within the MST1R intronic locus displayed robust causal effects on pain intensity, suggesting its significant role in chronic pain genetics.
title: The genetic architecture of pain intensity in a sample of 598,339 U.S. veterans

finding: The SNP rs2247036 was in a credible set associated with pain intensity, implicating it in the genetic architecture of chronic pain.
title: The genetic architecture of pain intensity in a sample of 598,339 U.S. veterans

finding: The low-frequency missense variant rs75495843 (MAF=3.0%) was associated with an increased risk of sebaceous cysts, showing an odds ratio (OR) of 3.17 for women compared to 2.22 for men, indicating a significant sexual dimorphic effect.
title: Genetic architecture and shared mechanisms of common ‘neglected’ diseases

finding: This SNP, located between SLC4A7 and EOMES on 3p24.1, was significantly associated with MacTel (P=5.6×10^-9), contributing to the understanding of metabolic dysregulation in the disease.
title: Identification of genetic factors influencing metabolic dysregulation and retinal support for MacTel, a retinal disorder

finding: Located at 3p21.31 within the glycine transporter gene SLC6A20, this SNP was associated with a significant risk for MacTel (P=6.2×10^-10), highlighting its metabolic implications.
title: Identification of genetic factors influencing metabolic dysregulation and retinal support for MacTel, a retinal disorder

finding: Identified as being proximal to TFRC, this novel SNP had a significance of 4.47×10⁻⁹ and was implicated in cellular iron uptake, indicating a critical genetic factor in brain iron regulation.
title: Hemochromatosis Neural Archetype Reveals Iron Disruption in Motor Circuits

finding: Another SNP proximal to TFRC, it was associated with serum transferrin and total iron binding capacity but differentiated in its effects on central versus systemic iron levels.
title: Hemochromatosis Neural Archetype Reveals Iron Disruption in Motor Circuits

finding: Located intronically within CPHL1P, this SNP demonstrated a significance of 9.82×10⁻¹³ and was linked to iron transport in intestines, where mutations have been associated with sex-linked anemia.
title: Hemochromatosis Neural Archetype Reveals Iron Disruption in Motor Circuits

finding: The SNP rs2071044 was located within the gene body of SFMBT1. IsoTWAS’s analysis showed strong association of the isoform ENST00000492146 with schizophrenia risk (adjusted P = 1.14 × 10^-6). Previous studies linked decreased expression of SFMBT1 to increased risk for both schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
title: Isoform-level transcriptome-wide association uncovers extensive novel genetic risk mechanisms for neuropsychiatric disorders in the human brain

finding: This SNP was associated with several clinical conditions including osteoarthritis, hypertension, and bipolar disorders, demonstrating its relevance in health outcomes.
title: An atlas of genetic regulation and disease associations of microRNAs

finding: The SNP rs3915166 was uniquely associated with the CD80 gene in naïve CD4+ T cells, which are related to T cell signal response and activation pertinent to lupus.
title: Hypomethylation of miR-17-92 cluster in lupus T cells and no significant role for genetic factors in the lupus-associated DNA methylation signature

finding: The SNP rs13069868 in SLC9A9 demonstrated association with both GSD and GSND, contributing to the broader understanding of genetic factors affecting grip strength, particularly in the context of the analyzed cohorts.
title: A GWAS for grip strength in cohorts of children – advantages of analysing young participants for this trait

finding: The novel locus at 3q29 with SNP rs62284390 was associated with cleft lip with or without cleft palate (CL/P) in the Pittsburgh Orofacial Cleft (Pitt-OFC) multiethnic study, demonstrating its significance as a genetic risk factor for OFCs.
title: Genome-wide association study of multiethnic non-syndromic orofacial cleft families identifies novel loci specific to family and phenotypic subtypes

finding: The variant rs73064425:T in LZTFL1 was identified as the strongest association for COVID-19 hospitalization when compared to COVID-19 negative or unknown controls, with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 7%, an odds ratio (OR) of 1.37, and a significant p-value of 1×10^-11.
title: Common genetic variants identify targets for COVID-19 and individuals at high risk of severe disease

finding: The variant rs2531743:G near SLC6A20 showed a nominally significant association in COVID-19 positive vs. COVID-19 negative individuals, with a MAF of 42%, an OR of 0.94, and a p-value of 2×10^-6, indicating potential risk modulation.
title: Common genetic variants identify targets for COVID-19 and individuals at high risk of severe disease

finding: The genotype frequency of rs1179252680 showed a statistically significant difference, with an increased risk linked to vascular endothelial dysfunction. Specifically, the data indicated an odds ratio greater than 1 for this SNP.
title: The Mechanism of Vascular Endothelial Dysfunction Induced by Ferroptosis Mediated by NARFL Knockout

finding: The SNP rs75174029, an intronic variant in the FOXP1 gene, was identified as a novel association with mood/anxiety disorders. It displayed significant regulatory roles during neural development, being the most likely causal variant within its locus. The finding was supported by chromatin interaction data, highlighting its role in enhancer activity of FOXP1.
title: Combining Transdiagnostic and Disorder-Level GWAS Enhances Precision of Psychiatric Genetic Risk Profiles in a Multi-Ancestry Sample

finding: The SNP rs7652704 was identified as a novel association related to mood/anxiety disorders, functioning as an eQTL for NECTIN3. Its regulatory role was suggested by chromatin interactions with both NECTIN3 and BTLA, indicating a potential influence on stress responses.
title: Combining Transdiagnostic and Disorder-Level GWAS Enhances Precision of Psychiatric Genetic Risk Profiles in a Multi-Ancestry Sample

finding: Carriers of the rs138043992 variant in the KIF15 gene from the FinnGen FinnIPF study demonstrated early disease onset and progression in IPF. This finding suggested a significant role of this variant in the clinical course of the disease.
title: Rare variants and survival of patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The rs35731912 variant was associated with severe COVID-19 at the chr3:45848457:C:T locus, indicating increased risk among those aged 41-60 with a genome-wide significance (P=2.15×10^-23, OR=2.20).
title: Detailed stratified GWAS analysis for severe COVID-19 in four European populations

finding: Associated with AUD, this novel intergenic variant near NICN1 has links to depression and intelligence.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: The study reported that homozygous carriers of rs36006402 exhibited lower axial length (AL) growth compared to wild-type individuals, with a significant association indicated by an odds ratio (OR) of 4.8 and a p-value of 0.0003. This SNP is located in the intronic region of the SLC7A14 gene, which is implicated in retinal development and visual function.
title: Associations between RetNet gene polymorphisms and efficacy of orthokeratology for myopia control : sample from a clinical retrospective study

finding: This SNP was associated with severe COVID-19, showing an odds ratio of 1.15 in the new analysis compared to 1.9 reported previously by Pairo-Castineira et al. It was located in the 3p21.31 locus, which has been validated in studies using population controls.
title: Genetic associations with severe COVID-19

finding: The association of this SNP with severe COVID-19 was corroborated, with an odds ratio of 1.17 in the current study versus 2.1 from Pairo-Castineira et al. Like rs71325088, this SNP was also found within the 3p21.31 locus.
title: Genetic associations with severe COVID-19

finding: Linked to traits modifying cardiovascular function such as height and body mass index, this variant was found to be significant.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: This SNP was previously linked to body mass index, showing significance within the context of cardiovascular health.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: The rs13069079 SNP was identified as a lead variant within the FYCO1 gene, which was associated with hospitalized COVID-19 patients. This finding indicated the potential influence of this locus on hospitalization due to COVID-19.
title: Exome-wide association study to identify rare variants influencing COVID-19 outcomes: Results from the Host Genetics Initiative

finding: The SNP rs1501299 located in the ADIPOQ gene was identified as being associated with lower levels of serum adiponectin. This result suggested a protective effect against Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome (PCOS) in a Jordanian population. The finding correlated well with the overall observations that indicated altered levels of circulating adipokines in non-obese PCOS patients.
title: Circulating adipokines in non-obese PCOS patients: a systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: The rs35677470 variant in DNASE1L3, which presents as a missense mutation (p.Arg206Cys), was found to significantly affect cfDNA properties. It increased the size of cfDNA fragments, lowered cfDNA concentrations, altered the distribution of cleave-site motifs, and increased the fraction of circulating fetal DNA during pregnancy. This variant had clinical implications for non-invasive prenatal testing (NIPT), as it raised the odds of inconclusive results and impaired sensitivity by causing predictors to overestimate the fetal fraction.
title: Cell-Free DNA GWAS Reveals Importance of p.Arg206Cys in DNASE1L3 for Non-Invasive Testing

finding: The rs4855883 genetic variant in the regulatory region of the APEH gene was identified as a predictive factor for radiotherapy-induced oral mucositis and overall survival in head and neck cancer patients, linking gene regulation to clinical outcomes in response to RT.
title: Systematic Review of Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Acute Pain and Relevant Acute Toxicities Induced by Radiotherapy for Head and Neck Cancer

finding: SNP rs61744388, a missense variant overlapping the ULK4 gene, was significant in the association with aortic valve regurgitation fraction, linking it to blood pressure regulation mechanisms.
title: Genetic architecture of cardiac dynamic flow volumes

finding: The lead SNP rs2352974 was identified as a novel locus associated with PTSD specifically in the cingulate cortex (CG) and uncus (UNC). It was mapped to the \'TRAIP\' gene, which is linked to DNA damage repair processes. The findings suggested a significant relationship between PTSD and white matter damage due to the function of TRAIP in cell replication.
title: The genetic relationships between post-traumatic stress disorder and its corresponding neural circuit structures

finding: Similar to rs2388334, this SNP was also reported for the first time in association with autism and was part of the twelve associations validated in prior studies.
title: Exploring autism and autism co-occurring condition associations to elucidate multivariate genetic mechanisms and insights

finding: Found near the MFSD1 gene, this SNP also reached genome-wide significance (p = 4.5 × 10^-8) and demonstrated an increased hazard ratio for depression associated with stressful life events.
title: Genome-wide by environment interaction study of stressful life events and hospital-treated depression in the iPSYCH2012 sample

finding: The SNP rs9809798 was identified as one of four male genome-wide significant SNPs for CRF-vo2max, showing strong associations in the combined sample with no evidence of heterogeneity, correlating with rs6801957 (r²=0.79).
title: The genetic case for cardiorespiratory fitness as a clinical vital sign and the routine prescription of physical activity in healthcare

finding: This SNP was identified as a genome-wide significant (GWS) variant in neuroticism with a substantial sample size of approximately 73,000 individuals.
title: A genome-wide investigation into the underlying genetic architecture of personality traits and overlap with psychopathology

finding: The variant rs61758195 (MME c.1188+428A>G) was identified as a homozygous variant in two affected individuals of Family 1, leading to a pathogenic loss-of-function associated with recessive Charcot-Marie-Tooth Neuropathy (CMT). The deep intronic variant created a novel splice donor site and resulted in the inclusion of an 83 bp pseudoexon, leading to a coding frameshift and premature termination codon. It was significant for being the first report of a pathogenic deep intronic variant causing CMT, highlighting the need for reassessment of individuals with CMT for such variants.
title: A deep intronic variant in MME causes autosomal recessive Charcot-Marie-Tooth neuropathy through aberrant splicing

finding: The SNP rs11708828 within the MOBP region showed a significant association with PSP, providing a p-value of 7.04 × 10^-12 and a beta of -0.35.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: Associated with ECC, this SNP also showed generalization in the GLIDE-children cohort examining caries in primary teeth with an effect allele frequency of 0.20 and P=0.02, thus linking it to pediatric dental health.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-Wide Association Study of Early Childhood Caries

finding: The SNP rs13080752 in LPP was significantly associated with mLOX, indicating a potential link between this locus and autoimmune diseases like celiac disease.
title: Population analyses of mosaic X chromosome loss identify genetic drivers and widespread signatures of cellular selection

finding: The SNP rs2371109 located in the EOMES gene associated with rheumatoid arthritis was found to also correlate with mLOX susceptibility.
title: Population analyses of mosaic X chromosome loss identify genetic drivers and widespread signatures of cellular selection

finding: The missense variant rs575892658 in the GORASP1 gene was linked to improved audiometric thresholds in carriers, and GORASP1 was also highlighted as contributing to Metabolic hearing loss in the TwinsUK outlier analysis.
title: Accurate phenotypic classification and exome sequencing allow identification of novel genes and variants associated with adult-onset hearing loss

finding: The SNP rs13092193 was associated with the prognosis of acute ischemic stroke (AIS) patients who had cancer. In a study referenced from a national inpatient sample, findings suggested that this SNP could influence the outcomes and mortality rates in patients undergoing endovascular thrombectomy (EVT) for large vessel occlusions (LVO), particularly highlighting that patients with active cancer had significantly higher mortality rates. This context emphasized the relevance of the SNP in the clinical management of stroke patients with underlying malignancies.
title: Does malignancy status effect outcomes in patients with large vessel occlusion stroke and cancer that underwent endovascular thrombectomy?

finding: The SNP rs6769789 was recognized as an xQTL affecting multiple genes on chromosome 3 and was associated with colocalization to SCZ GWAS. Its pleiotropic effects contributed to the complexity of gene-trait associations around this locus.
title: Cross-ancestry, cell-type-informed atlas of gene, isoform, and splicing regulation in the developing human brain

finding: The SNP rs58322641 was found to be associated with increased genetic risk of CHIP, which was inversely related to the odds of developing Alzheimer's disease (AD). The statistical analysis indicated an odds ratio of 0.92 per 1 log-odds increase in risk of CHIP, suggesting a protective role against AD.
title: Clonal hematopoiesis is associated with protection from Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs1799864 SNP variant in the CCR2 gene was identified in 8 COVID-19 patients, suggesting its potential role in conferring protection against HIV.
title: Clinical and molecular characterization of COVID-19 hospitalized patients

finding: The rs1800940 variant in the CCR5 gene was found in one patient, indicating its involvement in protection against HIV.
title: Clinical and molecular characterization of COVID-19 hospitalized patients

finding: The intronic variant rs1520483 in LTF was associated with an increased risk of HPV(+) OPC, with an OR of 1.23 (95% CI: 1.14, 1.32; p=2.19×10^-8).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: This SNP was associated with FOXP1 and related to intraocular pressure and vertical cup-disc ratio, having been identified as a significant GWAS hit for ocular traits.
title: Multi-omic spatial effects on high-resolution AI-derived retinal thickness

finding: At the rs1801725 locus in the CASR gene, the TT genotype was associated with higher circulating total and ionized calcium levels. This variant was linked to increased risks of secondary malignancies in patients of European descent, particularly respiratory organs and bone. Additionally, it correlated with deficiencies in humoral immunity, underscoring its role in the progression of breast, prostate, and skin cancers.
title: Calcium-Sensing Receptor Polymorphisms at rs1801725 are Associated with Increased Risk of Secondary Malignancies

finding: SNP rs62250713 was found to be an intronic variant in CADM2 and was associated with all four SUTs studied in the MTAG analysis.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The rs710521 SNP was correlated with an increased risk of developing low-risk urinary bladder cancers and was frequently mentioned in several studies.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: The SNP rs7613360 was identified in a large genome-wide association study (GWAS) involving 38,691 individuals with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and 186,843 controls. This SNP was one of the 27 genome-wide significant loci found, contributing to the genetic architecture of ADHD, which involved several brain-specific neuronal subtypes.
title: Genome-wide analyses of ADHD identify 27 risk loci, refine the genetic architecture and implicate several cognitive domains

finding: Similar to rs7613360, the SNP rs2311059 was also identified as a significant locus in the ADHD GWAS. It was located close to rs7613360 and was associated with ADHD, indicating its role in the genetic predisposition to this disorder, particularly affecting brain function.
title: Genome-wide analyses of ADHD identify 27 risk loci, refine the genetic architecture and implicate several cognitive domains

finding: The SNP rs61176331 showed a strong association with HDP, with a lead odds ratio of 3.09 (95% CI: 2.11, 4.53; P=7.97×10^-9).
