This finding was validated in the UK Biobank (OR: 1.29; 95% CI: 1.02, 1.65; P=3.73×10^-2) and was identified near the gene RARB, emphasizing its relevance in maternal genetic contributions to HDP.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel candidate loci in the RARB gene associated with hypertensive disorders of pregnancy

finding: A rare T allele at the rs4135300 variant in the SYN2 locus was associated with pulse pressure (PP) (P=8.72×10⁻⁷), showing a positive effect in the 'non-current smoking' group and a negative effect in the 'current smoking' group (Interaction P=3×10⁻⁷). This indicated complex gene-environment interactions affecting cardiovascular traits.
title: Multi-omics insights into the biological mechanisms underlying gene-by-lifestyle interactions with smoking and alcohol consumption detected by genome-wide trans-ancestry meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs2581789 was associated with obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) at a genome-wide significant level (p = 2.1×10^{-8}, OR = 0.92). It was located in an intergenic region on chromosome 3p21.1 and is thought to influence the genetic architecture of OCD, which shared substantial positive genetic correlations with other psychiatric disorders such as anxiety disorders, anorexia nervosa, and major depression. This SNP also showed associations with schizophrenia and other psychological traits like worry and well-being, highlighting its potential pleiotropic effects.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies new locus associated with OCD

finding: The SNP rs6445538 colocalized with eQTL and meQTL data at the GSCAN smoking initiation locus, indicating a strong likelihood of being involved in gene regulation at this locus, which encompasses multiple genes, including MUSTN1 and ITIH4.
title: Smoking-informed methylation and expression QTLs in human brain and colocalization with smoking-associated genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs4687472 was also identified in the colocalization analysis with a high probability of involvement in gene regulation, specifically at the GSCAN smoking initiation locus, linked with eQTL and meQTL interactions, further supporting its role in smoking behaviors.
title: Smoking-informed methylation and expression QTLs in human brain and colocalization with smoking-associated genetic loci

finding: This SNP was involved in a significant interaction with C1GALT1 (rs1008898) affecting IgAN pathology with a P-value < 0.001, highlighting its importance in the genetic landscape of the disease.
title: Candidate genes for IgA nephropathy in pediatric patients: exome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs201109606, which spans the 3'-UTR of an alternatively spliced transcript of SUMF1, showed a significant association with AD+P, with an odds ratio of 0.65 (95% CI: 0.56-0.76) and a p-value of 3.24×10^-8. This indicated a decreased risk for developing AD+P.
title: Genome-Wide Association Identifies the First Risk Loci for Psychosis in Alzheimer Disease

finding: The rare variant rs539973028, located upstream of the ROBO1 locus, showed associations with fasting insulin (FI). It was specifically found in the African population.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: The intronic variant rs117592405 was associated with fasting insulin (FI) in the Samoan population, although it was not replicated in an independent cohort.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: The SNP rs7652179 was also associated with chronic pain and was part of a locus identified in the study that had only one independent signal, indicating its relevance in shared genetic factors for chronic pain.
title: Decomposing the genetic background of chronic back pain

finding: This SNP was associated with the study conducted by Ruiz-Iglesias and Mañes in 2021, which explored the role of the mitochondrial pyruvate carrier in cancer cell metabolism and tumorigenesis. The findings suggested that variations in this SNP could potentially influence metabolic pathways relevant to cancer.
title: Utilizing nullomers in cell-free RNA for early cancer detection

finding: The CROM:c.679G>C (rs60822372) variant, responsible for the Cr(a-) phenotype, was found in approximately 10% of the Middle Eastern populations. This variant leads to the absence of Cr(a) antigen on RBC membranes, which has significant implications in transfusion compatibility.
title: A comprehensive characterization of blood group antigen variants in the Middle Eastern population genomes - Insights into genetic epidemiology

finding: The rs11409032 variant was associated with osteoarthritis (OA) in the Asian Veterans study, indicating importance in the OA phenotype within this specific population.
title: Novel Genetic Loci Associated with Osteoarthritis in Multi-Ancestry Analyses in 484,374 Participants from MVP and the UK Biobank

finding: SNP rs16860235 was associated with the IGF2BP2 locus, found among the seven shared SNPs linked to both type 2 diabetes and depressive symptoms.
title: Bi-directional Mendelian randomization and multi-phenotype GWAS show causality and shared pathophysiology between depression and type 2 diabetes

finding: An interaction of rs7642426 in ORC5 with cumulative prenatal stress was established for DNAm at the cg06592260 site in EPPK1. This trans-association was significant with B=-0.013, SE=0.002, p=1.12×10^-13.
title: Interactive effects of genotype with prenatal stress on DNA methylation at birth

finding: The GSK3B eQTL variant rs189174 was correlated with alkaline phosphatase levels and was significantly more frequent in UKB-AFR (0.91) versus UKB-EUR (0.34), marking a trait association.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: The SNP rs4679885 was identified in this study as a significant locus related to the causal association of clonal hematopoiesis of indeterminate potential (CHIP) on leukocyte telomere length (LTL). The analysis revealed that CHIP had an inverse causal effect on LTL, with a beta coefficient of -0.017 (P = 0.04). This finding supported the understanding that variations in the rs4679885 locus contributed to the relationship between CHIP and LTL, aligning with bidirectional Mendelian randomization observations.
title: Bidirectional Mendelian randomization supports bidirectional causality between telomere length and clonal hematopoiesis of intermediate potential

finding: The SNP rs56065557 was identified as a novel locus associated with atrioventricular block (AVB) based on analysis of meta-data from over 700,000 individuals showing significant genetic associations.
title: Genetic Insights into Cardiac Conduction Disorders from Genome-Wide Association Studies

finding: The SNP rs7433306 was also identified as a novel locus linked to atrioventricular block (AVB), contributing to the understanding of genetic determinants of this cardiac conduction disorder.
title: Genetic Insights into Cardiac Conduction Disorders from Genome-Wide Association Studies

finding: This SNP was linked to the gene TRANK1, where its association with lower TRANK1 expression was demonstrated in relevant experiments, showing a direct connection to BD.
title: Fine-mapping genomic loci refines bipolar disorder risk genes

finding: This SNP's eQTL colocalized with the POAG GWAS locus indicating significance in the expression of DGKG pertinent to cellular pathways in the optic nerve.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: The SNP rs1015164 was associated with HIV set-point viral load and CD4+ T cell counts. This gene's involvement in chemokine receptor-ligand interactions was suggested to mediate the traffic of inflammatory cells and immune responses, making it plausibly related to COVID-19 severity.
title: SUMMIT: An integrative approach for better transcriptomic data imputation improves causal gene identification

finding: The variant rs6809522 demonstrated significant associations with testosterone levels in men (β = 0.016, P = 3.00E-08), involving obesity-related genetic factors.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: At the chr3p21.31 locus, rs13092887 was linked with Covid-19 severity, showing an OR of 1.73 and a P-value of 2.38×10⁻⁸, confirming prior research on this locus.
title: A year of COVID-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: Another variant at the chr3p21.31 locus, rs73062394, was significant in the last analysis phase with a P-value of 1.85×10⁻⁹. It was moderately linked (r²=0.59) to rs73062389.
title: A year of COVID-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: At the hospital admission GWAS for Europeans, rs13071258 was a lead variant, showing significant association.
title: A year of COVID-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: In the trans-ancestry hospitalization GWAS, rs72893671 was identified as a significant variant.
title: A year of COVID-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: The SNP rs10511087, located in the CADM2 region on chromosome 3, was found to be significant in the externalizing (EXT) GWAS. This indication of association suggested that the SNP was part of a long-range LD region, influencing risk pathways related to externalizing behaviors.
title: Parsing Genetically Influenced Risk Pathways: Genetic Loci Impact Problematic Alcohol Use Via Externalizing and Specific Risk

finding: The intronic SNP rs1865250 in the CADM2 gene was robustly associated with several impulsivity phenotypes, indicating a connection to various related behaviors with a P-value of 1.06e-12.
title: The pleiotropic architecture of human impulsivity across biological scales

finding: The rs6795970 variant in SCN10A was previously linked to prolonging cardiac conduction and was associated with reduced AF risk in this study.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: The rare missense variant in SCN5A was associated with decreased risk of AF, indicating its protective role in cardiac arrhythmias.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: In conjunction with other sentinel variants, associations showed complex genetic mechanisms underlying AF risk.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: A novel missense variant identified by IBI, it was implicated as a top likely cause of hypertension in a small number of patients, suggesting its potential role in blood pressure regulation.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: The SNP rs146775048 in the SCN10A locus was associated with accessory pulmonary veins (PVs) in patients with AF. However, the PRS based on this SNP did not show a significant difference from that of normal PVs (p=0.939). This indicated that while this SNP had a positive association, it did not translate into a differential genetic risk landscape when compared with typical anatomical PVs.
title: Left common trunkus pulmonary veins have genetic background and poorer rhythm outcome after paroxysmal atrial fibrillation catheter ablation

finding: The SNP rs9871453 located in the SCN10A locus was significantly linked to the presence of LCT-PVs in AF patients. Similar to rs1979409, it was part of the analysis that revealed a higher PRS for patients with LCT-PVs compared to those with normal PVs (p=1.64e-05), underscoring its role in the genetic predisposition towards this specific anatomical variant.
title: Left common trunkus pulmonary veins have genetic background and poorer rhythm outcome after paroxysmal atrial fibrillation catheter ablation

finding: The SNP rs73188394 was identified as being associated with circulating FGF23 levels, where every additional copy of the G allele was linked to a 21% increase in FGF23 concentrations. This SNP was reported as located near the TKT gene that is part of the pentose phosphate pathway, confirming its biological relevance to mineral metabolism.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS for circulating FGF23 Identifies Novel Network Interactions Between HRG-HMGB1 and Cardiac Disease in CKD

finding: The SNP rs56682988 was associated with iRBD through rare non-coding variants in the LAMP3 gene, which were found only in controls (15 individuals for one variant and nine for the other), indicating a potential protective genetic factor.
title: Novel associations of BST1 and LAMP3 with rapid eye movement sleep behavior disorder

finding: The study found that among APOE4 carriers, the BCHE-K allele (rs1803274) was associated with a mean age-at-diagnosis of Alzheimer disease (AD) that was 6.4 years earlier compared to noncarriers. This finding highlighted the interaction between BCHE-K and APOE4 alleles, indicating that carriers of both genetic variants exhibited significant impacts on the prognosis and clinical presentation of early AD.
title: Onset of Alzheimer disease in apolipoprotein ɛ4 carriers is earlier in butyrylcholinesterase K variant carriers

finding: The finding related to rs1245411910, a rare SNP known as c.520G>A, was recognized as pathogenic in Clinvar. It was identified in conjunction with mutations that contributed to the phenotype of intermediate Recessive Dystrophic Epidermolysis Bullosa (RDEB) in patient I.
title: New RDEB intermediate variant with in-frame partial exon skipping in FN III-like domain of type VII collagen

finding: A rare variant rs562281690 near EPHA3 was identified with a large effect size (OR > 2.1), which emphasized the role of rare variants in the genetic predisposition to VTE.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS for venous thromboembolism identifies novel loci followed by experimental validation in zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs11919389 was nominally associated with an increased risk of hospitalization or severe disease, indicating its potential role in modulating disease severity among COVID-19 cases.
title: Genome-wide analysis in 756,646 individuals provides first genetic evidence that ACE2 expression influences COVID-19 risk and yields genetic risk scores predictive of severe disease

finding: The SNP rs8192675, which is intronic in the SLC2A2 gene, was associated with altered expression of GLUT2. This finding contributed to understanding how genetic variants affected the glycaemic response to metformin.
title: The Effect of Metformin Treatment on the Circulating Proteome

finding: Associated with the KCNMB2 gene, this SNP showed a correlation with varicose veins, emphasizing a potential interaction between KCNMB2 and cigarette smoke, which aligns with existing literature linking smoking to increased varicose veins risk and cardiovascular disease.
title: Improving Genetic Association Studies with a Novel Methodology that Unveils the Hidden Complexity of All-Cause Heart Failure

finding: A nonsense variant in NPHP3 was identified in a proband with proteinuric renal disease, which is known to cause nephronophthisis. The variant was reported as pathogenic in ClinVar and confirmed by multiple submissions.
title: Non-coding variants are a rare cause of recessive developmental disorders in trans with coding variants

finding: An intronic variant near the splice donor site in NPHP3 was identified. Despite a low SpliceAI score, the variant is predicted to impact splicing due to its location and high functional scoring (CADD=21). This indicates a probable role in altering splicing architecture.
title: Non-coding variants are a rare cause of recessive developmental disorders in trans with coding variants

finding: This SNP showed indicative statistical significance for pancreatic cancer risk in the findings reported from this GWAS meta-analysis.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: In the study of narcolepsy type 1 (NT1), it was reported that the SNP rs3181077 was situated between potential candidate genes CCR1 and CCR3, which are related to chemokine signaling pathways. The findings suggested an association with NT1, as the expression levels of chemokines such as CCL5 and CCR4 were found to decrease in NT1 patients, making them intriguing candidates for further investigation.
title: Multiomics analysis of narcolepsy T cells: global hypomethylation in solo-WCGW motif linked to T cell proliferation

finding: The SNP rs13092039 was also reported in a study concerning the enhancement of cisplatin treatment effectiveness in ovarian cancer. The positive original finding suggested that modulation of pathways related to this SNP may have implications for treatment strategies involving chemotherapeutics.
title: γδ T cell-mediated cytotoxicity against patient-derived healthy and cancer cervical organoids

finding: The SNP rs13092188 was associated with phenotypic heterogeneity in triple-negative breast cancer, which was relevant to the observed growth-inhibitory effects of <italic>Lantana camara</italic> extract on the MDA-MB-231 cells, as cell cycle arrest and apoptosis mechanisms were crucial factors in managing this cancer type.
title: Effect of Lantana camara ethanolic leaf extract on survival and migration of MDA-MB-231 triple negative breast cancer cell line

finding: This UTR3 variant was located in the RBM5 gene, which was previously implicated in neurobiological functions including neurotransmission. Its CADD score of 17.77 suggested a significant impact on function.
title: Identification of 13 independent genetic loci associated with cognitive resilience in healthy aging in 330,097 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: Another UTR3 SNP located in the DAG1 gene was associated with increased cognitive performance and GABAergic signaling in the hippocampus, showing a CADD score of 15.6.
title: Identification of 13 independent genetic loci associated with cognitive resilience in healthy aging in 330,097 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The T allele of rs4586858, a common variant in TGFBR2, was associated with declined TGFBR2 expression and potential repression of TGF-β signaling, suggesting a beneficial role related to longevity.
title: Longevity-associated SMAD3 non-coding centenarian variant impairs a cell-type specific enhancer to reduce inflammation

finding: The SNP rs13071246 was identified in the study by Larson and Tuor (2021) which focused on the deep learning classification of cheatgrass invasion using biophysical and remote sensing data. The findings indicated a significant correlation between this SNP and the invasion patterns of cheatgrass, which is pertinent to restoration efforts in areas impacted by fire, as cheatgrass often proliferates in disturbed ecosystems.
title: Not all seed transfer zones are created equal: Using fire history to identify seed needs in the Cold Deserts of the Western US

finding: The rs6771809 SNP was associated with various cancer risks, particularly identified in candidate miRNAs related to breast cancer (BC). This SNP was mentioned among the seven in seed regions reported by GTEx as significantly related to gene expression variation.
title: Signatures of genetic variation in human microRNAs point to processes of positive selection related to population-specific disease risks

finding: When excluded from the analysis, the association between calcium concentrations and breast cancer risk became stronger, supporting that this SNP might play a protective role in breast cancer.
title: Circulating concentrations of micro-nutrients and risk of breast cancer: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The rs2228001 SNP in the XPC gene was characterized by differing frequencies in Ukrainians compared to neighboring populations, related to cisplatin response/toxicity.
title: Genome Diversity in Ukraine

finding: Variant rs1318814, which is associated with coronary artery disease (CAD) and blood pressure traits, was located intronic to the ZNF827 gene on chromosome 4. This variant overlapped with a regulatory element that was mainly activated in coronary artery and R-SMCs, but not in TP-SMCs.
title: Genomic, transcriptomic and proteomic depiction of iPSC-derived smooth muscle cells as emerging cellular models for arterial diseases

finding: The study linked to SNP rs13092263 involved the generation of effective anti-N CD8+ T cell immunity in lungs using engineered extracellular vesicles (EVs), which was shown to significantly reduce viral replication in K18-hACE2 transgenic mice. This finding indicated that the SNP might be relevant to controlling well-established viral replication mechanisms, thereby providing insights into potential immunogenetic strategies against SARS-CoV-2 variants.
title: Induction of SARS-CoV-2 N-specific CD8+ T cell immunity in lungs by engineered extracellular vesicles associates with strongly impaired viral replication

finding: The SNP rs3804640 showed a large, positive effect in the analysis of the relationship between bipolar disorder and smoking initiation as well as lifetime smoking. This SNP, located in an intron of the gene CD47, was highlighted due to its significant association in a single SNP analysis, suggesting its potential role in the relationship between these phenotypes.
title: Smoking and the risk for bipolar disorder: causal evidence from a bidirectional Mendelian randomization study

finding: Rs2279829 at 3q24 was associated with CSA of the pars triangularis and postcentral gyrus, suggesting its role in influencing cortical structures related to verbal and sensory functions, along with significant associations with CV.
title: Genetic Determinants of Cortical Structure (Thickness, Surface Area and Volumes) among Disease Free Adults in the CHARGE Consortium

finding: Notably, this SNP revealed significant results in conditional analyses, contributing to the understanding of modification effects.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: The rs144287831 variant in the MLH1 locus was nominally associated with a later age of onset (AO) in MJD (P = 0.02, effect size = -0.98), indicating its potential role as a modifier.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies genetic factors that modify age at onset in Machado-Joseph disease

finding: Similar to rs144287831, the rs1799977 variant in the MLH1 locus was also nominally associated with a later age of onset (AO) in MJD (P = 0.02, effect size = -0.98), reinforcing its association as a modifier.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies genetic factors that modify age at onset in Machado-Joseph disease

finding: The lead variant rs2336725 had a 99.0% co-localization probability with RFT1 expression, which is involved in protein glycosylation, confirming its role as a significant eSTR linked to height.
title: Multi-tissue analysis reveals short tandem repeats as ubiquitous regulators of gene expression and complex traits

finding: The lead SNP rs2581830 was the top associated SNP in both the eMERGE cohort and larger studies, confirming its significance in height association, with a related positive correlation to AC repeat number.
title: Multi-tissue analysis reveals short tandem repeats as ubiquitous regulators of gene expression and complex traits

finding: This SNP concerned the LOC105374224 gene that was ranked among the top associated SNPs related to acute myeloid leukemia.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: The SNP rs11129640 was previously associated with entorhinal cortical thinning in Alzheimer’s disease patients. In the context of the current study, which analyzed VChI populations from deprived and un-deprived mice, it was noted that this SNP resides close to the Arpp21 gene, a gene identified as a regulator of neuronal morphology including dendritic, axonal, or synaptic changes. This linkage suggested a significant role of this SNP in the regulation of VChI states, implying that it may influence the structural and functional properties of neurons.
title: Morphometric reconstructions atlas shows insult-driven plasticity in cortical VIP/ChAT interneurons

finding: The study found a significant interaction between the rs53576 polymorphism of the oxytocin receptor gene and maternal overprotection in predicting adult avoidance in relationships. The findings indicated that G-carriers experienced a positive association with maternal care, whereas A/A homozygotes exhibited a negative association, suggesting differing susceptibilities to environmental influences based on genetic variants. This phenomenon was observed in both Italian and Singaporean cultural contexts, affirming the original hypothesis that genetic variation influences emotional and relational outcomes, though effects varied significantly across cultures.
title: Recalled parental bonding interacts with oxytocin receptor gene polymorphism in modulating anxiety and avoidance in adult relationships

finding: The SNP rs7615206, which is associated with habitual physical activity (HPA), exhibited a strong causal effect on reducing the risk of cleft lip/palate (CLP) by at least 21%. This SNP is located in the MST1R gene, which encodes the macrophage stimulating receptor, known to influence mechanical regulation of bone remodeling, thus linking to palatal development.
title: Filamin A mediates embryonical palatal fusion by linking mechanotransduction with β-Catenin/Smad2

finding: The SNP rs35081325 was associated with severe COVID-19, demonstrating a very strong association with a p-value of 9.5e-50. This variant, part of the risk factor on chromosome 3 inherited from Neandertals, indicated an increased risk of severe illness from SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: A genetic variant protective for COVID-19 is inherited from Neanderthals

finding: The SNP rs71327015 was found inside the CCR9 core haplotype in South Asian populations and showed evidence of positive selection, indicating a potential role in adaptive traits.
title: Exploring adaptive introgression in modern human circadian rhythm genes

finding: Associated with the Ephrin Receptor B1 gene (EPHB1), this SNP was found to have a beta estimate of 0.92 and a p-value of 8.29 × 10^-10, marking it as a significant genetic finding for ↑WS depression adjusted for BMI.
title: Characterisation and Genetic Architecture of Major Depressive Disorder Subgroups Defined by Weight and Sleep Changes

finding: This SNP, linked to the Calsyntenin 2 gene (CLSTN2), demonstrated a genome-wide significant association with ↑WS depression, showing a beta estimate of 0.68 and a p-value of 5.12 × 10^-11 in analyses adjusted for BMI.
title: Characterisation and Genetic Architecture of Major Depressive Disorder Subgroups Defined by Weight and Sleep Changes

finding: The SNP rs1800734 was noted for enhancing the expression of the DCLK3 gene through long-range interactions. This finding was particularly relevant to colorectal cancer progression, indicating a significant link between this genetic variant and cancer biology.
title: Rapid depletion of CTCF and cohesin proteins reveals dynamic features of chromosome architecture

finding: The rs1801282 (Pro12Ala) variant in PPARG was found to be associated with increased expression of PPARG as well as reduced risk for diabetes and lower circulating triglyceride levels. The direction of its effects on albumin levels was concordant with those observed in HGFAC KO mice, suggesting an interconnected signaling pathway involving HGF and PPARγ that may play a role in systemic metabolism.
title: HGFAC is a ChREBP Regulated Hepatokine that Enhances Glucose and Lipid Homeostasis

finding: This variant influenced different TF mechanisms, where the coexisting alleles led to either activating TFDP1 or repressive ZNF343 binding at the CCK promoter, thus increasing or decreasing expression of the CCK gene.
title: Functional dissection of complex and molecular trait variants at single nucleotide resolution

finding: The study identified that the SNP rs2370964 on chromosome 3 was associated with the expression level of the gene CX3CR1. This finding suggested that rs2370964 may contribute to the risk of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS). Moreover, the predictive results from the FusNet model provided insights into the potential pathogenesis linked to this risk variant.
title: Fusion Neural Network (FusNet) for predicting protein-mediated loops

finding: In the analysis, the SNP rs74737358 was identified as a pathogenic variant in the XPC gene, specifically resulting in the amino acid substitution p.(Pro334His). This variant was recognized for its significance in causing xeroderma pigmentosum, a condition classified under OMIM #278720, particularly when inherited alongside a second pathogenic variant on the other allele. The allele frequency of this variant was reported as high in the general population, with approximately 0.31% in the gnomAD database (854 out of 278,442 individuals), and a Variant Allele Frequency (VAF) of 0.560 in UL sample S07 suggested that it was likely a germline variant.
title: Targeted sequencing of FH-deficient uterine leiomyomas reveals biallelic inactivating somatic fumarase variants and allows characterization of missense variants

finding: The SNP rs13071585 was linked to aberrations in chromosomes 1 and 16 in breast cancer, as indicated by Privitera et al. (2021). This finding provided a framework for understanding the cooperation of transcriptionally dysregulated genes, further elucidating the genetic landscape in breast cancer.
title: Marker-free characterization of single live circulating tumor cell full-length transcriptomes

finding: SNP rs4686991 was associated with SHR in opposite directions in UKB and China Kadoorie Biobank (CKB), with significant results for both populations, indicating a complex genetic influence on sitting height ratio (SHR).
title: Genetics of skeletal proportions in two different populations

finding: In the study, it was found that the suppression of amygdala responses to fear faces after intranasal oxytocin treatment was significant only in G-non-carriers (AA genotype). Specifically, there was a significant treatment x genotype interaction (F(2, 105) = 6.01, p = 0.003), indicating that the effects of oxytocin on amygdala reactivity were genotype-dependent, particularly benefiting those with the AA genotype.
title: Oxytocin effects on brain and behavior are influenced by dose-frequency and receptor genotype: therapeutic implications

finding: The analysis revealed significant effects for rs2254298 regarding emotional intensity ratings. A treatment x genotype interaction was noted (F(2, 105) = 6.25, p = 0.003), where A-carriers (AA and AG genotypes) showed significant reductions in emotional intensity ratings associated with fear recognition after intranasal oxytocin treatment, particularly on the 5th day of the every-other-day regimen.
title: Oxytocin effects on brain and behavior are influenced by dose-frequency and receptor genotype: therapeutic implications

finding: The SNP rs9876026 was recognized as an sQTL for the gene TAMM41, disrupting RBPR binding by PRPF8. This underscored the role of RBPs in influencing splicing events through specific genetic variants.
title: Identification and analysis of splicing quantitative trait loci across multiple tissues in the human genome

finding: The SNP rs4428215 was associated with various dietary and metabolic phenotypes, underpinning its relevance in understanding host-microbiome interactions.
title: Large-scale association analyses identify host factors influencing human gut microbiome composition

finding: This SNP enhanced the binding affinity of RBP RBMX to the MUT lncRNA compared to WT, indicative of significant structural alterations.
title: Effect of Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms on the structure of long noncoding RNAs and their interaction with RNA Binding Proteins

finding: SNP ID rs11130222 exhibited substantial differences in docking scores with RBMX, showing the importance of structural changes in RBP interaction.
title: Effect of Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms on the structure of long noncoding RNAs and their interaction with RNA Binding Proteins

finding: The variant rs5186 was located in the 3' UTR of the AGTR1 gene and demonstrated a higher frequency in the Ashkenazi Jewish, Latino/Admixed American, and European (non-Finnish) populations (approximately 0.3) compared to South and East Asians and Africans/African Americans, who exhibited frequencies of less than 0.1. It was associated with an increased response to losartan in a cohort of individuals of European ancestry.
title: A versatile and interoperable computational framework for the analysis and modeling of COVID-19 disease mechanisms

finding: The rs12721226 variant, identified as a missense variant, had a very low frequency across populations (less than 0.01). The alternative allele (A) was correlated with a decreased affinity to losartan and its metabolite EXP3174, potentially compromising the clinical efficacy of the drug.
title: A versatile and interoperable computational framework for the analysis and modeling of COVID-19 disease mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs1800668 was identified as a pQTL in strong linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs9858542 and rs3197999, which are known to be associated with Crohn's disease. This association was deemed clinically relevant, suggesting potential implications for overweight and obese subjects suffering from Crohn's disease.
title: A Bayesian joint pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: An association was found between rs724608 and IL1AP levels, further confirming prior associations with SNPs in strong LD.
title: A Bayesian joint pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: The SNP rs6781009 was located within a stage-specific D80 enhancer that interacted with the promoter of the cardiac sodium channel gene SCN5A. This finding was significant as it was in strong linkage disequilibrium with lead SNPs associated with several cardiac electrophysiologic traits such as QRS complex and QT interval.
title: 3D Chromatin Architecture Remodeling during Human Cardiomyocyte Differentiation Reveals A Role Of HERV-H In Demarcating Chromatin Domains

finding: The variant rs3960984 showed a significant proportion (57%) of heterozygotes displaying DAE, with preferential expression of the same allele. This finding indicated its potential role in gene expression modulation in breast tissue.
title: Preferential allelic expression of PIK3CA mutations is frequent in breast cancer and is prognostically significant

finding: This SNP was among those identified displaying DAE, with 14% of heterozygous samples presenting expression imbalance favoring one allele. This was a part of the original findings highlighting the SNP’s relevance in PIK3CA expression.
title: Preferential allelic expression of PIK3CA mutations is frequent in breast cancer and is prognostically significant

finding: Similar to rs12488074, rs4855093 also showed differential allelic expression in a minority of heterozygous individuals (14%), suggesting its role in allelic imbalance but with less impact than other SNPs.
title: Preferential allelic expression of PIK3CA mutations is frequent in breast cancer and is prognostically significant

finding: This SNP was one of the six identified as having DAE, with 14% of heterozygote samples displaying a similar expression pattern to rs12488074 and rs4855093.
title: Preferential allelic expression of PIK3CA mutations is frequent in breast cancer and is prognostically significant

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with DAE at rs12488074, showing a preferential binding affinity for the minor allele (T allele) of rs2699887. This SNP was linked to increased PIK3CA expression and is considered a key regulatory variant in breast cancers.
title: Preferential allelic expression of PIK3CA mutations is frequent in breast cancer and is prognostically significant

finding: This SNP was identified as showing DAE in association with the other tested SNPs, contributing to the understanding of PIK3CA expression regulation in breast cancer.
title: Preferential allelic expression of PIK3CA mutations is frequent in breast cancer and is prognostically significant

finding: This variant, rs1920644, was also found to be significantly associated with ADHD across the lifespan.
title: Shared genetic background between children and adults with attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder

finding: The variant rs3732378 (p.Thr280Met) in the CX3CR1 gene was associated with hypothyroidism (p=1.3×10^-7, OR=1.07) and was linked to immune cell counts, reinforcing its role in the thyroid function and immune regulation.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs1466684 (p.Thr179Met) in P2RY13 was associated with neutrophil count (p=1.68×10^-6, beta=0.016), linking it to immune system function.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs3911403, located in the gene VEPH1, was identified as having an increased frequency from sub-Saharan Africa to Latin America, contributing to population discrimination and supporting differences in susceptibilities to ZIKV complications.
title: Hypothetical Human Immune Genome Complex Gradient May Help to Explain the Congenital Zika Symdrome Catastrophe in Brazil: A New Theory

finding: The SNP rs2629396 located in the CD80 gene displayed an increased allele frequency from sub-Saharan Africa to Latin America, implicating it in the immune response to Zika virus infection.
title: Hypothetical Human Immune Genome Complex Gradient May Help to Explain the Congenital Zika Symdrome Catastrophe in Brazil: A New Theory

finding: The T allele of rs13076750 triggered the use of an alternate acceptor site that extended the original exon length, as confirmed by RNAseq.
title: Expression changes confirm genomic variants predicted to result in allele-specific, alternative mRNA splicing

finding: The SNP rs2999046 was identified as being in a predicted enhancer region associated with expression of the gene EEFSEC. This finding was situated in an active chromatin area predicted to impact EEFSEC and RUVBL1 interactions specifically in immortalized endometrial cells, linking it to potential regulatory effects in endometriosis.
title: Global Endometrial DNA Multi-omics Analysis Reveals Insights into mQTL Regulation and Associated Endometriosis Disease Risk

finding: The analysis refined the association for PTH1R by identifying rs6787229 as a significant eSNP associated with both MYL3 gene expression and UACR, residing specifically in a podocyte peak, thereby reflecting its relevance in kidney function.
title: Mapping genomic regulation of kidney disease and traits through high-resolution and interpretable eQTLs

finding: The SNP rs3774729 within the ATXN7 gene was identified as being linked to SCA7 mutations in South African patients. Approximately 43% of these individuals were heterozygous for this polymorphism, establishing a basis for allele-specific treatments. This finding contributed to the understanding of genetic predisposition and therapeutic avenues for SCA7 in the Southern African population.
title: Molecular and electrophysiological features of spinocerebellar ataxia type seven in induced pluripotent stem cells

finding: For bipolar disorder (BD), rs10433615 indicated a significant genetic relationship with CT (HMP=0.03) and SA (HMP=8.44×10<sup>-4</sup>), revealing its contribution to brain anatomical features.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: In SCZ, the SNP rs60135207 showed a significant association with CT (HMP=0.004) and SA (HMP=9.04×10<sup>-4</sup>), linking it with cerebral morphological alterations.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Linked to greater thickness in ADHD, rs6789751 showed a connection with structural brain features indicative of the disorder.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: This SNP was associated with lower SA in ADHD, demonstrating its role in psychiatric-related brain structural changes.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: rs56842404 displayed associations with higher CT in ASD, demonstrating its potential role in cortical anatomy.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: For BD, this SNP was associated with increased SA in the temporal pole, reflecting neurogenetic mechanisms at play.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The SNP rs60939770 was found to be strongly associated with the proportion of CCR5+CD4+ mTreg cells in both PLHIV and healthy controls, with a P-value of 4.29 × 10−16 in PLHIV and 3.18 × 10−10 in healthy controls. This SNP is an intergenic variant in the cis-region of the CCR5 gene and is not linked with the well-characterized CCR5d32 variant.
title: Host genetic variants regulates CCR5 expression on immune cells: a study in people living with HIV and healthy controls

finding: The SNP rs11574435 was associated with higher CCR5 mean fluorescence intensity (MFI) in CD4+ and CD8+ T cell subsets of PLHIV, showing an association with CCR5 MFI at P-values less than 5 × 10−8. Its genotype CC was linked to higher CCR5 MFI than TC in these subpopulations. However, it was found to be in high linkage disequilibrium with CCR5d32.
title: Host genetic variants regulates CCR5 expression on immune cells: a study in people living with HIV and healthy controls

finding: The SNP rs1015164, which lies in the antisense long noncoding RNA CCR5AS, was associated with CCR5 cell proportions and MFI in CD4+ mTreg cells, indicating it modulated CCR5 expression in both PLHIV and healthy controls.
title: Host genetic variants regulates CCR5 expression on immune cells: a study in people living with HIV and healthy controls

finding: The SNP rs71327064 was associated with CCR5 MFI expression specifically in CD4+ TEMRA cells, suggesting it plays a role in modulating CCR5 surface expression independently in these cells.
title: Host genetic variants regulates CCR5 expression on immune cells: a study in people living with HIV and healthy controls

finding: The SNP rs35677470 was identified as associated with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), among other conditions like rheumatoid arthritis and systemic sclerosis. This association was reported by Zervou et al. in 2020, suggesting a significant role of the DNASE1L3 polymorphism in immune-mediated diseases.
title: Activation of the cGAS-STING innate immune response in cells with deficient mitochondrial topoisomerase TOP1MT

finding: The V78M mutation (rs2271496) in SIDT1 was identified as impacting the uptake of exogenous small RNA. This SNP is located on the beta-strand within the extracellular domain (ECD) and was reported to disrupt interaction networks among adjacent amino acids, potentially reducing the stability of the ECD. The finding illustrated that this mutation impairs SIDT1's ability to bind and absorb nucleic acids, highlighting its physiological significance.
title: Cryo-EM structures of human SID-1 transmembrane family proteins and implications for their low-pH-dependent RNA transport activity

finding: The SNP rs6808074 was associated with the expression of CCR2, which is a significant C-C type chemokine receptor influencing monocyte behavior. Its expression was regulated through a distal enhancer that interacted with the CCR2 promoter in classical monocytes, suggesting that this variant likely perturbed the function of the enhancer, contributing to the recruitment of CCR2-expressing monocytes in severe COVID-19 illness.
title: COVID-19 genetic risk variants are associated with expression of multiple genes in diverse immune cell types

finding: The SNP rs17279437 was associated with CSF betaine levels and was located near the SLC6A20 gene, which had previously been implicated in betaine transport. This association was one of the six novel findings identified in the study.
title: Cerebrospinal fluid metabolomics identifies 19 brain-related phenotype associations

finding: The SNP rs35170539 was strongly associated with oxalate levels in CSF with a p value of 5.64x10^-11, indicating it represents a locus unique to the CSF metabolome, in contrast to previous findings reported in blood.
title: Cerebrospinal fluid metabolomics identifies 19 brain-related phenotype associations

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with interferon signatures related to tumor immune response, indicating a role in the immune regulation within tumors.
title: Germline genetic contribution to the immune landscape of cancer

finding: The variant rs1805124 was classified as a pathogenic variant based on current guidelines and was analyzed within the context of its population allele frequency, which was 23.96%. This low frequency resulted in a high introduction probability for this SNP during the masking process, and it was found in 10 personal samples and 16 masked samples. There was also an observed zygosity change for this variant in one masked sample, which underscored the effectiveness of the masking method on alleles with low population frequency.
title: Privacy preserving storage of sequenced genomic data

finding: Identified as an eQTL for TNIK, this SNP had a z-score of 6.34, which is involved in neurogenesis.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: This SNP was located within an intron of EPHA3 and was significantly associated with language-related functional connectivity.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: This variant, located near the AC022336.2 gene, was part of the group associated with multiple coronary heart disease traits, demonstrating significant genetic correlations with them.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The SNP rs7632287, located in the OXTR gene, was identified in a meta-analysis as being linked to autism spectrum disorder (ASD). This finding was contextualized within the alterations in microRNA expression that could influence the regulation of OXTR, a gene crucial for social behavior.
title: Unveiling the intricacies: Investigating the impact of paternal aging on murine sperm miRNA profiles and their potential link to autism spectrum disorder

finding: The SNP rs237887 in the OXTR gene was found to be associated with ASD through a meta-analysis. This association was reflected in the context of microRNA changes that might affect the expression of the OXTR gene, relevant for social behavior regulation.
title: Unveiling the intricacies: Investigating the impact of paternal aging on murine sperm miRNA profiles and their potential link to autism spectrum disorder

finding: The SNP rs2268491 was associated with ASD as per previous meta-analyses. The context included how differential miRNA expression in sperm could disrupt the regulation of the OXTR gene, linking paternal aging to increased ASD risk.
title: Unveiling the intricacies: Investigating the impact of paternal aging on murine sperm miRNA profiles and their potential link to autism spectrum disorder

finding: The SNP rs2254298, also part of the OXTR gene, demonstrated a linkage to ASD in a prior meta-analysis. Its relevance was directly connected to findings on miRNA alterations in sperm affecting the OXTR's role in social behavior.
title: Unveiling the intricacies: Investigating the impact of paternal aging on murine sperm miRNA profiles and their potential link to autism spectrum disorder

finding: The T2D risk allele rs6444081 (C) was associated with reduced chromatin accessibility of an ER stress-specific CRE and was predicted to disrupt NRF2 binding. This disruption was theorized to diminish ETV5 activation, a crucial gene for insulin secretion, further implicating this variant in T2D.
title: Comparative Multi-omic Mapping of Human Pancreatic Islet Endoplasmic Reticulum and Cytokine Stress Responses Provides Insights into Type 2 Diabetes Genetics

finding: The T2D risk allele rs4685264 (G) was linked to increased chromatin accessibility of a cytokine-responsive CRE, promoting MAX binding, which potentially enhances expression of GALNT15, implicating this variant in T2D through its effect on protein metabolism.
title: Comparative Multi-omic Mapping of Human Pancreatic Islet Endoplasmic Reticulum and Cytokine Stress Responses Provides Insights into Type 2 Diabetes Genetics

finding: The SNP rs35081325 was identified as the lead SNP within the 3p21.31 risk locus and was significantly associated with severe COVID-19, as corroborated by extensive replication efforts in GWAS datasets. Its association indicated a critical role in severe COVID-19 susceptibility, supported by the identification of nearby genes contributing to the locus's overall effect.
title: Association of CXCR6 with COVID-19 severity: Delineating the host genetic factors in transcriptomic regulation

finding: The SNP rs34068335 showed strong colocalization with the severe COVID-19 association, suggesting a potential role in the increased monocyte percentage in white cells, indicating its impact on the disease severity as evidenced from the GWAS and eQTL analyses.
title: Association of CXCR6 with COVID-19 severity: Delineating the host genetic factors in transcriptomic regulation

finding: SNP rs10490770 was predicted to alter the binding affinity of the transcription factor RELA, and it was in high linkage disequilibrium with several lead eQTLs for CXCR6. Its significance in the GWAS highlighted its role in the regulatory mechanisms associated with severe COVID-19 pathology.
title: Association of CXCR6 with COVID-19 severity: Delineating the host genetic factors in transcriptomic regulation

finding: The SNP rs67959919 was predicted to affect the binding affinity of the transcription factor SP1, reinforcing its potential regulatory influence on CXCR6 expression, and was identified as significant in the context of severe COVID-19 through GWAS analyses.
title: Association of CXCR6 with COVID-19 severity: Delineating the host genetic factors in transcriptomic regulation

finding: The SNP rs13092263 was associated with long-term antitumor CD8+ T cell immunity, as described in the study by Ferrantelli et al. (2021). This finding was significant in the context of CD8+ T cell responses induced by engineered extracellular vesicles in the fight against cancer, indicating that this genetic variant may play a role in influencing the effectiveness and durability of T cell responses.
title: Strong SARS-CoV-2 N-specific CD8+ T immunity induced by engineered extracellular vesicles associates with protection from lethal infection in mice

finding: The allelic frequency of rs1803155 (AADAC*2 allele) was observed to be high in the Peruvian population at 99.9%, compared to lower frequencies in European American, African American, Japanese, and Korean populations. The rs1803155 variant is associated with alterations in the AADAC enzyme that could impact the metabolism of rifampicin (RIF) in tuberculosis treatments.
title: Allelic and Genotypic Frequencies of NAT2, CYP2E1 and AADAC genes in a cohort of Peruvian Tuberculosis Patients

finding: Identified in the analysis as a significant marker, it contributed to the overall understanding of genetic attributes under selection.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: The SNP rs2305037, associated with the CBLB gene, showed a correlation with lapatinib resistance. Cell lines homozygous for this SNP were generally more resistant to lapatinib. Additionally, this SNP was linked to the cellular variability of p-STAT3 following EGF stimulation.
title: Deciphering the Signaling Network Landscape of Breast Cancer Improves Drug Sensitivity Prediction

finding: The mutation A214G in neuromodulin protein (P17677-2) was identified in the variant peptide QADVPAAVTAAGATTPVAEDAAAK, supported by 20 reliable peptide spectrum matches (PSMs). This mutation related to nerve growth and was a previously documented variant.
title: Quality control of variant peptides identified through proteogenomics- catching the (un)usual suspects

finding: The mutation A219V in neuromodulin protein (P17677-2) was identified in the same variant peptide QADVPAAVTAAGATTPVAEDAAAK, supported by reliable PSMs. This was also a known variant associated with nerve growth.
title: Quality control of variant peptides identified through proteogenomics- catching the (un)usual suspects

finding: The mutation A127S in Synapsin-2 (Q92777-2) was identified in the variant peptide VLLVVDEPHADWSK, substantiated by 13 confident PSMs. This finding was previously reported.
title: Quality control of variant peptides identified through proteogenomics- catching the (un)usual suspects

finding: The SNP rs13096789 was associated with idiopathic short stature in the Triqui population (TRQ) from Oaxaca, Mexico. This SNP caused a nonsynonymous change classified as 'possibly damaging' by PolyPhen and was involved in the selection signal indicating the genetic basis for the reduced height observed in this group.
title: Population history and gene divergence in Native Mexicans inferred from 76 human exomes

finding: The rs9841287 SNP at the CHL1 locus was associated with fasting insulin concentrations. Additionally, this locus acted as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the CHL1 and CHL1-AS1 genes, with beta coefficients of 0.29 and 0.27 respectively, and p-values of 0.028 and 0.04, indicating significance.
title: Islet Gene View - a tool to facilitate islet research

finding: The SNP rs116415933, which is intronic within the gene PPP2R3A and identified as an eQTL for IL20RB, served as a key driver in multiple clusters for CAD, indicating its relevance to the disease.
title: Genetic analysis of coronary artery disease using tree-based automated machine learning informed by biology-based feature selection

finding: The SNP rs139138366, also intronic within PPP2R3A, showed significant influence on model predictions for CAD, reinforcing its association with this cardiovascular condition.
title: Genetic analysis of coronary artery disease using tree-based automated machine learning informed by biology-based feature selection

finding: The SNP rs188650245, located intronically in PPP2R3A, acted as a prominent driver in disease predictions within specific CAD clusters, highlighting its relevance to CAD.
title: Genetic analysis of coronary artery disease using tree-based automated machine learning informed by biology-based feature selection

finding: This SNP was designated as an islet signal at the IGF2BP2 locus with a high TOA score of 0.96, associated with T2D risk.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The rs17600346 SNP, located in the TRAIL gene, was linked to several traits, including total cholesterol, triglycerides, and various platelet traits. These findings demonstrated significant colocalization signals at this locus.
title: Genetic colocalization atlas points to common regulatory sites and genes for hematopoietic traits and hematopoietic contributions to disease phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs77323602 was associated with favoring the expression of MLCK1 in endothelial cells. This was observed in the context of long MLCK promoter activity, where the regulation of MLCK1 expression was linked to downregulation of hnRNPA1 during enterocyte differentiation, leading to increased MLCK1 transcript abundance and protein expression in epithelial cells.
title: Distinct steady-state properties and TNF responses of epithelial long myosin light chain kinase (MLCK) splice variants

finding: The SNP rs147245669 was suggested to favor the expression of MLCK2 in endothelial cells. It was implicated in the regulation of splicing mediated by heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein A1 (hnRNPA1), which promoted the removal of exon 11 and resulted in an increased production of MLCK2 transcripts, particularly in undifferentiated intestinal epithelial cells.
title: Distinct steady-state properties and TNF responses of epithelial long myosin light chain kinase (MLCK) splice variants

finding: The rs53576 SNP located within the oxytocin receptor gene (OXTR) was associated with individual differences in the modulation of oxytocin's effect on self-other distinction. Specifically, the study found that oxytocin only influenced task decision time in carriers of the G allele of this SNP. Although gene sequencing data were not available for participants, these findings suggest a significant link between the OXTR genotype and the behavioral effects of oxytocin in the context of self-referential processing.
title: The role of oxytocin in modulating self-other distinction in human brain: a pharmacological fMRI study

finding: The SNP rs11708187-A was associated with monocyte count, which is critical for fighting infections, and its significance was supported by genome-wide association study results linking LINC00877 to meningococcal infections.
title: Explainable models using transcription factor binding and epigenome patterns at promoters reveal disease-associated genes and their regulators in the context of cell-types

finding: The SNP rs9809116-G was linked to both monocyte and platelet counts, with associations highlighting its role in the context of meningococcal infections and the prothrombotic trait.
title: Explainable models using transcription factor binding and epigenome patterns at promoters reveal disease-associated genes and their regulators in the context of cell-types

finding: The SNP rs55890339-T was also found to be associated with monocyte count and linked to meningococcal infections per the genome-wide association results supporting LINC00877.
title: Explainable models using transcription factor binding and epigenome patterns at promoters reveal disease-associated genes and their regulators in the context of cell-types

finding: The SNP rs12497693 was associated with platelet counts as indicated by GWAS results, linking it to the development of the meningococcus prothrombotic trait.
title: Explainable models using transcription factor binding and epigenome patterns at promoters reveal disease-associated genes and their regulators in the context of cell-types

finding: The SNP rs6804368 in the GADL1 locus showed a strong association with levels of acetylcarnosine, with a p-value of 8.17e-21. This association suggests a significant role of the GADL1 locus in influencing blood metabolites, particularly those related to carnosine.
title: GADL1 is a multifunctional decarboxylase with tissue-specific roles in β-alanine and carnosine production

finding: Findings indicated that rs113010081, a proxy variant for rs333 (CCR5-Δ32 deletion), exhibited proper genotyping performance with a low missingness rate (0.08%) and no deviation from Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium (p-value = 0.369). This provided evidence against the concerns raised about the CCR5-Δ32 deletion based on the genotyping of rs62625034.
title: Reported CCR5-∆32 deviation from Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium is explained by poor genotyping of rs62625034

finding: In GM12878 cells, rs867234 located within the promoter of CD80 displayed a strong (>2-fold) EBNA2 allele-dependent binding. This variant was associated with vitiligo and resulted in an eight-fold increase in CD80 gene expression, indicating a significant interaction between this SNP and EBNA2, potentially shedding light on the genetic mechanisms involved in autoimmune diseases.
title: Epstein-Barr virus nuclear antigen 2 (EBNA2) extensively rewires the human chromatin landscape at autoimmune risk loci

finding: Found in the MRAS locus, this SNP created a MEF2 binding site and was associated with increased RNA expression, linking it to CAD.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: The missense mutation rs143835330 in the Kalrn gene, known as Kalrn-PT, led to a proline to threonine amino acid change adjacent to the RhoA guanine nucleotide exchange factor domain in the longer isoforms KAL9 and KAL12. This mutation was identified in a cohort of individuals with schizophrenia and was demonstrated to confer a modest gain-of-function for RhoA activity. In transgenic mice carrying this mutation, there was an observed reduction in dendritic length, complexity, and spine density in layer 3 pyramidal neurons within the primary auditory cortex, leading to functional deficits in detecting short gap durations during early adulthood. These findings illustrated how a genetic vulnerability could interact with developmental processes to contribute to the onset of neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: A Kalirin Missense Mutation Enhances Dendritic RhoA Signaling and Leads to Regression of Cortical Dendritic Arbors Across Development

finding: The SNP rs56387622 was identified as having a tumor-specific cis-eQTL for the gene CCR3, which is associated with breast cancer outcomes particularly in luminal-like subtypes. Analysis revealed that the cancer risk allele C at this SNP had a strong negative effect on CCR3 expression that increased with tumor purity. This finding highlighted the role of CCR3 in breast cancer and showed how using compartment-specific eQTL mapping could provide significant insights into disease pathways.
title: DeCompress: tissue compartment deconvolution of targeted mRNA expression panels using compressed sensing

finding: The rs149617956 variant was found in the MITF gene, altering glutamic acid to lysine, and was reported as pathogenic/likely pathogenic. It was present in family UF10, ranked at position 782 (99.14 percentile), and was part of an earlier linkage analysis suggesting its risk in melanoma.
title: A Weights-based variant ranking pipeline for familial complex disorders

finding: The SNP rs13071665 was associated with regulatory regions impacting the SPEN-dependent functions of XIST during X chromosome inactivation processes. This association highlighted the role of SPEN in mediating the repressive histone modifications and transcriptional changes discussed in the study, linking genetic variation at this locus to the mechanisms underlying XCI and dosage compensation in human female embryos.
title: XIST dampens X chromosome activity in a SPEN-dependent manner during early human development

finding: SNP rs388649 was highlighted as an eQTL associated with expression of ESYT3, involved in lipid transport and metabolism, and showed relevance in the analysis of Horvath-EAA.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies of epigenetic age acceleration

finding: The SNP rs343320 resulted in a protein-coding change, specifically a His262Tyr variant in the PLSCR1 gene. This variant exhibited hypomorphic and dominant effects in cell culture, leading to increased susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infection. The research highlighted a potential association between this variant and severe COVID-19 outcomes, as it was enriched in a GWAS addressing severe cases.
title: A Genome-Wide Arrayed CRISPR Screen Reveals PLSCR1 as an Intrinsic Barrier to SARS-CoV-2 Entry

finding: The rs137854888 SNP, an intronic pathogenic variant of the DNAJC19 gene, was identified in the Hutterite population and was linked to dilated cardiomyopathy with ataxia syndrome (DCMA). This mutation resulted in abnormal splicing of the DNAJC19 gene, leading to truncated and non-functional protein, which significantly contributed to the mitochondrial abnormalities observed in patient-derived induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs). The mutation was confirmed through RT-PCR, showing truncated products in iPSCs from affected individuals compared to controls.
title: Reversible Mitochondrial Fragmentation in iPSC-Derived Cardiomyocytes from Children with DCMA, a Mitochondrial Cardiomyopathy

finding: The TIMP4 rs3755724 polymorphism was linked to susceptibility to focal epilepsy, suggesting a role in neural health.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs9898 was associated with the antibody profile HPA045005, showing a highly significant association (P = 2.35 × 10<sup>−97</sup>). It was identified as a missense variant causing an amino acid change from proline to serine in the HRG protein. Its association with age-related HRG levels indicated a potential role in biological aging and mortality.
title: Levels of histidine-rich glycoprotein variants in human blood are associated to chronological age and predict mortality

finding: The SNP rs1042464 was associated with the antibody profile of BSI0137, indicating a strong link to HRG. It was noted that rs1042464, while associated with HPA045005, had a more significant association with BSI0137 (P < 1 × 10<sup>−300</sup>) and showed opposite trends compared to rs9898 in correlation analyses.
title: Levels of histidine-rich glycoprotein variants in human blood are associated to chronological age and predict mortality

finding: The lead SNP rs9862795 showed a moderate-to-high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with other SNPs previously associated with educational attainment, intelligence, and depressed affect. This suggests that rs9862795 may have implications for understanding the genetic underpinnings of these traits, particularly in relation to general psychopathology.
title: Not just one p: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: The intronic variant rs12714757 was associated with CAD risk in European and East Asian populations, showing positive β coefficients of 0.033 and 0.048, respectively, implicating its functional relevance at the MITF locus.
title: Partitioning heritability using single-cell multi-omics identifies a novel macrophage subpopulation conveying genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs6772383 overlapped with a cis-regulatory element (CRE) at the MITF locus, where the risk T allele disrupted a TEAD1 binding site and correlated with decreased MITF expression. This decrease in MITF expression was linked to increased atherosclerosis risk.
title: Partitioning heritability using single-cell multi-omics identifies a novel macrophage subpopulation conveying genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs3732765 was the lead QTL SNP for the P2RY12 gene, acting to decrease its expression in microglia. This SNP was significant in the context of Parkinson's disease, where it had a negative correlation with PD risk (β = -0.06; P = 2.4×10^-10) and colocalized with the MED12L PD GWAS locus.
title: Atlas of genetic effects in human microglia transcriptome across brain regions, aging and disease pathologies

finding: The SNP rs11707416, located within the MED12L gene, was identified as a causal SNP for Parkinson's disease through fine-mapping analyses, showing perfect linkage with the QTL SNP rs3732765 and potential microglia enhancer overlap.
title: Atlas of genetic effects in human microglia transcriptome across brain regions, aging and disease pathologies

finding: The rs35044562 variant was noted as a lead variant in subsequent Meta-GWAS, indicating a higher overall risk of severe COVID-19 symptoms. It was specifically mentioned that it forms a clade with Neanderthal haplotypes, suggesting a genetic contribution traceable to Neanderthal ancestry.
title: COVID-19 genetic risk and Neanderthals: A case study highlighting the importance of scrutinizing diversity

finding: The variant rs67959919 served as a lead variant in one of the Meta-GWAS studies comparing hospitalized COVID-19 patients with population controls. Its inclusion in the credible set of variants linked to COVID-19 severity suggested an important role in the genetic landscape of the disease.
title: COVID-19 genetic risk and Neanderthals: A case study highlighting the importance of scrutinizing diversity

finding: Identified as a lead variant in a GWAS conducted by 23andMe, rs13078854 was part of a credible set of 20 variants that characterized significant genetic associations with COVID-19 severity, contributing to understanding the genetic risk factors.
title: COVID-19 genetic risk and Neanderthals: A case study highlighting the importance of scrutinizing diversity

finding: Linked to Siglec-9 plasma protein levels, presenting an effect on protein concentration with a beta of -0.68 (other allele G), suggesting an inverse relationship with the variant.
title: Genetic and epigenetic architectures of neurological protein biomarkers in the Lothian Birth Cohort 1936

finding: This SNP was an important trans pQTL for NEP protein levels, indicating that it was also associated with significant methylation changes in the related CpG sites.
title: Genetic and epigenetic architectures of neurological protein biomarkers in the Lothian Birth Cohort 1936

finding: Located in the promoter of the G elongation factor mitochondrial 1 (GFM1) gene, rs28372852 exhibited ASB of CREB1 and MXI1. This SNP highlighted the potential for allele-dependent switching in gene expression activities, indicating an interaction with the transcriptional roles of the associated factors.
title: Landscape of allele-specific transcription factor binding in the human genome

finding: Analysis of rs13092113 indicated significant findings relating to the lymph-sparing quotient in extremity radiation therapy. This SNP was found to influence outcomes in patients, particularly in minimizing lymphedema following reirradiation with FLASH proton therapy.
title: FLASH proton reirradiation, with or without hypofractionation, mitigates chronic toxicity in the normal murine intestine, skin, and bone

finding: The proline12/alanine polymorphism (rs1801282) in the PPARgamma gene was found to be associated with psoriasis and obesity in Egyptian patients, indicating a significant role of this SNP in the pathogenesis of psoriasis.
title: The Model of PPARγ Downregulated Signaling in Psoriasis

finding: The SNP rs4683026 was significantly associated with circulating levels of Tetranectin (CLEC3B), showing the highest levels for the CC genotype. This finding indicated that the assay preferred the Gly106 isoform produced by the C allele over the Ser106 isoform produced by the T allele.
title: Facets of individual-specific health signatures determined from longitudinal plasma proteome profiling

finding: The SNP rs13963, a perfect linkage disequilibrium proxy of rs4683026, was associated with the production of two proteoforms of CLEC3B, further emphasizing its role in determining specific protein isoform levels related to genotype.
title: Facets of individual-specific health signatures determined from longitudinal plasma proteome profiling

finding: This SNP was part of the LAMP3 gene, which exhibited a P-imputed value of 6.54×10^-6 and was shown to be significantly up-regulated in CL lesions.
title: A genome-wide association study highlights a regulatory role for IFNG-AS1 contributing to cutaneous leishmaniasis in Brazil

finding: The SNP rs36016914 on chromosome 3 was linked to the lateral globus pallidus concerning regional grey matter volume.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: The SNP rs9882746 on chromosome 3 was significantly associated with the inferior fronto-occipital fasciculus regarding white matter tract FA.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: This variant’s association with metabolic factors highlights its role as a key player in lipid metabolism.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: Linked to atopic dermatitis, marking it as an important variant in dermatological conditions.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP was previously described as part of the COVID-19 risk core haplotype inherited from Neanderthals and was found in samples from Campinas. Its association with the risk of COVID-19 was established.
title: Genetic variability in COVID-19-related genes in the Brazilian population

finding: This SNP was previously described in the COVID-19 risk core haplotype inherited from Neanderthals and was exclusively present in the BIPMed dataset from Ribeirão Preto, indicating its potential connection to COVID-19 risk.
title: Genetic variability in COVID-19-related genes in the Brazilian population

finding: This SNP contributed to the COVID-19 risk core haplotype inherited from Neanderthals and was documented in samples from Campinas, indicating its potential involvement in the severity or susceptibility to COVID-19.
title: Genetic variability in COVID-19-related genes in the Brazilian population

finding: This SNP was also part of the COVID-19 risk core haplotype inherited from Neanderthals and was present in the ABraOM dataset, suggesting its relevance to COVID-19.
title: Genetic variability in COVID-19-related genes in the Brazilian population

finding: This SNP was noted as being part of the COVID-19 risk core haplotype inherited from Neanderthals and was present in the ABraOM dataset, implying its significance in COVID-19 risk assessment.
title: Genetic variability in COVID-19-related genes in the Brazilian population

finding: The rs1801282 polymorphism was investigated and showed geographic diversity in genotype frequencies, indicating an association with gestational diabetes mellitus in multiple ethnic groups.
title: Genome-Wide Polygenic Risk Scores and Prediction of Gestational Diabetes in South Asian Women

finding: Observed in a poised promoter region associated with Hodgkin lymphoma and showed motif disruption linked to various cancers.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: This SNP disrupted ELF1 motifs linked to multiple neuropsychiatric traits, indicating its role in disease susceptibility.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: SNP rs56407180 was implicated in association with platelet volume, driven by the gene KALRN, demonstrating that variants in this locus influenced hematologic traits.
title: Whole exome sequencing and characterization of coding variation in 49,960 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: This variant was identified as having high posterior probability in relation to pulse rate at the GNB4 locus and was found to be in high LD with a previously reported GWAS index SNP.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: The variant rs13071258 was associated with increased COVID-19 severity, with significant evidence provided by a median p-value of 2.32 x 10^-26 and a median effect size of 0.42.
title: Regulatory dissection of the severe COVID-19 risk locus introgressed by Neanderthals

finding: The variant rs13068572 was linked to increased risk for COVID-19 severity, with significant associations established within the LD Block A.
title: Regulatory dissection of the severe COVID-19 risk locus introgressed by Neanderthals

finding: The variant rs17282391 showed a significant association with COVID-19 severity, contributing to the cumulative evidence from the B block.
title: Regulatory dissection of the severe COVID-19 risk locus introgressed by Neanderthals

finding: The variant rs13063635 was identified as a trans-eQTL impacting the regulation of 11 response genes relevant to COVID-19, suggesting a potential significant role in differential severity.
title: Regulatory dissection of the severe COVID-19 risk locus introgressed by Neanderthals

finding: Identified as a trans-eQTL for 33 response genes, rs13098911 was shown to be differentially expressed in infections, indicating its relevance to COVID-19 severity.
title: Regulatory dissection of the severe COVID-19 risk locus introgressed by Neanderthals

finding: The variant rs35454877 was implicated in the down-regulation of CCR5 and was significantly associated with COVID-19 severity based on the functional studies conducted.
title: Regulatory dissection of the severe COVID-19 risk locus introgressed by Neanderthals

finding: The variant rs71327024 fell within LD Block A and was significantly associated with COVID-19 severity, providing evidence for its role as a possible causative variant.
title: Regulatory dissection of the severe COVID-19 risk locus introgressed by Neanderthals

finding: Similar to rs71327024, rs71327057 was found to have significant associations with increased COVID-19 severity and was linked to CCR1 regulation.
title: Regulatory dissection of the severe COVID-19 risk locus introgressed by Neanderthals

finding: The variant rs34041956 showed significant association with COVID-19 severity and was positioned to influence the regulation of CCR1.
title: Regulatory dissection of the severe COVID-19 risk locus introgressed by Neanderthals

finding: This SNP was involved in the simultaneous inference approach which yielded a 56% increase in novel edges and an 11% increase in additional nodes compared to the two-step method. This indicated its significant role in regulatory networks.
title: Network reconstruction for trans acting genetic loci using multi-omics data and prior information

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with an increased risk for familial colorectal cancer, indicating its potential significance in cancer susceptibility.
title: Identification of hub genes and key pathways in pediatric Crohn’s disease using next generation sequencing and bioinformatics analysis

finding: This SNP corresponded with a reported increased risk for familial colorectal cancer, implicating its role in cancer genetics.
title: Identification of hub genes and key pathways in pediatric Crohn’s disease using next generation sequencing and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The rs2177336-T allele was associated with increased levels of MUC20 expression in SARS-CoV-2-stimulated cells and lower susceptibility to COVID-19.
