finding: The SNP rs55736314 was highly significant for educational attainment (EA) with a p-value of 1.63 × 10^-16. It was located close to the 5' region of the gene FOXP1, which is implicated in several phenotypes including EA and SCZ.
title: An approach to gene-based testing accounting for dependence of tests among nearby genes

finding: The SNP rs4677597 approached GWAS significance for SCZ with a p-value of 3.87 × 10^-7 and was also located near the 5' region of the gene FOXP1, consistent with prior associations of this gene with neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: An approach to gene-based testing accounting for dependence of tests among nearby genes

finding: The index SNP rs7616330 had a p-value of 2.26 × 10^-4 for ASD, indicating a modest signal. It was positioned toward the 3' end of the gene FOXP1, suggesting potential differences in expression regulation related to ASD compared to SCZ and EA.
title: An approach to gene-based testing accounting for dependence of tests among nearby genes

finding: The rs60464856 variant was identified as a regulatory SNP influencing RUVBL1 gene expression in the BPH1 cell line during a multiomic association analysis. It demonstrated significant statistical relevance across several linkage disequilibrium SNPs.
title: Identify Regulatory eQTLs by Multiome Sequencing in Prostate Single Cells

finding: The SNP rs13061380 was found to be linked to genetic mechanisms guiding cancer evolution, contributing to a better understanding of the underlying factors in cancer dynamics and providing insights into the mechanisms that could affect treatment responses.
title: Understanding and leveraging phenotypic plasticity during metastasis formation

finding: The ADIPOQ rs2241766 gene polymorphism was identified as being associated with a predisposition to diabetic kidney disease (DKD), indicating its potential role in the pathogenesis of DKD.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs2713575 was associated with GATA2 and directed towards therapeutic considerations within the VEGF axis, reinforcing its relevance in varicose veins.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The lead SNP rs17759085, found on chromosome 3, was linked to the vertical component of the brain asymmetry analysis. With a higher MAF of 19.90%, this SNP indicated a negative additive effect with increasing T alleles, evidenced by a t-value of -5.46 and a p-value of 4.83e-08. It resides near the SPATA16 gene, adding to the genetic landscape of brain structural asymmetry.
title: Handedness and Other Variables Associated with Human Brain Asymmetrical Skew

finding: The study highlighted that the wildtype SCN5A used in their experiments had the more common H allele of the H558R polymorphism (rs1805124). This SNP was included in their research on Brugada Syndrome-associated variants and served as a control point for the mutants created, thereby underscoring its importance in the context of SCN5A functionality in arrhythmia disorders.
title: High-throughput reclassification of SCN5A variants

finding: The synonymous variant rs2877561 in ILDR1 showed a significant association with hearing difficulty (p = 1.1e-8) in the UK Biobank study. This represented a replication of previous suggestive findings, solidifying its role in hereditary hearing loss.
title: Biological insights from multi-omic analysis of 31 genomic risk loci for adult hearing difficulty

finding: The SNP rs993137 was identified as the most significant lead SNP associated with general risk tolerance, with a p-value of 2.14×10^-40. It was located within the gene CADM2 and was part of a long-range linkage disequilibrium (LD) region on chromosome 3 that encompassed lead SNPs associated with all seven GWAS conducted, thereby suggesting a shared genetic influence across general risk tolerance and other risky behaviors.
title: Genome-wide association analyses of risk tolerance and risky behaviors in over 1 million individuals identify hundreds of loci and shared genetic influences1

finding: The SNP rs13092053 was found to be associated with the presence of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) in breast cancer. This association was linked to the regulation of the tumor microenvironment (TME) and identified as a potential target for therapeutic strategies.
title: Hybrid computational modeling highlights reverse Warburg effect in breast cancer-associated fibroblasts

finding: The investigation into SNP rs13061399 highlighted its relevance to the modulation of immune responses by CAFs. This variance was correlated with altered inflammatory responses in breast cancer, indicating a potential pathway for therapeutic intervention.
title: Hybrid computational modeling highlights reverse Warburg effect in breast cancer-associated fibroblasts

finding: This SNP was associated with GP+M and linked to Barrett's esophagus and esophageal adenocarcinoma, thus indicating its relevance in gastroesophageal disease progression.
title: Genome-wide association study of gastrointestinal disorders reinforces the link between the digestive tract and the nervous system

finding: The rs3762637 variant was associated with an i-rQTL of PARP9-204, co-localized with the GWAS trait for LDL cholesterol levels, indicating its functional role in lipid metabolism.
title: Splicing QTL analysis focusing on coding sequences reveals pathogenicity of disease susceptibility loci

finding: The variant rs35124509 (EPHA3) was replicated in various meta-analyses, highlighting its support in the association with intrinsic brain activity.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: The SNP rs9820529 was associated with changes in mRNA expression, ribosome occupancy, and protein expression levels in the EIF2A gene, showcasing a direct link between genetic variation and phenotypic outcomes through transcriptional regulation mechanisms.
title: Alternative polyadenylation mediates genetic regulation of gene expression

finding: This SNP was also linked to HGFL levels in the pQTL analysis, confirming its role alongside rs1800668 in influencing the protein levels.
title: A large-scale multivariate pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: The SNP rs13071609 was positively linked to alterations in the Epithelial-Mesenchymal Transition (EMT) process as evidenced in the study by Deng et al. (2021), which discussed the coupling of EMT to extracellular matrix stiffness via LOXL2, indicating its relevance in cancer progression and metastasis.
title: Epigenetic memory acquired during long-term EMT induction governs the recovery to the epithelial state

finding: The TREX1 variant rs11917071 was associated with increased TREX1 expression and lower odds of being a responder to immunotherapy, indicating its potential role as an immunomodulatory target.
title: Germline modifiers of the tumor immune microenvironment implicate drivers of cancer risk and immunotherapy response

finding: The TREX1 variant rs2267844 was linked to decreased TREX1 expression and higher odds of being an immunotherapy responder, showcasing its importance in immune response regulation.
title: Germline modifiers of the tumor immune microenvironment implicate drivers of cancer risk and immunotherapy response

finding: The SNV located at chr3:178936091:G:A was associated with findings showing an opposite correlation concerning mortality within five years. This characteristic was included in the model and indicated that it negatively correlated with five-year survival outcomes.
title: Machine learning enables accurate prediction of breast cancer five-year survival using somatic genomic variants

finding: The PAS SNP rs14434, located in the 3' UTR of EIF2A, served as both a pA-QTL and an eQTL. Its PIA, which involved the C allele, was associated with a decrease in usage at the relevant p(A) site, resulting in 3' UTR lengthening, alongside a reduction in EIF2A expression levels. This effect was consistent across all twelve analyzed tissues.
title: Systematic identification of functional SNPs interrupting 3’ UTR polyadenylation signals

finding: The SNP rs73058498, located in the SACM1L locus on chromosome 3, was associated with CSF proline levels at high significance (P=1.88e-12). This was identified as a novel mQTL not previously reported.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapping of circulating metabolites in cerebrospinal fluid to uncover biological mechanisms involved in brain-related phenotypes

finding: Linked to the ZBTB38 locus, rs2871960 was part of the height-specific QTL interaction network correlating with significant methylation changes.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: The <italic>CHDH</italic> variant, rs35518479, was identified as a significant cis-expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for <italic>CHDH</italic> expression in postmortem brains from schizophrenia patients. A allele carriers exhibited significantly higher <italic>CHDH</italic> expression levels compared to G/G homozygotes. Additionally, the SAM/SAH ratio was found to be higher in A allele carriers, indicating a potential influence of this genetic variant on the methionine-homocysteine cycle, which may inform genotype-based stratification of schizophrenia patients for betaine treatment.
title: Investigation of betaine as a novel psychotherapeutic for schizophrenia

finding: In the context of genetic variations affecting depressive symptoms, it was found that the rs237887 polymorphism in the Oxytocin receptor gene (Oxtr) was associated with an increased risk of depression in pregnant women, particularly those who had experienced early abuse. This discovery highlighted the potential linkage between OXTR variants and social cognitive impairments, suggesting that differences in oxytocin receptor signaling may influence vulnerability to depression due to prior adverse life conditions.
title: Natural variation in oxytocin receptor signaling causes widespread changes in brain transcription: a link to the natural killer gene complex

finding: The rs4687102 SNV was identified as a dynamic regulatory element during epidermal differentiation, linked to psoriasis risk by GWAS. It resided in an enhancer that interacted with the TP63 gene, associated with altered expression in psoriatic tissue, indicating its role in dysregulated epidermal homeostasis.
title: Disease-Linked Regulatory DNA Variants and Homeostatic Transcription Factors in Epidermis

finding: This SNP was related to mode 2_62 and located near GMNC, implicated in Alzheimer's disease endophenotypes, specifically influencing p-tau 181 levels in cerebrospinal fluid.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: This SNP, an eQTL for WNT7A, influenced angiogenesis and neurogenesis and correlated with height and trunk mass in the UK Biobank.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: The SNP rs996423 was associated with overall mortality in patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC). This finding highlighted its impact on cancer prognosis.
title: Disrupted in Renal Carcinoma 3 (DIRC3) impacts malignant phenotype and IGFBP5/IGF-1/Akt signaling axis in differentiated thyroid cancer

finding: The SNP rs7623455 was identified as having a large positive effect size (β=10.7) on processing speed, specifically measured by Digit Symbol Substitution Test (DSST) scores. It showed a significant association with a p-value of 2.7×10^-18 in the combined Danish cohort and was part of a cluster of rare protective variants on chromosome 3.
title: Rare Genetic Variants Correlate with Better Processing Speed

finding: The SNP rs9821776 was among those confirmed to have a positive effect on DSST scores in the GWAS. Its association was replicated in the independent Danish cohort, contributing to the understanding of processing speed as evidenced by significant findings after Bonferroni correction.
title: Rare Genetic Variants Correlate with Better Processing Speed

finding: This SNP was one of the variants on chromosome 3 found to associate positively with DSST scores in the initial analysis and was replicated in Danish twin cohorts, confirming its significance in cognitive processing.
title: Rare Genetic Variants Correlate with Better Processing Speed

finding: Similar to the other SNPs on chromosome 3, rs78704059 exhibited a positive association with higher DSST scores and was part of the significant cluster discovered in the LLFS GWAS.
title: Rare Genetic Variants Correlate with Better Processing Speed

finding: The SNP rs140387800, found in an intergenic region on chromosome 3, displayed a strong protective effect size (β=40.5) in longitudinal analyses of DSST, confirming its positive role in cognitive processing speed.
title: Rare Genetic Variants Correlate with Better Processing Speed

finding: The SNP rs6437412-C was identified as associating with increased cortical CSF levels and demonstrating significant relationships within structural imaging metrics, highlighting its relevance in brain structure associations.
title: Deep learning based brain age prediction uncovers associated sequence variants

finding: The rs121913273 variant in the PIK3CA gene was identified in 3 patients and was classified as likely pathogenic. It had been previously described as likely pathogenic in esophageal carcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck, indicating its relevance as a negative prognostic factor in ASCC.
title: Comprehensive characterization of the mutational landscape in localized anal squamous cell carcinoma

finding: The SNP rs9811581 was associated with the genes DTX3L and FBXO2 1 and demonstrated a strong trans-omic path relevance. Its high node importance score indicated its potential implications in Alzheimer's disease as established in the MoFNet framework.
title: Deep multi-omic network fusion for marker discovery of Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs2228467 was associated with both monocyte and eosinophil counts, highlighting its role in the regulation of these immune cells influenced by the ACKR2 gene.
title: Eosinophils promote monocyte to macrophage differentiation and anti-bacterial immunity

finding: Research indicated that rs1366045 was linked to variations in monocyte counts, further supporting ACKR2's importance in monocyte regulation within tissues.
title: Eosinophils promote monocyte to macrophage differentiation and anti-bacterial immunity

finding: The findings demonstrated that rs2228468 affected monocyte counts, implicating ACKR2 in the management of monocyte dynamics.
title: Eosinophils promote monocyte to macrophage differentiation and anti-bacterial immunity

finding: This SNP was determined to have a significant association with eosinophil counts, supporting the role of ACKR2 in eosinophil regulation.
title: Eosinophils promote monocyte to macrophage differentiation and anti-bacterial immunity

finding: The presence of SNP rs9872570 correlated with eosinophil counts, providing evidence for ACKR2's influence over eosinophil behavior.
title: Eosinophils promote monocyte to macrophage differentiation and anti-bacterial immunity

finding: The study identified that the C allele of the TLR9 polymorphism rs5743836 was associated with a decreased risk of uterine corpus endometrial cancer (UCEC), reporting an odds ratio (OR) of 0.11 (95% CI 0.03-0.44, p = 0.002). This finding suggested that the high activity C allele contributed positively to the immune response against pathogens present in the endometrium.
title: Pattern Recognition Receptor based Prognostic Biomarkers for predicting Survival of Uterine Corpus Endometrial Cancer Patients

finding: Like rs5743836, the C allele of TLR9 polymorphism rs187084 was found to be associated with decreased risk in UCEC, with the combined effect of variants (rs5743836 and rs187084) further reinforcing this association. This indicated the potential for these alleles in providing a favorable risk profile against UCEC.
title: Pattern Recognition Receptor based Prognostic Biomarkers for predicting Survival of Uterine Corpus Endometrial Cancer Patients

finding: The SNP rs13092107 was associated with the identification of specific tumor cell populations, such as CRYAB(+), KCNN3(+), and SOX9(+), which exhibit astrocyte-like characteristics in diffuse IDH1-mutant gliomas. This finding highlighted the importance of NOTCH1 signaling in the genesis of these cell types, suggesting that this SNP could play a role in cellular differentiation and tumor heterogeneity.
title: KAT5 regulates neurodevelopmental states associated with G0-like populations in glioblastoma

finding: SNP rs568408 in the IL12A gene was significantly associated with 13 different bacteriophage groups, illustrating a common pathway where inflammatory responses may affect phage-host dynamics.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: The rs4684677 SNP in the GHRL gene was linked to Kuttervirus phages, indicating a potential role of metabolic factors in shaping the composition of the phage community.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: The SNP rs9853321 was associated with RNF13, and used as a causal instrument in recreating the causal network driven by RNF13 in subcutaneous fat.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: SNP rs35896106 was identified as a significant lead eQTL for CXCR6 in whole blood with an association p-value of 5.03 × 10−37. This pointed to its crucial role in mediating the genetic influence on CXCR6 expression in context of COVID-19.
title: Association of CXCR6 with COVID-19 severity: Delineating the host genetic factors in transcriptomic regulation

finding: The SNP rs17713054 exhibited significance as a lead eQTL for CXCR6 specifically in T follicular helper cells, with a p-value of 1.30 × 10−5, indicating its importance in the immune response modulation associated with the severity of COVID-19.
title: Association of CXCR6 with COVID-19 severity: Delineating the host genetic factors in transcriptomic regulation

finding: The SNP rs1080500 was highlighted as a possible causal variant by the MetaChrom analysis. Its effects were likely limited to adult neurons, and it was also identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) in the adult brain. The likely target gene, GNL3, is known to regulate neuron differentiation, further supporting its relevance in SCZ.
title: Predicting Epigenomic Functions of Genetic Variants in the Context of Neurodevelopment via Deep Transfer Learning

finding: The non-coding variant rs1800734 was found to enhance the expression of DCLK3 through long-range interactions, which promoted the progression of colorectal cancer. This finding indicated a significant role for this SNP in cancer biology, particularly in relation to its influence on gene expression pathways.
title: p63 cooperates with CTCF to modulate chromatin architecture in skin keratinocytes

finding: The rs13071525 SNP was associated with the FLT3/FLT3L signaling pathway, which was connected to the maturation of dendritic cells. The findings indicated that this SNP had a significant role in determining the immune response processes, particularly in the context of traumatic brain injury (TBI). Enhanced expression levels following ethanol intoxication (EI) were noted, corroborating its relationship with pro-inflammatory cytokine production and dendritic cell activation, based on the referenced literature.
title: Fast maturation of splenic dendritic cells upon TBI is associated with FLT3/FLT3L signaling

finding: The second most significant SNV, rs277627 (chr3:100336429:G/A), was associated with increased αKGM levels with a p-value of 2.0×10^{-36}. It was located in the intron of the NIT2 gene and contained a regulatory element that could affect transcription factor binding, suggesting a mechanism for its influence on NIT2 expression.
title: The transaminase-ω-amidase pathway is a redox switch in glutamine metabolism that generates α-ketoglutarate

finding: Associated with melanoma and implicated in sunburn risk, this intergenic SNP is linked to LINC00886 and METTL15P1.
title: Pan-Cancer Study Detects Novel Genetic Risk Variants and Shared Genetic Basis in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs13079080 was associated with differential regulation of the succinate receptor 1 (SUCNR1) gene by miRNA-4470, highlighting its potential relevance in the genetic susceptibility factors for age-related macular degeneration (AMD) development.
title: The metabolite receptor SUCNR1 in oxidative stress-induced age-related macular degeneration

finding: The SNP rs12636284 was identified in a caQTL that exhibited significant chromatin accessibility in muscle fibers, with a P value of 1.4×10^-63. This caQTL was also observed in fibro-adipogenic progenitor (FAP) cells, highlighting its role in mediating chromatin accessibility across cell types.
title: Population-scale skeletal muscle single-nucleus multi-omic profiling reveals extensive context specific genetic regulation

finding: This SNP was linked to the CCR3 gene and annotated as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) in Tregs, suggesting its possible role in Treg biology and immune regulation.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: Identified as influencing MEF2 binding for the CCR2 gene, this SNP was linked to changes in Treg function and thereby implicated in T1D.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: This SNP was associated with transcription factor regulation, affecting TF gene expression in adipose tissue, which is linked to insulin sensitivity.
title: Same role but different actors: genetic regulation of post-translational modification of two distinct proteins

finding: The SNP rs4855559, found in the intron of Myosin Heavy Chain 15 (MYH15), had a p-value of 3.7×10−8. It was associated with Lifetime Anxiety Disorder, although its direction of effect was not consistent across other analyzed traits, such as Neuroticism or Depression.
title: A Major Role for Common Genetic Variation in Anxiety Disorders

finding: This SNP was identified as a strong signal associated with anxiety, located near the SATB1 locus, with a p-value of 7.40×10^-11 in the GWAS of anxiety using the GAD-2 scale in a cohort of nearly 200,000 individuals. The finding was deemed novel and significant, linking anxiety disorders to genetic variants.
title: Reproducible Risk Loci and Psychiatric Comorbidities in Anxiety: Results from ~200,000 Million Veteran Program Participants

finding: The SNP rs11709472 was correlated with celiac disease in a genomic region relevant to autoimmune mechanisms affecting GC B cells.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: Found associated with celiac disease and asthma, rs7628982 demonstrated significant correlations in chromatin dynamics within GC-related contexts.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: This SNP was linked with celiac disease and recognized as part of an autoimmune locus relevant to BCL6 regulation.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: Associations were made with multiple autoimmune diseases, indicating its role as a genetic determinant in GC B cells.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: Associated with allergy, SNP rs56046601 showed potential regulatory roles in GC B cells.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: Similar to rs56046601, this SNP was linked with allergy suggesting relevance to immune response modulation.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: Recognized for links with multiple sclerosis, this SNP's role in B cell regulation was highlighted.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: SNP rs7640550 was associated with asthma, indicating interaction with regulatory mechanisms in immune cells.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: This SNP was noted as accessible across various immune lineages, contributing complexity to autoimmune regulation.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: Significant accessibility across immune cells marked this SNP, enhancing the understanding of its role in autoimmune pathways.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: Associated with autoimmune response mechanisms, this SNP was highlighted as part of a larger regulatory framework.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: The variant rs17215589, which coded for an Alanine to Threonine amino acid exchange at position 715 of the ULK4 protein, was identified as having a significant impact on brain activation in the reward system. Minor allele carriers exhibited increased activation responses to conditioned reward stimuli in several brain regions, including the ventral tegmental area and nucleus accumbens, suggesting a possible increased vulnerability to mental disorders through modulated reward system function.
title: Impact of Unc-51 Like Kinase 4 (ULK4) on the Reactivity of the Extended Reward System in Response to Conditioned Stimuli

finding: SNP rs11709284 was associated with increased lithium-induced neural progenitor cell (NPC) proliferation and higher GNL3 expression levels in response to lithium. The allele linked to increased expression of GNL3 correlated with both increased baseline and lithium-induced proliferation, including sensitivity of NPCs to lithium. This SNP also marked a complex locus related to bipolar disorder (BD) and schizophrenia.
title: Cellular genome wide association study identifies common genetic variation influencing lithium induced neural progenitor proliferation

finding: SNP rs352140 exhibited a significant association with lithium-induced NPC proliferation, similar to rs11709284. Both SNPs were weakly correlated (r2 = 0.22), suggesting they may tag independent, yet related, genetic variants at the locus.
title: Cellular genome wide association study identifies common genetic variation influencing lithium induced neural progenitor proliferation

finding: SNP rs1108842, located in the GNL3 5'UTR, was linked to higher lithium-induced NPC proliferation and expression of GNL3. This SNP demonstrated that alleles associated with increased GNL3 expression led to a significant rise in lithium-induced proliferation.
title: Cellular genome wide association study identifies common genetic variation influencing lithium induced neural progenitor proliferation

finding: The SNP rs2492286 was linked to a range of traits including cancers and hematological parameters. It also showed significant association with IEAA.
title: Genome-wide association studies identify 137 loci for DNA methylation biomarkers of ageing

finding: The SNP rs1047210 was associated with the IEAA biomarker and demonstrated colocalization with an eQTL for the TRIM59 gene, which is related to chronological age and cancer.
title: Genome-wide association studies identify 137 loci for DNA methylation biomarkers of ageing

finding: The SNP rs1405401 was identified as a significant association with tuber flesh color (FC), explaining 18.04% of the variance at Godet. It was observed that 80% of the accessions with homozygous TT genotype had white FC, while heterozygous TC genotype corresponded to accessions with cream and purple FCs. This SNP was positioned between the genes Dioal.15G046800 (upstream) and Dioal.15G046900 (downstream), annotated as leucine-rich receptor-like protein kinase.
title: Genome-wide association studies reveal novel loci controlling tuber flesh color and oxidative browning in Dioscorea alata

finding: This variant achieved a high MpraVAE score of 0.993 and was located in an open chromatin region within NEK10. It was linked to the promoter region of STAT2 by a chromatin loop. STAT2 is essential for immune responses to environmental stimuli, supporting its functional significance in disease.
title: In silico generation and augmentation of regulatory variants from massively parallel reporter assay using conditional variational autoencoder

finding: The SNP in CASR was associated with a conserved position related to breast cancer.
title: Predicting functionally important breast cancer SNPs using pleiotropy, conservation, and protein structure

finding: The association between the rs7627468 SNP, located within the CaSR gene, and nephrolithiasis was confirmed with a statistically significant p-value of 3.5×10^-5, supporting its role in kidney stone disease.
title: Genetic variants of calcium and vitamin D metabolism in kidney stone disease

finding: The SNP rs35779991-C showed an association with inflammation in esophagus mucosa (β = 0.25, P-value = 8.87 × 10-7). It is noteworthy that this variant was genome-wide significant in a GWAS for Body Mass Index (BMI) (β = 0.018, P-value = 9.97 × 10-12), emphasizing its relevance in complex traits associated with obesity.
title: Self-supervised learning for characterising histomorphological diversity and spatial RNA expression prediction across 23 human tissue types

finding: The SNP rs2306374 was associated with coronary artery disease (CAD) in a GWAS involving over 100,000 Europeans. It was shown to be linked to the expression of the gene MRAS in multiple tissues relevant for CAD, such as the aorta and tibial arteries.
title: Qtlizer: comprehensive QTL annotation of GWAS results

finding: SNP rs9851766, located within the 3' UTR of the MRAS gene and near a predicted hsa-miR-135-5p binding site, was prioritized for functional studies. It was noted for its potential impact on MRAS regulation in relation to CAD.
title: Qtlizer: comprehensive QTL annotation of GWAS results

finding: SNP rs13324341 was identified as an intronic variant of the MRAS gene and was located in a DNase I hypersensitivity site. It was regarded as the best QTL for MRAS in six studies related to heart and artery tissues.
title: Qtlizer: comprehensive QTL annotation of GWAS results

finding: The SNP rs556788 tags the esv3597888 deletion, which overlaps with the intronic region of the PCC gene. It was strongly associated with total bilirubin levels and neuroticism, with a noteworthy p-value indicating functional relevance.
title: Network-based analysis of allele frequency distribution among multiple populations identifies adaptive genomic structural variants

finding: rs2029591 was identified as a brain eQTL, affecting multiple genes including NCKIPSD, which is involved in synaptic activity. It had strong associations with various mental health traits (p=5.9×10⁻⁹), reinforcing its relevance in ADHD and MDD.
title: Investigating regions of shared genetic variation in attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder and major depressive disorder: A GWAS meta-analysis

finding: This lead SNP was associated with CAD and found influential within the enhancer region, confirming its relevance in gene regulation as part of the broader CAD-associated loci findings.
title: Comprehensive identification of coronary artery disease-associated variants regulating vascular smooth muscle cell gene expression

finding: Variant rs61791721 was associated with the gene PCCB, and it was discovered that it decreased the activity of PCCB, which resulted in increased levels of propionyl-CoA and variations in multiple metabolites related to coronary artery disease.
title: Integrative analysis of metabolite GWAS illuminates the molecular basis of pleiotropy and genetic correlation

finding: The variant rs12493830 had a <italic>trans</italic> association with ICAM2 levels, also associated with CNV in the same intergenic region.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: The proxy SNP rs10935473 was associated with the deletion CNV on chromosome 3 affecting FLT4/VEGF-sR3 protein levels.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: Linked to the ITIH4 gene, rs2535629 increased transcript levels in both fetal and adult tissues, suggesting a consistent role of this SNP in ASD-related processes.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: Associated with THOC7, rs832190 was found to upregulate its expression in both developmental stages, indicating potential importance in ASD.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: This SNP was shown to have opposing effects on PCCB gene levels in different tissues, highlighting its complex regulatory role in transcript expression.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: Linked to PCCB, rs7618871 also influenced transcript levels inconsistently between fetal and adult stages, further underscoring the complexity of ASD regulation.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: While present in both fetal and adult databases, rs4481150 specifically increased ITIH4 transcript levels only in the adult cortex, indicating developmental specificity.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: This low frequency variant was identified as the sentinel variant within an intron of KIF15. The minor allele was associated with increased susceptibility to IPF and decreased expression of KIF15 in brain tissue.
title: Genome-wide association study of susceptibility to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The SNP rs7622814, located on chromosome 3q13.2, emerged as a candidate causal variant related to immune function due to its highly significant cis-eQTLs (P<1.0×10^-300) observed in blood. The gene CD200R1, associated with this SNP, plays a role in suppressing pro-inflammatory responses, which may influence asthma pathology.
title: Large-scale Genetic Analysis Identifies 66 Novel Loci for Asthma

finding: The SNP rs13071606 was identified as a positive original finding in a study related to breast cancer patients. The study utilized multidimensional diffusion magnetic resonance imaging to characterize tissue microstructure, demonstrating its relevance in understanding tumor characteristics and implicating genetic variations in disease phenotypes.
title: Frequency-dependence in multidimensional diffusion-relaxation correlation MRI of the brain: overfitting or meaningful parameter?

finding: The variant rs6778080 showed a positive causal link between lifetime smoking and waist-hip ratio (WHR<sub>adjBMI</sub>), as well as waist circumference (WC<sub>adjBMI</sub>). This finding underscores its role in increased abdominal adiposity attributed to smoking.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: The SNP rs1801725 was associated with an increased risk of secondary malignancies as demonstrated in research conducted by Actkins et al. in 2021. This finding provided a significant insight into the role of calcium-sensing receptor (CaSR) polymorphisms in the context of lung epithelial function and ion transport that was previously investigated in the study concerning the effects of low molecular weight hyaluronan (LMW-HA). The context surrounding this SNP highlighted its potential implications in various phenotypic outcomes related to lung epithelial ion transport and associated pathologies.
title: Low Molecular Weight Hyaluronan Inhibits Lung Epithelial Ion Channels by Activating the Calcium-Sensing Receptor

finding: This SNP was associated with RMM and located in UROC1 gene; it was a missense variant predicted to be damaging, indicating high deleteriousness with a PolyPhen-2 score of 0.99.
title: First genome-wide association study of non-severe malaria in two birth cohorts in Benin

finding: The SNP rs13081780 was identified as a positive original finding in the context of enhancing temozolomide sensitivity in three-dimensional glioblastoma spheroids. This enhancement was linked to oxidative stress-mediated DNA damage, which was shown to augment the effectiveness of treatment against human glioblastoma.
title: Ultrasound-mediated drug diffusion, uptake, and cytotoxicity in glioblastoma 3D tumour sphere model

finding: The SNP rs13081930 was identified as a significant genetic marker in a study conducted by Dunphy et al. (2021) that analyzed post-translational modifications and their applications in blood cancers. The authors concluded that this SNP was associated with alterations in the pathways related to blood cancer progression.
title: Introducing ‘identification probability’ for automated and transferable assessment of metabolite identification confidence in metabolomics and related studies

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with broadly defined depression, aligning with previous genetic discoveries.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: The study found that the rs113408797 SNP in the DNAJC13 gene significantly influenced activation in the ventral tegmental area (VTA) and nucleus accumbens (NAcc) in response to conditioned reward stimuli, with p-values of 2.50E-07 and 5.31E-05, respectively. This finding provided empirical evidence that genetic variation at this locus impacts reward processing in the human brain.
title: DNAJC13 influences responses of the extended reward system to conditioned stimuli: a genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs9869178, located in 3q24, was associated with risky behaviors, specifically automobile speeding propensity (P = 4.4E-8) and educational attainment (P = 2.4E-7), indicating its influence on behavioral traits relevant to risk tolerance.
title: Diverse functions associate with trans-species polymorphisms in humans

finding: The SNP rs2118072 was linked to risky behaviors and educational attainment in both individual GWAS and the UK Biobank, reinforcing its association with traits influenced by social variability and personal choices.
title: Diverse functions associate with trans-species polymorphisms in humans

finding: The SNP rs13061187 was linked to agronomic performance through its relation to remotely sensed vegetation index (VI) traits. This SNP's role was evidenced in background research on the assessment of genetic markers for enhanced grain yield and drought resilience.
title: Identification of QTL hotspots affecting agronomic traits and high-throughput vegetation indices in rainfed wheat

finding: The rs2535629 regulatory variant in ITIH3 was associated with increased risk for schizophrenia.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: SNP rs6801235 showed significant allelic differences across both cell lines and was identified as an eQTL for a gene in the cerebellar hemisphere in the GTEx database, linking it to potential functional impacts in brain-related tissues.
title: A screen of 1,049 schizophrenia and 30 Alzheimer’s-associated variants for regulatory potential

finding: Identified to harbor multiple functional rSNPs, with up to 13 found in this specific locus indicative of its regulatory significance.
title: Sex significantly impacts the function of major depression-linked variants in vivo

finding: rs114503684 on chromosome 3 reached genome-wide significance in patients with left heart lesions, reinforcing its importance in this type of congenital anomaly.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: Another variant on chromosome 3, rs2046060, reached genome-wide significance in the context of left heart lesions, indicating a potential role in this subtype of CHD.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: Identified on chromosome 3 near the LEPREL1 locus, SNP rs187369228 was associated with ASD type II, adding to the evidence of genetic contribution to this variant of congenital heart disease.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs53576 in the oxytocin receptor gene was associated with bulimia nervosa (BN) and binge-purge tendencies in women. This finding was relevant in understanding the genetic factors that may contribute to dysregulated eating behaviors.
title: Investigating resting brain perfusion abnormalities and target-engagement by intranasal oxytocin in women with bulimia nervosa and binge-eating disorder and healthy controls

finding: The SNP rs2254298 was implicated in binge-purge tendencies in women, supporting the role of the oxytocin system in eating disorders, particularly in the context of bulimia nervosa.
title: Investigating resting brain perfusion abnormalities and target-engagement by intranasal oxytocin in women with bulimia nervosa and binge-eating disorder and healthy controls

finding: The SNP rs2268493 was associated with overeating, contributing to the understanding of genetic variants that may influence eating patterns and behaviors in relation to binge eating.
title: Investigating resting brain perfusion abnormalities and target-engagement by intranasal oxytocin in women with bulimia nervosa and binge-eating disorder and healthy controls

finding: The SNP rs2268494 was also linked to overeating, reinforcing the idea that variations in the oxytocin receptor gene may affect eating behaviors and predispositions to eating disorders.
title: Investigating resting brain perfusion abnormalities and target-engagement by intranasal oxytocin in women with bulimia nervosa and binge-eating disorder and healthy controls

finding: The SNP rs13092014 was linked to aberrant sialylation in cancer, particularly in the context of the study by Pietrobono and Stecca. This finding was relevant as it suggested that alterations in glycosylation patterns, especially hypersialylation noted in colon cancer HCT116 cells, could serve as biomarkers and potential therapeutic targets. The research highlighted the significance of N-glycoproteomics in uncovering the molecular mechanisms associated with cancer progression.
title: Comparative analyses of the N-glycoproteomes in HCT116 cancer cells and their non-tumorigenic DNMT1/3b double knockout (DKO1) cells and insight into the Mannose-6-phosphate pathway

finding: The SNP rs9874537 was identified through a GWAS analysis of a latent variable associated with schizophrenia in a sample of 20,744 UK Biobank participants. It showed a significant association with a p-value of 4.5 x 10^-8, which was notably lower than the minimum p-value from the univariate MRI GWAS analysis (3.4 x 10^-5). This suggests a stronger link to schizophrenia beyond what was captured in univariate analyses.
title: Linking the genetic structure of neuroanatomical phenotypes with psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs13092077 was associated with the MAPK13 gene, which played a significant role in the sensitivity of cancer cells to rapamycin, a chemotherapeutic agent. The findings suggested that m6A modification of MAPK13 impacted its mRNA stability, and silencing of MAPK13 improved the effectiveness of rapamycin in suppressing cancer cell growth, indicating that this SNP could contribute to drug resistance and may serve as a therapeutic target.
title: MAPK13 stabilization via m6A modification limits anti-cancer efficacy of rapamycin

finding: The rs53576 SNP in the OXTR gene was significantly associated with the speed of face categorization in adults based on their early experiences with other-race nannies. Specifically, A/A homozygotes showed a significant negative correlation (r=-0.52, p<.001) between nanny experience and categorization reaction time, whereas G-carriers did not exhibit this correlation. This indicates that the OXTR genotype interacted significantly with early caregiving experience, affecting social sensitivity and face categorization abilities.
title: Gene-environment interactions in face categorisation: experience with a nanny and oxytocin receptor genotype interact to reduce face categorization reaction times

finding: The SNP rs2230461, located in the PIK3CA gene, was a significant finding related to its role in oncogenic processes. The study highlighted that this SNP could be present in a different chromosomal copy relative to two particular PIK3CA mutations, E545K and L866F. The context of this finding emphasized its relevance in understanding the predicted oncogenicity and treatment sensitivity when these mutations co-occur on the same copy (in cis) as rs2230461.
title: Targeted Phasing of 2-200 Kilobase DNA Fragments with a Short-Read Sequencer and a Single-Tube Linked-Read Library Method

finding: The eQTL variant rs73138519 was associated with decreased differentiation efficiency for DPH3. This finding was significant when stratifying differentiation efficiency across 125 individuals, demonstrating the impact of this SNP on cellular behavior.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing of differentiating iPS cells reveals dynamic genetic effects on gene expression

finding: The SNP rs9826458 was found to have strong associations with both RiskyBehavior (P_RiskyBehavior = 4.36 x 10^-21) and SmokingInitiation (P_SmokingInitiation = 1.21 x 10^-14). It was associated with cell type-specific activity contributing to addiction-related phenotypes.
title: Addiction-associated genetic variants implicate brain cell type- and region-specific cis-regulatory elements in addiction neurobiology

finding: rs1354034 exhibited a strong non-additive association with platelet distribution width (P = 5.80 × 10⁻⁹⁰), being linked to ARHGEF3 expression, whereas the additive association for platelet count and volume was not significant (P = 0.825).
title: Analysis of genetic dominance in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs2877561 SNP in the ILDR1 gene was fine-mapped as contributing to the genome-wide significant association with hearing difficulties, which was linked to age-related hearing impairment, although it did not achieve genome-wide significance in earlier studies.
title: Analysis of genetic dominance in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs2306374 showed a significant association with coronary artery disease (CAD) traits (p=6.49e-09) and was located in a Sertoli cell-specific peak, linked to the gene Mras, which has been reported to be associated with CAD.
title: The single-cell epigenetic regulatory landscape in mammalian perinatal testis development

finding: The SNP rs13092005 was associated with the context of cancer development and progression in relation to integrin-associated CD151 and other tetraspanins. This finding was considered a significant original contribution to understanding how these genetic factors might influence cellular functions and signaling pathways relevant to cancer.
title: Multi-gradient Permutation Survival Analysis Identifies Mitosis and Immune Signatures Steadily Associated with Cancer Patient Prognosis

finding: The SNP rs75968099 was indicated as a risk variant associated with both schizophrenia (SCZ) and bipolar disorder (BD). It showed significant alterations in expression along the developmental trajectory of the neuronal lineage, linking it to the DCLK3 gene. This finding related to the causal genes for neuropsychiatric disorders helps explain the complex cell-specific regulation and underscores the importance of chromatin accessibility in gene expression leading to these conditions.
title: Multi-omic profiling of the developing human cerebral cortex at the single cell level

finding: The variant rs146589465-G, resulting in an aspartic acid to glutamic acid substitution at position 522 in the ATG7 protein (p.Asp522Glu), was found to be associated with an increased risk of cholangiocarcinoma (CCA) in the Icelandic population. The odds ratio (OR) for this association was 6.56 (P=1.3×10^-3), indicating a significant link. Additionally, the variant also showed associations with increased risks of hepatocellular carcinoma (OR=4.95, P=2.9×10^-2) and pituitary adenoma (OR=5.22, P=3.9×10^-3). Analysis also revealed that carriers of this variant had significantly higher levels of the autophagy receptor p62 in tumors compared to non-carriers, supporting the conclusion that the rs146589465-G variant leads to defects in autophagy.
title: Genetic risk of cholangiocarcinoma is linked to the autophagy gene ATG7

finding: The SNP rs13061299 was associated with the regulation of lysosomal calcium channels, which have roles in autophagy and cancer as discussed in the paper by Wu et al. (2021). The IRE1α activation and its importance in phagosome maturation, particularly during <italic>Candida albicans</italic> infection, suggest that genetic variations at this locus might influence macrophage antifungal responses and susceptibility to fungal infections.
title: Non-canonical activation of IRE1α during Candida albicans infection enhances macrophage fungicidal activity

finding: This SNP, mapped to the IQCJ-SHIP1 gene, showed a positive effect for total area with a beta coefficient of 4.28 and a highly significant p-value of 4.54 × 10−17. It indicated an association with the morphometry of the corpus callosum.
title: The Genetic Architecture of the Human Corpus Callosum and its Subregions

finding: The SNP rs13071609 was implicated in a theoretical framework that connected the epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) to extracellular matrix (ECM) stiffness, mediated by LOXL2. This relationship was suggested to influence cancer cell migration and metastasis, indicating its potential relevance in the understanding of cancer dynamics.
title: Nrf2 modulates the hybrid epithelial/mesenchymal phenotype and Notch signaling during collective cancer migration

finding: This SNP showed associations not only with prostate but also ovarian cancer susceptibility, making it notable for multiple cancer types.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: rs2811476 was associated with endometrial cancer risk and correlated with known SNPs linked to hormone-related traits, emphasizing its potential role in disease.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: Known for its significant role in breast cancer, this SNP also emerged in the current study as an independent lead SNP in association with cancer risk.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs13081830 revealed associations with beta-catenin activation, which affected lipid class transformations, impacting the development and progression of hepatocellular carcinoma, and indicated a relevance in metabolic changes as a result of this oncogenic signaling.
title: Phospholipid isotope tracing reveals β-catenin-driven suppression of phosphatidylcholine metabolism in hepatocellular carcinoma

finding: The SNP rs13092054 was identified as a relevant genetic marker in the gene expression profiling of PanNETs with varying Ki67-based grades, reflecting its role in tumor biology.
title: Digital spatial profiling of RNA in pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors highlights the distinct profile of α-SMA positive stroma and its impact on surrounding tumor cells

finding: The rs12491955 variant was associated with increased expression of SENP7 mRNA levels (P_adj = 4.2×10^-302) and 5mC levels at 35 CpG sites. Of these, 30 CpG sites were located in clusters of ZNF genes on chromosome 19, with 23 sites located in binding sites for KAP1, a chromatin remodeler regulated by SENP7.
title: Factors Driving DNA Methylation Variation in Human Blood

finding: There was a significant association between rs9823335 in the IQCB1 locus and serum creatinine levels (most significant p-value 3.05e-09), which replicated in the meta-analysis. IQCB1 is critical in kidney function and has established links to Senior-Løken syndrome.
title: Mendelian pathway analysis of laboratory traits reveals distinct roles for ciliary subcompartments in common disease pathogenesis

finding: The rs75382826 variant within IQCB1 also showed significant association with urea levels (p-value 2.56e-09), replicating at both variant and gene level in meta-analysis, reinforcing IQCB1's role in kidney function.
title: Mendelian pathway analysis of laboratory traits reveals distinct roles for ciliary subcompartments in common disease pathogenesis

finding: The rs993387 locus was associated with <italic>Salmonella</italic> invasion, particularly influencing the susceptibility of lymphoblastoid cells to <italic>S</italic>. Typhi and <italic>S</italic>. Typhimurium. It was shown that the G allele of rs993387 correlated with increased susceptibility to <italic>S</italic>. Typhi invasion (2.6%) than to <italic>S</italic>. Typhimurium invasion (0.7%). Results from a GWAS indicated that this SNP significantly deviated towards lower p-values than expected by chance for both serovars, supporting its role as an influential genetic variant in <italic>ARHGEF26</italic> in mediating these infections.
title: ARHGEF26 enhances Salmonella invasion and inflammation in cells and mice

finding: The SNP rs13081759 was associated with Zona Pellucida Protein 2 (ZP2), which was expressed in colon cancer and promoted cell proliferation, as reported in the study by Kraus et al. in 2021. This finding highlighted the potential oncogenic role of ZP2 and suggested that the presence of ZP2 might contribute to cancer biology.
title: Intracellular fraction of zona pellucida protein 3 is required for the oocyte to embryo transition in mice

finding: The SNP rs2272007 was associated with diseases such as high blood pressure and sporadic thoracic aortic dissection (STAD). This SNP is located in the pseudokinase domain of ULK4, affecting residue 39. The common variant K39 resulted from a T nucleotide, found in 68% of individuals, while the C nucleotide leads to arginine at this position (R39), found in 32% of individuals. R39 and K39 showed similar stability with ATP present, but R39 displayed a tighter binding affinity for ADP compared to K39. The findings suggested that altered nucleotide affinity contributed to the diseases noted in GWAS studies.
title: Nucleotide binding, evolutionary insights and interaction partners of the pseudokinase Unc-51-like kinase 4

finding: The SNP rs13061364 was found to correlate with YAP1 amplification in osteosarcoma cases, which was relevant in the context of Ewing sarcoma pathogenesis. It highlighted a mechanism where YAP1 upregulation could contribute to tumorigenic processes in related cancers.
title: YAP1 is a key regulator of EWS::FLI1-dependent malignant transformation upon IGF-1 mediated reprogramming of bone mesenchymal stem cells

finding: The SNP rs6809764 was identified as an sQTL affecting PCYT1A, associated with increased PSI of an intron junction, implicating its role in chondrocyte morphology changes during hypertrophy relevant to OA.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The SNP rs7628578 was identified as FN-f-specific, colocalizing with a THR GWAS signal linked to the PBRM1 gene.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The SNP rs3774354 was found to be associated with the THR GWAS signal, with evidence suggesting PBRM1 could be the causal gene.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The SNP rs4146336 was identified as significant in the non-stratified GWAS for systemizing, with a p-value of 2.58×10−8. It mapped to two genes, LSAMP and PTMAP8, suggesting its potential involvement in autism-related phenotypes.
title: Social and non-social autism symptom and trait domains are genetically dissociable

finding: The SNP rs13061350 was identified in a study by Garate et al. in 2021, which reported a drastic shift in lipid adducts in colon cancer. The findings indicated alterations in specific potassium channels related to the presence of this SNP, highlighting its significance in the molecular pathology of colon cancer.
title: Spatial Probabilistic Mapping of Metabolite Ensembles in Mass Spectrometry Imaging

finding: The variant rs34457487 was connected to the MOBP gene and demonstrated associations in the pallidum and putamen, relevant to myelin sheath structure.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: This SNP was identified as an intronic variant of the TPRG1 gene. It was found in the context of height associations linked to genome-wide significant rare variants that were not discovered in previous UK Biobank analyses.
title: Joint modelling of whole genome sequence data for human height via approximate message passing

finding: The SNP rs13071746 was associated with epigenetic modifications in myeloid diseases, as discussed in the context of a study published by Maher et al. in 'Cancers'. The finding highlighted the potential for exploiting these epigenetic alterations for therapeutic purposes in a spectrum of myeloid malignancies.
title: ExoSloNano: Multi-Modal Nanogold Tags for identification of Macromolecules in Live Cells & Cryo-Electron Tomograms

finding: The SNP rs4684090 was identified as a significant risk locus for PTSD in the African sample (p=3.59×10−8) and was located intronically within the CNTN6 gene.
title: Genomic Characterization of Posttraumatic Stress Disorder in a Large US Military Veteran Sample

finding: The SNP rs111488606 was related to chronic airway obstruction (p=1.47×10−5), found near TRAIP, indicating potential associations with physical health outcomes underlining PTSD.
title: Genomic Characterization of Posttraumatic Stress Disorder in a Large US Military Veteran Sample

finding: The SNP rs13081882 was associated with alterations in cytoskeletal dynamics during epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT), as evidenced by its role in the upregulation of key markers such as SNAIL1 and ZEB1 in cell lines exposed to CdtB, which indicated a potential link to cancer metastasis.
title: The cytolethal distending toxin modulates cell differentiation and elicits epithelial to mesenchymal transition

finding: The SNP rs12635900 was identified as an affinity-optimizing SNV, resulting in an 8-fold increase in ETS binding affinity. It was associated with QRS duration and located within a putative developmental heart enhancer that interacts with the SCN5A promoter. This enhancer displayed low-affinity ETS binding sites, consistent with findings in other cardiac enhancers. Variants affecting SCN5A are linked to significant human cardiac conduction traits such as QRS duration, indicating its role in heart conduction and associated diseases.
title: Affinity-optimizing variants within cardiac enhancers disrupt heart development and contribute to cardiac traits

finding: The study found a positive association between the abundance of Christensenellaceae and Methanobrevibacter and the SNP rs2276731 in the ALDH1L1 gene. This SNP was characterized by a nucleotide exchange towards C in approximately 17% of the population. The findings suggested a correlation between this SNP and the prevalence of methane producers, which was observed to be about 15% in the analyzed subjects. This correlation highlighted the role of host genetics in methane production, suggesting that the SNP may influence the microbiome composition related to methane emissions.
title: Methane emission of humans is explained by dietary habits, host genetics, local formate availability and a uniform archaeome

finding: In the context of height GWAS from UK Biobank, rs2871960 was highlighted as a significant genetic association with a p-value of 2.4 × 10<sup>-256</sup>. However, it was also found to be unlikely a causal eQTL for the gene ZBTB38 due to low PIP and SNP-level colocalization probabilities.
title: Analyzing and Reconciling Colocalization and Transcriptome-wide Association Studies from the Perspective of Inferential Reproducibility

finding: This SNP disrupted an islet enhancer crucial for ADCY5 expression, linking it to type 2 diabetes.
title: INFIMA leverages multi-omics model organism data to identify effector genes of human GWAS variants

finding: rs11708903 was identified as linked to ADCY5 and relevant to blood glucose regulation.
title: INFIMA leverages multi-omics model organism data to identify effector genes of human GWAS variants

finding: This SNP was connected to the ADCY5 gene, involved in insulin secretion processes.
title: INFIMA leverages multi-omics model organism data to identify effector genes of human GWAS variants

finding: SNP rs4450740 was part of the enrichments associated with ADCY5 and blood glucose levels.
title: INFIMA leverages multi-omics model organism data to identify effector genes of human GWAS variants

finding: The ITIH3-rs2535629 SNP was associated with multiple psychiatric disorders, including attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bipolar disorder (BD), unipolar depression (UD), and schizophrenia (SCZ). Additionally, it was shown to correlate with the expression of the ITIH3 gene while also being involved in spatial regulatory interactions with 12 additional eGenes, enhancing the understanding of multimorbid phenotypes.
title: Decoding the multimorbidities among psychiatric disorders and cognitive functioning

finding: Found on chromosome 3, this SNP was significantly associated with mean cortical thickness, presenting a p-value of 2.10e-17 and explaining 0.22% of the variance. It is located within the RPSA gene, which plays a critical role in early cortical development related to dendritic spine morphology and cortical layering.
title: Larger cerebral cortex is genetically correlated with greater frontal area and dorsal thickness

finding: The SNP rs520558 acted as an eQTL for the gene SENP7, which is involved in the regulation of DNA methylation. It indirectly affected distal CpG sites (cg24214260) through this regulatory pathway, exemplifying a trans-meQTL mechanism.
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: The SNP rs13061356 was associated with findings in the research conducted by Prezado et al. (2021), where it played a role in the context of Neon Minibeam Radiation Therapy and its potential effects on chemiluminescence as a result of free radical oxidation. This indicated a relationship between the genetic variant and the body's response to radiation therapy, particularly focusing on antioxidant processes.
title: Possible Mechanisms Of Action Of Light Inert Gases On Chemiluminescence Arising As A Result Of Lipid Peroxidation

finding: The SNP rs12497850 was linked to the gene LAMB2 at the IP6K2 locus. This was noted as a significant finding related to the genetic risk underlying Parkinson's disease and emerged from rare variant burden analyses.
title: Expanding Parkinson’s disease genetics: novel risk loci, genomic context, causal insights and heritable risk

finding: The rs3197999 missense variant in the MST1 gene (G>A; R703C) was associated with an increased risk of Crohn’s disease. It was noted that this variant led to a lower abundance of the MSP-RON protein complex, affecting macrophage activation and potentially impacting epithelial cell survival and growth.
title: MecCog: A knowledge representation framework for genetic disease mechanism

finding: The GPx-1 gene variant (rs1050450) was connected to obesity risk and GPx activity, marking its significance in metabolic health.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs34631447 demonstrated skipping of the nearest LPP promoter to interact with the BCL6 promoter, implicating it in the regulation of a master transcription factor in TFH biology linked to SLE.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: Like rs34631447, rs79044630 was identified as a regulatory SNP in open chromatin near the LPP gene with connections to BCL6, underscoring its relevance in TFH activity in SLE pathogenesis.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: The SNP rs1800734 was originally associated with the enhancement of DCLK3 expression through long-range interaction, which was found to promote colorectal cancer progression. This finding indicated that the variant might play a significant role in the underlying genetics of colorectal cancer.
title: CTCF and cohesin promote focal detachment of DNA from the nuclear lamina

finding: The SNP rs2681781 was categorized as an exonic SNP, exhibiting a synonymous mutation in the CAMKV gene. It was part of the 45 SNPs associated with 12 trait domains.
title: A global overview of pleiotropy and genetic architecture in complex traits

finding: The SNP rs2230590 was classified as an exonic SNP, showing a nonsynonymous change in the MST1R gene. Like rs2681781, it was part of the 45 SNPs associated with 12 trait domains.
title: A global overview of pleiotropy and genetic architecture in complex traits

finding: The non-coding variant rs1800734 was found to enhance DCLK3 expression through long-range interaction, promoting colorectal cancer progression. This finding related to the aggressive phenotypes observed in colorectal cancer and suggested that rs1800734 might have implications in KAT2A-dependent CRC.
title: The histone modifier KAT2A presents a selective target in a subset of well-differentiated microsatellite-stable colorectal cancers

finding: The Benign substitution Tyr2740Phe in DNAH12 indicated a conserved unstructured region relevant for a functional motif, which allowed this protein to be classified positively in the final analysis.
title: MotSASi: Functional Short Linear Motifs (SLiMs) prediction based on genomic single nucleotide variants and structural data

finding: The SNP rs2272522 was associated with schizophrenia in a study conducted in Qatar. This finding suggested a significant link between the polymorphism in the close homologue of the L1 gene and the manifestation of schizophrenia, highlighting potential genetic influences of L1CAMs in neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: The L1CAM SAX-7 is an antagonistic modulator of Erk Signaling

finding: The stop gain variant rs780671030 (p.Arg722X) in ALDH1L1 was associated with a mean decrease in serum glycine levels of 0.03 mmol/l, and is potentially linked to cardiometabolic disorders.
title: Exome sequencing identifies high-impact trait-associated alleles enriched in Finns

finding: The SNP rs13071580 was associated with dietary fat intake and liver cancer risk. In the context of a systematic review and meta-analysis, a significant positive correlation was established between increased dietary fats and elevated liver cancer risk, indicating that this SNP could be relevant in understanding the genetic predisposition to cancer in relation to dietary habits.
title: High-fat diet-induced obesity increases susceptibility to endogenous and ethyl carbamate-induced somatic mutagenesis

finding: The variant rs529711487 on chromosome 3 was identified as a rare SNP (minor allele frequency = 0.002) with a strong association to endocranial globularity, exhibiting a Beta estimate of 6.68 (SE = 1.15). Heterozygous carriers of this variant showed larger globularity scores compared to peers homozygous for the major allele, although there were no homozygous carriers in the cohort for further analysis.
title: Imaging genomics reveals genetic architecture of the globular human braincase

finding: SNP rs839254 was positively and originally found to be associated with higher dry matter (DM) content in yam tubers. The analysis revealed that homozygous accessions (AA) at this locus had a higher DM compared to AG and GG heterozygous or homozygous genotypes. This SNP was consistently identified in the genomic region on chromosome 9 across two study locations, Roujol and Godet, and was annotated as downstream of the gene Dioal.09G047900, encoding a Winged helix-turn-helix DNA-binding domain protein.
title: Detecting the genetic variants associated with key culinary traits in Dioscorea alata

finding: The SNP rs556874 was found within the fourth intron of the gene WNT5A and was part of a significant interaction network involving lung function and multiple pulmonary pathology measures in SSc patients.
title: Genetic interactions affect lung function in patients with systemic sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs1449292 was located in an intron of RBMS3 and was identified as part of the three-node subnetwork that influenced autoantibody status and lung function in SSc patients.
title: Genetic interactions affect lung function in patients with systemic sclerosis

finding: The locus rs2251219 was linked to several proteins in a pleiotropic manner, with shared genetic influence on various diseases and traits, indicating its role in multiple complex disease traits.
title: Human serum proteome profoundly overlaps with genetic signatures of disease

finding: The SNP rs13092060 was linked to the exacerbation of colorectal cancer (CRC) in a study that demonstrated the role of colibactin-producing <italic>E. coli</italic> in CRC development. The research indicated that this SNP is associated with a pathway influencing the adhesion of bacteria, particularly the FimH adhesin, which is essential for colibactin-mediated DNA damage to host epithelial cells, thereby driving the cancer initiation and progression.
title: Colibactin-induced genotoxicity and colorectal cancer exacerbation critically depends on adhesin-mediated epithelial binding

finding: The rs5186 polymorphism of the AGTR1 gene was associated with decreased estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) in patients with type 2 diabetes, suggesting its role in kidney function impairment.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs13061380 was identified as a significant marker in studies examining the interplay of genetic and phenotypic factors influencing glioblastoma. It was linked to the phenotypic plasticity that allows tumor cells to switch between migratory and proliferative states, which is crucial in understanding cancer evolution and treatment responses in glioblastoma patients.
title: Evolution of phenotypic plasticity leads to tumor heterogeneity with implications for therapy

finding: rs62273067 was linked to Acidaminococcus and validated in this study, consistent with earlier research.
title: Inter-determination of blood metabolite levels and gut microbiome supported by Mendelian randomization

finding: This SNP was associated with tumor grade (P=7.78×10⁻¹⁰).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Associated exclusively with tumor grade (P=1.54×10⁻³).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Rs348873 was associated with RP11-290F20.3 in FCGR3A+ monocytes, underscoring its significance in gene expression regulation within these immune cells.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The rs4857055 CL>LT polymorphism in EPHA6 was associated with hypertension through modulation of triglyceride and LDL particle size in a Korean population.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers associated with endometriosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs35124509 at locus 3p11.1 was associated with nine distinct FC connections primarily involved in semantic language processing. The minor allele was linked with increased connectivity among various regions in the left parieto-frontal-temporal lobes, underlining its relevance in language comprehension and semantics. Significant associations indicated its capacity to enhance semantic processing in language-related areas.
title: The genetic architecture of language functional connectivity

finding: The SNP rs1354034 exhibited heterogeneous quantile effects related to platelet width distribution. It was not detected in linear regression but showed a strong non-additive association, linked to increased expression of the ARHGEF3 gene, specifically in platelets. This SNP's interaction with age suggested a role in platelet activation variability, related to vascular diseases.
title: Quantile Regression for biomarkers in the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP was validated for its significant effects on beta cell transcriptional activity, consistent with earlier studies using luciferase reporter assays.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: This SNP was highlighted as a putative causal variant in T2D association signals due to its significant transcription-modulating effects identified by the MPRA.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: First nominated as a putative causal SNP in T2D due to significant MPRA activity effects observed.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: The intronic SNP in MECOM (rs10513664) was associated with methylation levels at mt-tRNA-G (position 9999) within heart tissue. MECOM's role as a transcription factor in stem cell maintenance linked it to significant health implications for haematological cancers.
title: Nuclear genetic regulation of human mitochondrial RNA modification

finding: The missense mutation in SLC25A26 (rs13874) was associated with mitochondrial-encoded tRNA methylation levels in whole blood. However, it was observed to be tissue-specific, not replicating in other tissues despite being a mitochondrial carrier for S-adenosylmethionine, a critical methyl group donor.
title: Nuclear genetic regulation of human mitochondrial RNA modification

finding: The SNP rs13081946 was associated with the role of macrophages in cancer development and therapy. The findings indicated that certain genetic variations could influence macrophage behavior, impacting tumor progression and response to immunotherapy.
title: Advancing CAR T-Cell Therapy: Simultaneously Attack Tumor and Immunosuppressive Cells in the Tumor Microenvironment

finding: The SNP rs13071727 was found to be associated with the effects on prostate cancer (PCa) cell viability related to OxPhos inhibitors and androgen signaling. Specifically, in studies by Sant’Anna-Silva et al. (2021), the presence of certain hormonal concentrations was noted to influence the cellular responses to OxPhos inhibitors, which emphasizes the relevance of this SNP in the context of prostate cancer treatment and cellular metabolism.
title: Oxidative Phosphorylation Inhibition in Different Prostate Cancer Models and the Interplay with Androgen Receptor Signaling

finding: The SNP rs13061380 was identified in a study that explored genetic and non-genetic mechanisms underlying cancer evolution. The findings indicated that this SNP was associated with variations in phenotypic outputs related to cancer cell plasticity. Specifically, the research highlighted how clonal cell populations harboring this SNP displayed distinct transcriptome states that contributed to their adaptive responses to environmental changes, reflecting the interplay between genetic predispositions and non-genetic information reservoirs.
title: Cytoplasmic lncRNAs nucleate signalling pathways to define metastable state dynamics and determine phenotypic output

finding: This SNP was associated with BMI and was validated in a trans-ethnic analysis, despite lower significance in the UKBB cohort.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The SNP rs6444469 was found to be associated with CSF-Ttau levels, achieving genome-wide significance (P = 1.61E-06). The findings were further supported by evidence of sex-specific differences in its association, with stronger effects observed in females.
title: Genome-wide association study of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarkers in the EMIF-AD Multimodal Biomarker Discovery dataset
